passages.name: if you move in.
passages.text:
You're not sure if you're ready to take this <<replace>>next step<<becomes>>leap off of the moutain top<<endreplace>>. You backpedal to get out of it.

"Oh, shoot, I remembered that Gwen offered me a place to stay."

"Who's Gwen?"

"She's got a twin brother. She's the Gwen who used to work at IBM. You know, Gwen Gwen, the greatest Gwen who ever Gwened." You down the rest of your latte.

Gwen's about as real as Jill.

"Oh, okay. Do you need a ride to her place? I drove my car here."

"Nope, I've got it! I'm taking the bus." You check your Mackie Moose watch. "Look at the time! I've got to get to Gwen's. She's having a chips and dip party. Bye, Sarai! Nice seeing you."

You [[hurry]] out the door.

passages.name: Run away
passages.text:
You run away. You hurry down stairs before they notice. It's like you're running on air. Your dress feels o good against your legs as you run. Alright! You're back on the dance floor, and you're bouncing up and down.<<set $ranaway = true>>

You grab onto someone random and spin around with him. He's so nice. He joins right in. Spinning messes up your clothes. The "someone" takes you by the hand and twirls you some more. You're a ballerina.

You don't think you're spinning anymore, but the room still is. That's okay, though. That's all cool with you. Everything's cool with you. You've got this boundless energy wrapped up inside of you that's waiting to burst out.

You scream the lyrics to your first single. You want to get these people dancing! They're moving, yeah, but they need to DANCE. Your dance instructor would have a field day with all of these rhythmless souls. They need help. You've got to help them.

[[SoMeOnE gRaBs YoU bY tHe WaIsT]]

links.text: SoMeOnE gRaBs YoU bY tHe WaIsT

destination.name: SoMeOnE gRaBs YoU bY tHe WaIsT

passages.name: feel happier and safer
passages.text:
"Does that extend to the rest of us?" Taya asks.

"It could help Sarai if we do this in solidarity. We have to get rid of all her temptations," Nayeli says.

"I don't want you guys to stop having fun on my account..." Sarai says. "I'll do better. I'll do anything."

"Anything?" Taya perks up at that. "Will you drop all of your rules?"

"I can't do that."

"I might [[have to walk]], then." Taya clicks her teeth.

passages.name: all grumbly
passages.text:
"This is what I need to become #1. I don't want to be 75 forever." You slide to the floor. The carpet's soft. You rub your hands all over it.

"No, you're a 10! A 12!" Taya yells at you. "You're not a 1."

Nayeli covers her face. "It's going to be hours until Sarai gets off from work. Why the fuck did she have to do overtime today of all days?"

"Jerri caught up fast. Cool." Taya joins you on the carpet.

"What possessed you to think this was a good idea?" Nayeli crouches near Taya. She holds her head to help her drink water. "Fucking open your mouth or I'm going to spill this all over you."

"You look like a baby!" Baby Taya with a Mommy Nayeli. This is [[gold]].

passages.name: one of us
passages.text: The bed's a tight fit, but it's all the better for it.\n\nYou don't want to be <<if $openmic>>[[anywhere else|mikael]]<<else>>[[anywhere else|nextscene]]<<endif>> in the world.

passages.name: Give Ashley Evans her phone back.
passages.text:
"I only debuted last month, but I'm already 93. Shannon tells me that's pretty good." Ashley Evans says once her phone's back in her hand. "I'm sure once you debut, you'll get way high up on the charts, even better than Cameo! She's one of ST Music's leading ladies, but we've got so many more people, like you, me, and all of the other Estrella Girls. We've got this."

Ashley Evans pulls up her Twitter page. "Ooh, looks like someone was a jerk to her this morning. She posted all about it. Someone knocked into her at that plaza that's near here."

"Wait a second, can you show me Cameo's picture real quick?" Something dawns on you. "Let me see her face... Yeah, that jerk was me. I ran into her by accident."

"Good thing she doesn't know your name or else you'd be in trouble," Ashley Evans laughs. "Looks like you've made yourself [[a new friend]]."

passages.name: steal your thunder
passages.text:
"Who're they setting you up with?" Nayeli tries her best to look like she doesn't care, but she fails miserably.

"Maybe a cool gay actress," Sarai suggests. "They should pair you up with the one that did that teen pregnancy movie."

"They're not setting me up with anyone. I'm with Taya." Saying that is enough to flip a switch in Nayeli and Sarai. Their body language changes. Nayeli's posture gets worse. Sarai tightly clasps her hands together.

Nayeli glares at you. "That's bullshit."

"They won't let you be poly?" Sarai asks.

"Gay's enough for them." You don't tell her that you [[didn't even mention it]].

passages.name: a new friend
passages.text: After finishing up with the rest of your day, you go straight home. You manage to avoid running into any more rival pop stars, and your bus doesn't get stuck anywhere, so you figure you're in for a night that's better than your morning.<><><><><><> The apartment's empty. You're not sure what to do with all of this silence. That might have been what drew you to music. Sarai and Nayeli's bedroom door is open. <>It feels like Nayeli's guitar is calling out to you. It looks lonely. Would she mind if you played it? Some people can get touchy about their instruments. Others couldn't care less. You're not sure where Nayeli falls along the spectrum.<><> But haven't some of your boundaries been lowered? Playing a guitar shouldn't be that big of a deal.<><>You peek inside. Well, more like you stick your head all the way inside and start looking around. You see an acoustic guitar and an empty keyboard stand. Their computer desk is full of an assortment of books and playing cards. Some of them look burnt. You're afraid to ask how that happened. You'd rather not see a demonstration. A dusty bag sits in the corner. A stethoscope and a strange-looking pair of scissors sticks out of it. Your eyes go back over to the guitar. It's got to be Nayeli's. Would she mind if you played it?<> * [[Play][$played_guitar = true]]. * [[Leave it alone]].

passages.name: Close your laptop
passages.text:
You sit on the couch, clutching a pillow in your lap. You're watching Jerri the pop star on TV. She's promoting her CD that's coming up. You mouth her words as she says them. The interviewer asks Jerri what it's like to be a role model for so many LGBTQA youth.

"LGBTQA, that's a mouthful! How many more letters do you need?" The interviewer guffaws. You're happy that Jerri doesn't let her disgust show on her face.

"The queer spectrum is wide and diverse. People are free to have their own identities." Jerri answers. "As for your other question, while I'm happy that so many people consider me to be a role model, I'm honestly just myself." She goes on to say something about inspiring hope, and wanting to be that person she always wanted to see in the media when she was growing up.

Shannon made you memorize that speech front and back. You've given that [[same answer]] a million times before.

passages.name: hating yourself
passages.text:
"Can you please come back to the apartment? It's cold outside and I don't have any money to pay for a place for us to stay." You think about your other options. "Shannon said I can't ever stay at her place again. Um, maybe we can try Ashley Evans' place? It's dicey on short notice, so we can't bank on that. The best thing for us is to go back, but if you don't want to we can walk around all night until the library opens. I've done that before."

"We? You won't go back alone?"

"You're my girlfriend. I'm not going back if you're not too." You hug her. As you let go, Nayeli pulls you back in and squeezes you tighter. She whispers thank you into your ear. "Sarai and Taya would do the same thing. We don't want you out in the streets. Come back. Stick around until tomorrow morning, then decide if you want to break up with us or not."

"I  don't want to."

You stand up and [[hold out your hand]] to help her up. "We should go home, then. C'mon, Nayeli."

passages.name: okok
passages.text:
"I picked you because you seemed like you'd enjoy it the most." And she's the best one on paper. If there were girlfriend superlatives, she'd be voted most likely to succeed. She's golden. She shines even when she's dressed "scuzzy" in her own words.

Smart. A go-getter. Unafraid. Has money. Has a future laid out ahead of her.

"And, honestly, I think you could handle this better than Sarai and Nayeli can," you admit.

"You've got that right." Taya smiles. "Have you told them yet?"

"I'll do it tonight."

"I'll go with you in case things get weird. I don't want them to take anything the wrong way."

"[[Thank you|hometime]]."

passages.name: Turn down the offer.
passages.text: "I can't do it. I'm sorry," you say.<<set $openmic_no = true>>\n\n"That's okay." She turns her head away so you [[can't see her]] disappointment. You don't have to. You can feel it.

passages.name: Now
passages.text:
"Now... If Sarai's okay with it."

"Yeah, just try not to be too loud," Sarai says. She gathers a pillow and a blanket for the couch.

"I'm good at being quiet." Nayeli replies.

"You're not the loud one."

"I'm not that loud." You feel like you have to defend yourself.

Sarai laughs on her way out of the bedroom. It's only you and Nayeli around. Oh, and the tension. It's weird how cool with everything Sarai is. Is it genuine or an act?

"I don't think I'd be able to sleep [[if I was]] Sarai," you say.

passages.name: Anything
passages.text: Nayeli laughs bitterly. "What if I don't like anything besides sex and music?"\n\n"Then you might as well embrace it or else you'll sped the rest of your time on this Earth miserable and [[hating yourself]]."

passages.name: give us off from work
passages.text:
"Nope, my bosses love their work too much to do that." Sarai pulls at the sleeves of her blazer. The only thing she's wearing that isn't black is her blouse, a royal purple color. Something about being with her when she's dressed professionally makes you feel powerful by association, even when you're in old jeans and even older sneakers. "How's Jill doing?"

There's no Jill at Jill's Sandwiches. The owner thought a woman's name would make the sandwich place seem more friendly. Even so, that doesn't stop you and Sarai from inventing stories about this made-up Jill woman.

"Well, someone offered to do a biopic on her life, but changed their mind at the last minute and replaced her with somebody named Alice."

"An Alice sandwich doesn't have the same ring to it."

"Nope. Jill sandwiches for life. Or maybe for another couple of days. My [[two week notice]] is almost up." You swallow down half of your drink.

"In a hurry to get home?" Sarai laughs.

There's [[the subject]] you were hoping to avoid.

passages.name: Don't promise
passages.text:
"I don't like making promises, sorry," you tell her.<<set $no_promise = true>>

"Same here," Taya says.

"I promise." Nayeli says.

"I understand." Sarai [[wipes her eyes|airtime]]. "Thank you."

passages.name: Tell Sarai and Taya to allow Nayeli her independence
passages.text:
"It's not fair for you guys to torture Nayeli like this. You have to let her have her independence," you stand up for her.

"Is it fair for her to keep torturing me? And lying about it?" Sarai says. "Nayeli can't be that uncomfortable, seeing how she accepts us feeding her and putting a roof over her head. Nayeli's got a cushy life but she insists on doing something that hurts me." She sigh. "The worst part is that you lied, Nayeli. You lied for so long."

"I'm sorry. I didn't know what else to do..."

"You could've talked to me," Sarai says.

"[[Same here]]," Taya says.

passages.name: Take the couch.
passages.text:
"I'm going to take the couch."

<<if $route_b>>"Again? You don't have to insist on being polite. You're welcome to the bed," Sarai says, frowning.<<set $backpain2 = true>>

"It's okay, really, I'm fine with it. I like the couch."

"Suit yourself. I'll grab you some blankets." Nayeli stretches. Sarai gives you a good night kiss, then walks off to get ready for bed. Once she's gone, Nayeli whispers to you that you're a bad liar. You don't justify that with a response.<<else>>"Okay. Nayeli, could you grab her some blankets from the other room? I'm going to go wash my face." Sarai gives you a good night kiss, then walks off to the bathroom.

Nayeli drops off your blankets. "You didn't pick the couch because of what happened last night, right?"

"No. I wanted to give you guys some privacy."

"Okay, cool. Have a nice night." She leaves you alone.<<endif>>

You [[fall asleep]] easily.

passages.name: too busy
passages.text:
You're on your way back with the drinks when you nearly run into a girl. <<if $willpower < 2>>You can't stop yourself from taking a few sips. The drinks are stronger than you thought. They go straight to your head since you're such a lightweight.<<endif>>

"Sorry! Wait, Ashley Evans?" It's her, dressed in a way you've never seen before. She fills out her tight dress nicely. Rather than the fresh-faced makeup she's usually in, she's wearing smoky eyeshadow and thick mascara. "What are you doing here?"

"Call me Ashley. I'm not working." Her usual Ashley Evans smile splits across her face. "I'm doing the same as you! Having fun. Is your girlfriend here?"

"Yeah, she's—" You can't say what she's actually doing. "She's [[dancing]], I think."

passages.name: a melody
passages.text: A few days later, you send Taya a text message. Recently, it's been harder to get a hold of her. Me: Where r u? T-Money: Just got out of class. Going to dorm. Why? Me: I'm at the lion statue. Your campus is big! Lost. T-Money: Wait there. [[Put down your phone and look up.]]

links.text: Put down your phone and look up.

destination.name: Put down your phone and look up.

passages.name: get a look
passages.text:
You take Taya in. Every curve. The shape of her breasts. Her cute belly. She bites her bottom lip, not at all shy with her eyes. "Dammit," she breathes out. "You're unfairly hot naked. Give me your work out plan."

You step forward to touch her, but she dodges you. "Behave! It's shower time." Taya hops into it. Laughing to yourself, you follow her right in. "Lean down. I wanna wash your hair."

She lathers the shampoo in, gently scratching your scalp as she does. Taya works it all through your hair, from the roots to the ends. You're so relaxed that you start humming. Being taken care of like this makes your heart swell.

Taya washes out the shampoo just as gently and to thank her, you kiss her, hard. Just as you feel her lips start to part, she catches herself and pushes on your stomach. "Stop, you're supposed to behave." She giggles, a little breathless.

"Sorry. Can I wash your hair?"

"Yeah," she says, [[getting lower]].

passages.name: hold out your hand
passages.text:
As you walk hand-in-hand back to the apartment, Nayeli asks you a question. "Would you ever want to perform with me at an open mic?"

"I'm not sure if I can. Estrella Entertainment has certain rules... I can't perform without their permission."

"You could go incognito. A wig, sunglasses, the whole bit." Nayeli suggests. "How about a masquerade mask?"

*[[Agree|michael][$openmic = true]].
*[[Turn down the offer.][$openmic_no = true]]

passages.name: Don't get coffee
passages.text:
You turn down the coffee. You don't want the caffeine to mess you up.

"You're going to love the name that I gave you guys," Taya says.

"I'll kill you if it's something bad." Nayeli says, glaring at her.

"Oh, it's certainly not a lie... [[You'll see|more than welcome]]!"

passages.name: Nope.
passages.text:
Taya's grateful to hear that. "Between you and me, Sarai used to have drinking problems,  like real bad. She went through a program and everything. She's over it now."

"Like a twelve-step program?"

"Yeah."

"I thought the point of those is to quit people to quit drinking. How did it work if she's still drinking?"

"Sarai rarely drinks. It's not like she's chugging bottles every single night." Taya's voice darkens. "Don't make this into a bigger deal than it is. If Sarai has a problem with anything, it's living in a la-la land. She's lucky—no, we're all lucky that you've been so on-board with everything. This...all of this...is a lot for any polynewbie to take. You got started off on [[hard mode]]."

passages.name: michael
passages.text: "Yeah," you squeeze her hand. "It'll be fun."\n\n"Good, good...that's really good." Nayeli turns away so you [[can't see her]] smile. You don't have to see it. You can feel it in the way that she swings her arm as she holds your hand.

passages.name: wait
passages.text:
You don't have to wait for long. The door opens slowly. Sarai emerges. She almost loses her footing.

"Didjoo see the news?" She slurs.

<<if $comments_no>>"I never look at the news."<<endif>><<if $comments_yes>>"No. What is it?"<<endif>>

"Look up your name," Sarai says.

Taya beats you to it. She holds it out for you to see. The search reveals article after article about the mysterious woman you were seen kissing.

"Guess whose girlfriend is an escort? A lying bitch of an escort!"

"No one's an escort. What the fuck?!" Taya exclaims. "Don't believe that tabloid shit."

You [[scroll]] through the list.

passages.name: your apartment
passages.text:
It's late enough that everyone should be home now, but all the lights are off. You check your phone for a voicemail from Sarai. She has to pick up a late shift at work on the boss' orders. They're preparing for a big event.

You heat up leftovers from the fridge and go to your room.

Yeah, the one with the wooden floor and no furniture. You take out your laptop. You might as well check out that Pickford Top 100 chart while you have a quiet moment to yourself.

Not having the wi-fi password foils that plan.

You [[hunt around]] the living room and kitchen for the router.

passages.name: Join in
passages.text:
You join in with them. After a while, Nayeli says something that makes you feel a smidgen bad. She says that she's only kissing you guys to keep you from doing anything worse. Oh well. You kiss them forever. Nayeli doesn't let Taya touch you under your shirt. She's being mean.<<set $booth = true>>

"I'm gonna be sick." Taya runs away without any warning. This means that she's mean too. She ruined the good time that you were having.

You feel hot. Your clothes are messy. Nayeli grabs your hand. She drags you along with her to find Taya. She's cursing up a storm. You like having your hand in hers. You feel safe. It's been so long since you've felt this safe and taken care of.

But you realize where you are—back on the dance floor and in public—so you wiggle your hand free of hers. You're [[alone]] again.

passages.name: less soft
passages.text:
"How's that make you feel?" Taya takes her shoes off to get more comfortable. You do the same, untying your shoes and tossing them away in no time at all.

"Happy. It means that my hard work's paying off."

There's a knock at the door. Room service. Taya gets the door. The waiter rolls in the cart. He's young, not that much older than you and Taya. You're a little jealous. This kind of gig beats being a sandwich worker by far. Of course, you're no longer a sandwich girl, but still. The past you would've been so jealous.

Smiling and wishing you both a good evening, he sets down your plates. Taya says the same back to him and [[shuts the door behind him]] when he goes.

passages.name: glass of ice
passages.text:
"As long as they don't cover up Jerri's voice with auto-tune, it'll be great," Nayeli says.

Sarai sucks down her drink like it's water. She makes a second one that's more bourbon than ginger ale and knocks that one back just as fast.

"Hey, not to be pushy, but...is there any way that we could all share the bed tonight? I could use a little extra comfort."

"Are you sure we shouldn't be worried?" You ask her.

"If Sarai says we shouldn't worry, then we shouldn't worry," Nayeli answers for her.

<<if $backpain or $backpain2>>You know you have no way out of this for the sake of your physical health. You're going to have to do something about getting your own [[furniture]].<<else>>"If you say [[so|furniture]]..."<<endif>>

passages.name: a big laugh
passages.text: "You're the one that's gonna be set for life. You're famous! I still can't believe Sarai picked you up. Did she win you over with one of her stupid card tricks?" Taya asks. "Yeah. She shot a card at me," you answer. "It wasn't stupid to me. It was cool." "She's got a weakness for musicians, and we've all got a weakness for playing cards." <>Taya must be the exception to that rule, considering what Nayeli said about her last night.<><>"Are you a musician too? What do you play? <><>You figure she can't be a singer, not with that voice. <><>Taya shakes her head and says that she's the exception to the rule.<> "How'd you [[meet Sarai]]?"

passages.name: getting lower
passages.text: You thread your fingers through her hair, careful to rub the shampoo all the way through it. You sing the notes of Rub-A-Dub-Dub, Three Men in a Tub to her as you do it. Recognizing it, she sings out the rest. "The butcher, the bakeeeerrrr, the candlestick—waugghh." Water runs into her mouth when you tilt her head the wrong way. She splutters it out. "Sorry. I was trying not to get any soap in your eyes." "You did that on purpose, you jerk." Taya stands up all the way and wipes the water off of her face. "Turn around. I'm gonna wash your back." You wonder if she's going to "wash" any of your other [[hard-to-reach]] places.

passages.name: starts writing something down
passages.text:
She hands it to you when you're done. "This is the address for Kitagawa's, the best sushi bar in this city. Take her there. It's low-lit, intimate, and you can have some privacy. Many Estrella Girls frequent it when they want to lay low for that reason."

"Thank you so much!"

"Order the sweet potato rolls." Shannon gestures towards the door. "This concludes our meeting. Good luck on your date, Jerri."

You swear that she smiles as you leave.

[[Success.]]

passages.name: wish Taya luck
passages.text: Taya goes off to get Nayeli while you talk with Sarai. She holds your hands. "Did you spill some coffee on yourself?" You've never seen her look less than impeccable. "Oh, yeah, it was one of those kinds of days. Good thing I wasn't wearing white or it would've been more embarassing." She says. "How was your day?" "Apparently I ran into Cameo without realizing it, I work with a bunch of low-key bitches, and I might've made a new friends. Her name's Ashley Evans. She joined a month ago." "Wait, you ran into Cameo? That Cameo?" "Yeah, the famous one. I don't know why she was walking around Estrella Headquarters. Weird. Either way, I kind of pissed her off so I'm hoping I never see her again." "I hope so too," Sarai kisses you on the [[forehead]].

passages.name: razor's edge silence
passages.text:
Sarai clears her throat. "Nayeli... If we do stay together, could you stop being a webcam model?"

You're not sure how well his line of questioning is going to turn out.

"I hate having hand-outs." Nayeli says.

"So you'd rather get them from men online?"

"It's different," she explains. "This is what I do for work. Even with the sites taking a cut of my earnings, it still beats making nothing. I can't live like that."

"While I admire you being independent with your hand-outs for handjobs, there's no reason for you to refuse our help. You're our girlfriend." Taya says. "Whatever money I have is yours too. And the money that I make in the future, if we're still together then, will be yours too. I don't see you as a fucking [[freeloader]]."

passages.name: 607N
passages.text:
Life's interesting when you have money. None of these people look like they have problems. As soon as something bad crops up, they can pour cash on the issue until it goes away. It's weird thinking that this kind of life is within reach for you too.

Your money won't be as unlimited as Taya's, but it's going to be there in heaps and piles. That's a perk of being a famous pop star. When your bank account gets low, you can make an appearance, or do something else for free food and goods. Wealthy companies will endorse you. That sort of thing happens for celebrities all the time.

You reach Room 607N. You slide in the card, it beeps twice, and you enter. There's one queen-sized bed. The sheets are so white that they look like they've never been touched by human hands. There are endtables with lamps on them on either side of the bed. The one on the right has a wired telephone.

The carpet's a mottled gray-blue color.

A large screen television sits on top of dark mohagony drawers. Then, there's a desk, a spinny chair, a view of the city skyline that's gorgeous at this time of night, and a thermostat for the in-room air conditioning.

There's a mini-fridge and an assortment of snacks and drinks on the counter resting on what you assume is some type of sensor machine. Maybe it counts the weight of the items and will ping when something's removed so it's automatically put on the bill?

Taya hangs the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the outside of the door, and then [[deadbolts]] you in.

passages.name: It's going to get hotter.
passages.text:
You enter the bathroom. Taya has her back to you as she strips off her clothes. You follow each article of clothing as it hits the tiles. Her shirt. Her socks. Her pants that she has to bend forward to get off. Her bra, snapped off and hurled behind her. It misses you. Her underwear that she steps out of...

She peeks over her shoulder, her arms crossed over her chest. "Are you coming in or are you just going to stand there?"

You hurry to remove your clothes. Soon, they all join her pile. You kick them off to the side so they don't accidentally get wet.

"Tell me if it gets too hot for you," she says.

"It won't be."

She finally turns around to [[get a look]] at you.

passages.name: be a freeloader
passages.text:
"You don't have to be one anymore. You can get out of my face." Sarai says.

"Once we leave, that's it. We're not coming back." Taya says.

"Don't let the door hit you on the way out."

As they go to the bedroom to get a bunch of their things, you try to talk Sarai down.

"Nayeli blew everything that I worked hard for. Is this my fault? I should've worked harder. I should've done better in school. Oh, a rich family. That would've solved everything." Sarai's off in her own space, tracing her problems. You try to hug her but she snaps at you, "don't touch me. You're a liar too."

Taya and Nayeli are ready to go. Taya asks you if you're coming with them.

*[[Go with them][$went_with_them = true]].
*[[Stay with Sarai][$stayed_with_first = true]].

passages.name: casual
passages.text:
You met her in the same [[bar]] where you were scouted. When she walked up to you, you were in the middle of packing up your [[guitar]] after playing a set of 90's pop hits for a group of drunks that kept yelling "free bird."

"Hey, I was watching your show and I was just wondering if you're doing any autographs." She brandished a deck. "I've only got these cards, sorry. Pick your favorite."

You signed your name in block letters on the Ace of Diamonds: JERRI BENAVIDES.

"Why that one?"

"It's got a lot of [[space]]."

passages.name: The neat desk on the yellow side.
passages.text: "I think your desk is that one," you point over to the desk on the yellow side.\n\n"You're right. Here's your prize." She [[kisses|feeling]] you.

passages.name: Ask her if she had a hand in it
passages.text:
"Did you have anything to do with it?" You ask her.

Ashley Evans puts her hand over her mouth. "I'd never do such a thing! I was a friend, not your competition. It's nasty of you to even think that."

"Okay." You don't want to bother fighting with her. You're done with everything Estrella-related. You just want to [[go home]].

passages.name: seeing someone else
passages.text:
"No," Nayeli sighs. "I fucking hate this name for it, but I'm a cam girl. This is how us people in the real world make our money."

"Isn't this illegal? Isn't this borderline prostitution?" You don't want her to get arrested over this.

"Who the fuck cares?" She waves off your concern. "I don't need your shitty judgment. You've got it so easy. A loving girlfriend. A roof over your head the moment things started to suck for you."

"That was all in the timing. It's not like I wasn't dating Sarai in the first place. I didn't go out with her expecting all of this."

"No, you didn't, but you got it. Everything gets handed to you."

"If anyone's being judgmental, it's you with that stick up your ass." The muscles in your arm [[tense up]]. "Who do you think you are coming at me like this?"

passages.name: we're dressed up
passages.text:
"Yeah..." You search your brain for a conversation topic. You settle for an easy one. "What led you to majoring in Finance & MIS? I would've thought you'd be into something more creative."

"I'm a logical person. Math is easy for me." She shrugs. "Honestly, I'm more into the job security aspect of it. It's not hard to major in both. It's something most kids at school do."

"Are you looking forward to being done soon? I couldn't wait to get out."

"Hm, not really. Office jobs suck and banks are banks."

You're not sure what she means by that [[bank comment]].

passages.name: waiting
passages.text:
The next day, you meet Shannon in her office in the afternoon after hours of working on your music video. You had trouble perfecting one of your turns. You may have to do more work at home.

<<if $tired>>"Do you know why I called you into my office, Jerri?" Shannon types something into her computer.

"Because I messed up today." You don't need her to tell you that.

"Yes, you did. You missed cues and you were off on your counts. It was so alarming that the music video director called me to ask me the same question I'm going to ask you: what's wrong with you?"

"I slept too late." You fight away a yawn.

"Was it because of your girlfriend?"

"No, it was [[someone else]]."<<else>>"Do you know why I called you into my office, Jerri?" Shannon types something into her computer.

"You wanted to congratulate me on a job well-done?"

"I called you here to talk about [[your image]]. It's been pretty much finalized."<<endif>>

passages.name: Take the bed with Sarai only.
passages.text:
"I'd like to take the bed with Sarai tonight, if that's okay..."

Nayeli nods in understanding. <<if $route_a>>"Makes sense. Good night, guys."<<endif>><<if $route_b>>"It's cool. Good night, guys."<<endif>>

...

This is your first night in bed with Sarai since officially declaring yourself her girlfriend. You spread yourself out on her sheets, searching for a difference in feeling. The cotton's cotton. The decor is what it is. Being with Sarai feels practically the same as always.

Isn't the G word supposed to be a bigger deal? Your stomach's supposed to flip. You're supposed to get weak in the knees. You're supposed to want to follow her around like a puppy dog.

The thing is, you already went through that relationship stage with her, before you became "[[official]]."

passages.name: Once a cheater
passages.text:
"I s-swear I didn't touch anyone else. No one touched me!" Nayeli pleads.

"She's telling the truth. It was all online," you stick up for her.

Sarai reels on you. "You knew about this?!" You brace yourself for whatever hit's about to come.

"It was my fault!" Taya calls out. "I was lonely at school, okay? I asked Nayeli to send me that stuff. Pictures, videos, all of it. I didn't want to tell you because I was embarrassed. I bet I was hacked, so...so leave her alone, Sarai."

*[[Tell Taya to stop lying]].
*[[Let the lie go]].

passages.name: freaky
passages.text:
"That's it. I'm calling Sarai. I'm gonna make her come get you. I can't do this all by myself." Nayeli takes out her phone and sits down sort of close to you but not really on the couch. Like, she's really on the couch, but she's not that close to you.

Taya gets in her lap. Nayeli's eyes get all wide. What's with everyone's eyes? Then they start making out and it's the best thing you've seen in your life. What could be better than watching two of your girlfriends make out with each other? This is so fascinating.

Ooh, maybe you should join in. Or! Or! Or you could run away and find someone fun, like Ashley Evans. You could hang out with Ashley Evans and like, do something other than make out with her because that's something you're only allowed to do with Sarai, Nayeli, and Taya.

*[[Run away]].
*[[Join in]].

passages.name: melancholy
passages.text:
<<if $company>>Things go back to relative normalcy for you at Estrella Entertainment. You're climbing in rank on the Pickford Toop 100 Chart. The last time you checked, you were somewhere in the 60s. Shannon tells you to keep doing what you're doing.

You've done well for yourself. You've got your own apartment. You keep it spotless, which is easy to do since you never have any guests. Your bed's too small for that.

You keep an empty room for practicing in. Sometimes you wonder what it would be like if someone moved into your spare room. I'd be easyYou'd clear out he closet, put a bigger bed in, and decorate it however they'd like. It'd be nice.<<else>>You fill up your days <<if $hotel>>working room service in a hotel<<else>>scooping ice cream<<endif>> and going back to your studio apartment. You've got enough money from your pop star life to float the place for another few months. You're saying goodbye that money one dollar at a time.

The money's easy to let go...it's the stage that isn't. Sometimes you catch yourself asking, "what if?"

You shake those thoughts away as fast as you can.

You're thinking of going back to school, but you're not sure where (somwhere cheap) and what major (something business or music-related, maybe both).<<endif>>

You find yourself walking outside, thinking of going somewhere to clear your head...

*[[Walking along the business district]].
*[[Walking to a coffee shop to hear live music|A coffee shop to hear live music]].
*[[Walking through a college campus]].
*[[Nevermind]].

links.text: Walking to a coffee shop to hear live music

destination.name: A coffee shop to hear live music

passages.name: shuts the door behind him
passages.text:
You spend the next hour eating and watching a secret agent movie together. The main character's partner turns out to be a spy for the enemy the whole time, which forces him to have to choose between his love and his duty. Duty wins. In the epilogue, he sits alone at his favorite bar, nursing a whiskey bottle and missing his dead boyfriend's piano playing.

Taya gets up and you instantly miss having her arm around you. You feel cozy with her in a way that's different from when you're alone with the others. You're not looking up at her, or looking at her from a distance.

"I'm gonna take a shower," she says "It's up to you if you want to save water and join me. How much of an environmentalist are you?"

*[[Join her]].
*[[Stay|hotely]].

passages.name: with a smile
passages.text:
"We should plan a date for this weekend," she says. "We can get to know each other better."

"That'd be fun. We definitely should."

<<if not $played_guitar>>"We should come up with some [[date night plans|continuation]], then."<<endif>><<if $played_guitar>>Nayeli bursts out of her room. The door opens so hard that it slams into the wall.

"Taya! What the fuck did I tell you about touching [[my guitar|oops]]?!"<<endif>>

passages.name: two week notice
passages.text: No more greasy sandwich shop working for you. You're glad to [[leave that life behind|give us off from work]].

passages.name: No, we're not
passages.text:
"We're not giving up," you say. "We're...trying to work things out."

"Try saying that like you mean it." Nayeli looks directly at you.

"I don't know where to go from here."

"That's okay as long as you're still trying."

Taya says, "if we're not going to talk about anything new, then I'm going to go. I've got things to do. Sarai's already volunteered to break up with us. This is pretty much settled, right?"

"You're completely rewriting history," Sarai says.

"What was your speech about earlier then? You're getting cold feet?"

"You make it sound like you [[want me to break up]] with you."

passages.name: alone
passages.text:
"We can't make it look like you're dating me," you tell her.

"I am dating you."

"No, I'm dating Taya. That's it. Everyone's supposed to think I'm with her and that's it." Even though you say that, you pull Nayeli in for a kiss anyway. You think it's emotional. Or would passionate be a better thing to call it? "I wish you took a pill too. I want you to feel this good."

You don't know how she reacts to that. She drags you to the bathroom and puts your head in the sink. Nayeli runs water over you.

Taya pops out of one of the stalls. She yells "surprise" and it's the best surprise ever. She calls you a drowned rat. You splash water on her so she looks like one too.

The party ends when Nayeli takes you both by the hands and walks you out of the club. She doesn't say anything or laugh at any of your jokes.

She's a hero for [[getting you home|in the toilet]] and in bed.

passages.name: sing
passages.text:
When the glitter fades, you're back to reality, away from the photoshoots and meetings that have marked the beginning of your career with [[Estrella Entertainment]].

One of their agents recently scouted you. It's been so recent that you haven't gotten any payments yet. They've [[taken more money]] from you than you've given to them.

It'll swing back the other way, though, and you'll be able to live on more than your abysmal sandwich shop salary. [[Some day]]...

passages.name: tense up
passages.text:
"Whatever," Nayeli stands up. "I don't have time for your shit."

"Nothing's going to change between us if you're going to keep saying 'whatever' like that. I thought we were actually getting somewhere, and then you pull something like this." <<if $kissed_n>>You think back to that kiss you shared. Did it not matter to her at all?<<endif>><<if $starry2>>Did the other night not matter at all?<<endif>>

You feel like you have to say this. "Should I even bother anymore or is this all a waste of our time?"

A few emotions pass by quickly on her face. She settles for neutrality, and holds her hand out for you to take. "Here. Don't worry, I washed up."

*[[Take her hand]].
*[[Get up without her help]].

passages.name: Success.
passages.text:
"You know what's funny? Helping my girlfriend get ready for a date with my other girlfriend."

"Funny in a bad way?" You hold up a dress to your body, checking yourself out in the mirror.

"Not at all. I like it."

You're in a store with Sarai. You trust her tastes, so you enlisted her help. She doesn't look too thrilled with your latest dress. You put it back on the rack to get another.

The struggle is striking a balance between effortless and trying-because-you're-worth-it. You want to be casually flawless, like you're not [[too much of one thing or the other]].

links.text: too much of one thing or the other

destination.name: too much of one thing or the other

passages.name: search
passages.text: JNFan posted 11 days ago, "I was getting gelato with my friends and guess who I spotted? JERRI AND TAYA!!!! I took pictures." Pinky posted 11 days ago, "Did you get an autograph?" JNFan posted 11 days ago, "I got pictures with them and they signed my shoes." nerdygirl14 posted 11 days ago, "pix or it didnt happen" rahul_cookie posted 11 days ago, "THE PICTURES ARE IN THE LINKS" estrellaisbestrella posted 10 days ago, "@nerdygirl14: Please stay on topic. If you post something like that again, nerdygirl14, I'm going to report you to the moderators. @JNFan: I'm so jealous! You're so lucky. I've gotten pictures with a few Estrella Girls before, but I haven't gotten a chance to meet Jerri and Taya yet." twist_of_fate posted 9 days ago, "ive got all her songs on repat. her music videos are great. i love jerri. i cant wait for her next video to come out. i think there are leaked singles out there. i'm going to look for them." JNFan posted 9 days ago, "Are you going to the Estrella Girl fan meet and greet? I bet you that Jerri and Taya are the secret guests. It's this weekend!!" estrellaisbestrella posted 9 days ago "I'll be there. I'm going to wear an Ashley Evans shirt and my Miya K hat. Team Estrella all the way!" JNFan posted 8 days ago, "I love Jessica Nash and Simon-Timmons Music but I think I'm converting over to Team Jerri... Uh oh!" The rest of the thread becomes irrelevant. [[Do one last search.|Finish searching.]]

passages.name: Back off.
passages.text:
You shift back over to your side of the bed. You hear Nayeli turn in possible confusion.<<set $starry = "no">>

"Sorry, I remembered that I have practice tomorrow and it's getting late." You punctuate your words with a light and airy laugh to let her know that nothing's wrong. "Good night!"

She's quiet at first. "Okay. I've gotta go to the bathroom. Good night."

Nayeli closes the door carefully when she leaves. You wonder if you let her and Sarai down somehow. These worries make it hard for you to fall sleep, but [[eventually you do|SleepA]].

passages.name: StoryAuthor
passages.text: kaleidofish

passages.name: hunt around
passages.text: Since it's nowhere to be found, that means it has to be in Sarai and Nayeli's bedroom. You knock on the door. No answer. Nayeli must be out somewhere, maybe with friends or at a concert or something. You don't know what she does with her personal life outside of the quadship. She could be anywhere, doing anything.\n\nOr she could be doing what you [[catch her doing]] when you open her unlocked door...

passages.name: be a laugh
passages.text:
<<if $stayed_first>>You're still with Sarai. She's been practicing new card flourishes to occupy her time with. You don't see why she has to. She's already captured you with a simple card trick. Sometimes, simplicity is all you need.

You've become her sous chef in the kitchen, chopping up vegetables for her. You haven't cut your hand yet so that's a plus.

[[Things with her are great.|nayeliend]]<<else>>You don't see much of Sarai these days. You grab lunch with her here and there, but that's about it. She's trying to convince you to take up cardistry with her. Yu don't see why a master has o spend ime with a beginner. Maye she's jut looking for an excuse to spend time with you...

In that case, that's [[not so bad|nayeliend]].<<endif>>

passages.name: Teenage girls
passages.text:
"What am I supposed to do?"

"We have to figure out what we'll do for damage control. This is bad all around. This could cost you your career." Shannon says. "This is bound to come up at the press conference. Our publicist will train you on what we need you to say. We need this scandal to die fast."

<<if $noconference>>"I can't go to the press conference."

"You have to. It's your career on the line."

"Could I do another one? One that's more specifically focused on this issue. I'll be more ready then." You pray that she'll accept that reasoning.

She does. "Alright. That will give our publicist more time to train you."<<else>>"Okay." What more is there for you to say?<<endif>>

Your meeting reaches its conclusion. Shannon <<if $comments_yes>>[[dismisses|comments]]<<else>>[[dismisses|phonecall]]<<endif>> you.

passages.name: hotely
passages.text:
"I think I'm gonna stay in bed for a bit. I'll see you when you're done," you say. Taya tells you to suit yourself, and skips off to the shower.

You surf the channels for something else to watch. You find a reality show about college a capella groups and settle for that. Sometime during it, you fall asleep. You wake up briefly later that night. Taya's in bed with you, her arm draped over your body. She's snoring softly.

You go back to sleep, [[content|nextscene]].

passages.name: Some day
passages.text: And you hope that some day comes soon, because you got kicked out of your most recent place of residence. To call it that is being generous—it was a dingy couch in a former lover's basement.\n\nWhen you couldn't keep up the rent, she tossed you out with the [[couch]].

passages.name: get any worse
passages.text: It gets worse. You find out how much worse it gets when you [[return home]] that night.

passages.name: Don't. Just go to sleep.
passages.text: You decide not to do anything more than that, and gently [[fall asleep]] in her arms.

passages.name: confidence
passages.text:
"Hi, I'm Nayeli. I'm doing a cover of a song by one of my favorite up and coming singers. I hope you like it."

She opens up with playing a bunch of chords back and forth. You recognize the rhythm instantly. That's...your song. It's an acoustic, melancholic version of your upbeat song.

Nayeli sings it with such sorrow that you almost forget that it's a song about dancing and having the best day ever with your friends because everybody else sucks. She makes it sound so bitter and jealous.

You put your head [[down on the table]] until it's over.

passages.name: pleasework
passages.text:
"She's not a celebrity. She's a pop star," Nayeli says. "She'll be a one hit wonder if she's lucky."

It takes a great amount of willpower for you not to snap at her.

"Let's get on with [[the rules|groundrules]] already, shall we?" Sarai asks.

passages.name: next
passages.text:
"Sorry about today in general," Nayeli tells you once you're lying in bed. <<if $played_guitar>>"I didn't mean to freak out so much over the guitar. It's just that the last time Taya handled something of mine, she broke it."

That has to be the reason why the keyboard stand's empty.

"Taya's got the money to replace it, but I don't want her to. I don't want to keep hearing her nagging at me about what she owns and all that. It's annoying," she continues.<<else>>"At least you got a preview of what it's like to be with all three of us. Some of us are harder to be with than others." She coughs Taya's name into her palm.<<endif>>

"Speaking of Taya..." Time for some reconnaissance. "Can you tell me something about her? I need to figure out a good place to take her on a date."

"No way, that's unfair. You're going to play the dating game [[like everyone else]]."

passages.name: follow suit
passages.text: "I'm the one who's sorry. I should've laid down the ground rules better." Sarai says. You don't know whose fault this all is. "Here, I'll [[start doing it now|groundrules]]."

passages.name: fall asleep
passages.text:
On your way to the HQ, you see someone that looks vaguely like your mother.

You know for a fact it's not her. She isn't even in this state.

You think back to the last time you saw her face and the [[burning disappointment]] in her eyes.

passages.name: Avoid the kiss
passages.text:
You turn away. You cringe as you say, "I can't risk doing any PDA right now. Sorry."<<set $avoid_3>>

"Even though you're a no-name singer?"

"I won't be one forever. It's better for us to get used to this early on."

"...That's some bullshit, but whatever." Taya sighs. 

"It's not like I didn't want to. It's work."

"At least you know how to let a girl down easy." She starts [[walking]].

passages.name: saraichoice
passages.text:
<<set $stayed_first = true>>"I'm staying with Sarai. I have to break up with you, Taya." It's hard for you to say but you manage it.

"What the fuck?"

"It's the best thing for the both of us."

"Don't give me that bullshit," she seethes. <<if $stayed_second>>"So you think I was the problem all along? The three of you are just going to go off into the sunset together?"<<endif>><<if $single_second>>

"It's not the three of us. I broke up with Sarai," Nayeli corrects her.<<endif>>

You don't know what to say to her. "I'm sorry?"

"Save it. I don't want to hear it," Taya [[says|endmoment]].

passages.name: phone
passages.text:
It's a latest-of-the-line phone, sleek and professional-looking. You whistle when you see it. This is the sort of thing that people camp out overnight for. Ashley Evans sees the envy in your eyes and giggles.

"This is company-provided. Once you're in the Top 100, I'm sure Shannon will get you one. It's a lot of responsibility, though." She frowns as she sticks a fork into a chunk of chicken. "We're supposed to stay connected to our social media accounts 24/7. All of our statuses have to make us look good in some way or be relatable. Oh, and they gotta fit our image, like Ashley Evans the performer could never tweet about a monster truck show even if Ashley the person thinks they're cool. We're separate people."

"That sounds like more trouble than its worth." All that to get a super phone? It's too much. You pick up some noodles with your chopsticks and bring them to your mouth. They're surprisingly not bad.

"I bet you a hundred dollars that [[girls like Cameo]] have interns taking care of their accounts."

passages.name: all things considered
passages.text:
"What about the rest of us?" Taya asks. "We might as well cut to the chase about this now that Nayeli has. What do you want to do, Jerri?"

*[[Stay with both Sarai and Taya][$stayed_first_third = true]].
*[[Stay with Sarai and not Taya|saraichoice][$stayed_first = true]].
*[[Stay with Taya and not Sarai|tayachoice][$stayed_third = true]].

links.text: Stay with both Sarai and Taya

destination.name: Stay with both Sarai and Taya

links.text: Stay with Sarai and not Taya
Stay with Taya and not Sarai

passages.name: that shit to work
passages.text:
"See, this is why we should've talked over the rules together." Sarai scratches the back of her neck. "It'd make the boundaries clearer and nothing would've gotten confused."

"I'm sorry...I didn't mean to say that." You say. "I didn't mean anything by it."

"Sure you didn't." Taya grins.

"Stop it," Nayeli chides her.

"These rules aren't a punishment. They're just a necessity. Let's move on with [[talking about them|groundrules]], shall we?"

passages.name: hurry
passages.text:
Hours later, you're sitting outside, swiping through an app to find a place with a warm bed. The prospects aren't looking good. Too many pictures of women with high-angle photos, group shots, and so much blurriness you can't distinguish their eyes from their forehead.

Maybe you'll have better luck at a bar... They won't try to card you as long as you don't order any alcohol.

The only ones nearby will close at 3 AM so that gives you a couple hours to [[find somebody, anybody]].

passages.name: Agree
passages.text: You laugh in agreement. "A babypolydyke? It's silly, but [[sure]]."

passages.name: she wants us to
passages.text:
"I dunno. She did this same thing when she brought Taya into the group. She left us alone in bed together, and, yeah," Nayeli muses. "She likes it when her girlfriends bond fast so it's possible."

That's an interesting way to break the ice...
but also something you're not sure you're up for.

It's different when it happens naturally for fun...
this is more like a performance and you're not so sure you can give a good one.

Not that you'd fake anything with Nayeli...
but your nerves are shot even though you're interested.

And if you did do this, Sarai would approve...
and maybe your relationship with Nayeli would improve.

There's drawbacks...
and there's [[benefits]].

passages.name: nayeliend
passages.text:
<<if $stayed_second>>Nayeli's out and about playing music more regularly. You support her at every show you can get to, the one person in the back clapping enthusiastically every time even if you're just at a grungy house show. <<if $company>>You do it while disguised, of course. You can't have Estrella Entertainment catch you with her in any way. You've worked too hard to lose it again.<<endif>>

You work on songs together. <<if not $company>>You've thought about joining her on stage, but it brings back too many weird memories for you.<<endif>> <<if $openmic and not $company>>The world will have to wait longer for anoher Pussy Lovers Anonymous reunion.<<endif>>

She's enrolled to start school next fall. She figures if her music takes off again, she'll pursue that...but for now, Nursing can be her back-up plan.

You've got to admit it...Nayeli looks [[cute in her scrubs|tayaend]]. You're proud of her. She's making it in the world.<<else>>You keep in touch with Nayeli, sometimes meeting up with her to talk about music together. It's rare to find someone on the same wavelength with you like that, so you cherish your friendship.

She's enrolled in school for the fall. She's picking up where she last left off in her Nursing degree. You wish her the best of luck.

Singing certain songs together makes you long for the past...songs about love or mistakes you've made in losing that love. It doesn't help that you've gotten so into the music that you've wound up kissing her more than a few times.

But that's all in the performance, isn't it? That's what Nayeli says. It's the music, [[and nothing more|tayaend]].<<endif>>

passages.name: being late
passages.text: <<if $backpain>>During dance practice, you have trouble with the movements. Your back tightens up on you. The springs in the couch must've done a number on your back.<<endif>><<if $starry>>During dance practice, you miss your cues. The instructor isn't happy about that. He asks you to come back down to Earth and get out of La La Land.<<endif>><<if $backpain or $starry>>\n\n<<endif>>Dance practice leaves you feeling tired and drained by the end of it. You work out muscles you didn't think you owned. You feel like you've been stretched to new heights and new lows. Apparently, the burn in your body tells you that this is working, so you'll have to get used to [[the sensation]].

20. Rylie Million 19. Luka 18. Avery D 17. Carey Marie 16. Rhiannon 15. Karli 14. QueenB 13. Meeko 12. Elodie Ayres 10. Athena Lauryn 9. Luciana Adams 8. Lilou 7. Saanvi 6. Melanie Avarice 5. Jimena 4. May Westward 3. Angel Parks 2. Heloise 1. Litany [[38-21|38-11]] >> 20-1 [[Give Ashley Evans her phone back.]]

links.text: Give Ashley Evans her phone back.

destination.name: Give Ashley Evans her phone back.

passages.name: hometime
passages.text:
You go home with Taya to find Sarai lounging out on the couch, eating cereal. She calls out to Nayeli that you're back, then gets up to hug you both at once. As soon as she lets go, Nayeli's arms are around Taya to squeeze her tight.

"It feels like it's been forever since I last saw you," she says to her.

"School sucks. Stay away from it."

"It's not like I want to," Nayeli grumbles.

"Are you staying over?" Sarai asks her, her tone hopeful.

"Yeah! I think I've got some pajamas here."

"Or you can borrow some of mine," you say. You wonder how all four of you are going to fit on the bed. There's [[too many limbs]].

passages.name: What's up
passages.text:
"Just because we're not all having sex doesn't mean we're unhappy," Sarai says. She puts her arm around you.

"But we're poly. Isn't this something that poly people do?"

"It doesn't have to be. It's not like your poly badge is going to get revoked because you're not having orgies." Nayeli sounds more awake. "People in polyships don't have to all see each other, either. It just worked out for us that way."

"Okay...then why haven't we done it again, if you guys are happy?"

Sarai says, "I didn't want it to turn into a given. I wasn't in the best state of mind the first time." As Sarai talks, Nayeli's hand goes under your shirt to rub your stomach. You can tell its hers by the ring she's wearing. "I wouldn't hate it if it was a given, don't get me wrong. I just didn't want to put you under that kind of [[pressure]]."

passages.name: put up with it
passages.text:
"How did you feel about everything, Jerri?" Nayeli asks.

"It feels like we're all about to say goodbye." You dodge her question.

"It doesn't have to be that way," Nayeli says. "But, really, how did you feel? Happy? Sad? Angry?"

"That depends on how this ends."

"I don't get why you're refusing to answer me."

"Don't put her on the spot like that," Sarai says. "Jerri could be right. This could be us saying [[goodbye to ourselves the way we are now]]."

links.text: goodbye to ourselves the way we are now

destination.name: goodbye to ourselves the way we are now

passages.name: Take her hand
passages.text: She helps you up and doesn't let go of your hand as she leads you to [[her bedroom]].

passages.name: not going to work out
passages.text:
"That might be for the best," you say. "Your needs and wants are at odds with each other's."

"I understand. I went into this conversation expecting us all to break up so I'm okay with his. I've reached an understanding," Sarai says, not looking at anyone in particular.

"It's shitty that you're blowing this out of proportion, Nayeli." Taya says.

"Everyone weighs things differently," you explain to her.

"Yes," Nayei says. "Yes, and that's why I don't think I can be with you, either, Taya. There's too many things we don't see eye-to-eye on."

"If that's [[the way it has to be]]..." Taya sighs.

links.text: the way it has to be

destination.name: the way it has to be

passages.name: it hits the ground
passages.text:
"What are you studying?" So far, Taya's much more conversational than Nayeli. You're thankful for that. "Sarai mentioned something like business or computers?"

"A bit of both. I study Finance and Management Information Systems. I might drop Finance, though. That's more of a back-up plan." You wouldn't have pictured her studying either one of those, let alone both.

"Information Systems? Is that like IT?"

"I guess you could say that...on a corporate level." Taya shrugs. "My parents work in those fields."

"Sounds like you're gonna be set for life."

Taya lets out [[a big laugh]].

passages.name: gotten yourself into
passages.text:
You meet Taya for coffee on your day off. School's been wearing her down, so you grab time with her whenever you can. You're in a coffee shop close to her campus, sipping a fizzy lavender lemonade drink.

"So, let me get this straight... Estrella Entertainment wants to turn you into a gay icon. The world's gayness rests on your shoulders."

"It beats the alternative."

"What's that?"

"Not having a career at all. This is important to me. It's everything."

"Well, you said something about needing my help. What am I supposed to do, give you foot massages or something?"

"I'd like you to [[be my girlfriend]]."

passages.name: can't see her
passages.text:
You walk into the apartment. Nayeli trails in after you. Her boots are heavy on the floor. She drops her backpack full of clothes by the door. It's dark. You would've thought that Taya and Sarai left if you didn't hear someone softly hiccuping on the couch.

"Sarai?" You ask.

"It's me," Taya answers. Her voice is hoarse. "You can turn on the light." You do so. Her eyes are puffy and red. "You came back?"

"Yeah," Nayeli says.

"Get the fuck over here."

Nayeli joins Taya on the couch and gives her a tight hug. You knock on the bedroom door. Sarai opens it a crack. "I got her back," you tell her, and that's enough for her to rush out and embrace Nayeli too. She sobs for a different reason now.

"Big baby," Taya teases.

"You were crying too!"

"Let's all get ready for bed," Nayeli says. "I think we could all use some cuddling."

"Who are you and what did you do with my Nayeli?" Taya asks.

"Shut up."

Looks like they're [[back to normal]].

passages.name: hard mode
passages.text:
"It's not so bad. I like it. The hardest thing in my life right now is my career."

Your work schedule's getting more demanding. Your legs are half-dead every time you exit the studio. There are some days you get to work and feel like you can't do it—that you're some kind of fraud only playing at being a performer, but you push through those feelings and do it anyway. There are nights when you hide your face under your pillow and cry from the things your coaches have screamed at you, or from Shannon's nitpicking. <<if $comments_yes>>You've read awful things about yourself online, about how much you suck or should die.<<endif>> You get up the next morning anyway, because you love what you do.

"How about a private concert?" Taya lounges back on the pile of pillows and folds her arms behind her head. "I'm bored and got nothing better to do, so... Sing or whatever."

"Were you channeling Nayeli?"

"Maybe. What, are you going to [[punish]] me for it?"

passages.name: Same here
passages.text:
"It's funny," Nayeli laughs bitterly. "It's funny how the most 'sex positive' people are actually the least. You guys don't give a shit about sex workers. You're only 'sex positive' when it's on your terms."

"Being sex positive has nothing to do with this," Sarai argues.

"Pretty sure sex positive doesn't mean you're clapping for your girlfriend when she's fucking herelf on camera for some dude," Taya says.

Nayeli glares at her. "How polyamorous are you if something like that makes you jealous? You call Sarai pathetic for wanting to set boundaries, but here you are, just as upset as her [[over a webcam]]."

passages.name: okdecision
passages.text:
"What about us? Where do you and I stand, Jerri?"

Is this going to be it for you and Nayeli?

*[[Stay with Nayeli][$stayed_second = true]].
*[[Break up with Nayeli]].

passages.name: make your way back
passages.text:
"Where's Nayeli?" You say into Taya's ear. She grabs her drink from you and gulps it down. It took you longer to walk over than it does for her to finish it.

"She had to go to the bathroom. Hey, do you want something sweet? A mint?"

"What are you talking about?"

"It's more like chalk. I dunno. Don't ask me. You wanna have fun tonight, right?" Taya grins. "Then let's do something real fun. This is something you swallow and don't chew. Kiss me if you want it. It'll make you happy."

You kiss her without thinking about it. She passes you a tablet through the kiss. You swallow it down, avoiding it with your teeth. Taya pokes you in the stomach.

"You know that wasn't a mint at all, right? You know all about what it is, yeah? Not a mint. Not a sweet. None of the above! Oh, but it makes you soooo happy, Jerri."

You grip her by the arm with your free hand and [[tell her to calm down]].

passages.name: something about your closet
passages.text:
"My closet doesn't matter... I'm more worried about how we're going to perform."

Sarai says, "this is a smalltime gig for you. You have nothing to worry about."

"This is how I got started. It's like going back to my roots."

"If you think you're nervous, you should check out how Nayeli's doing." Taya laughs. "She's pacing around in circles singing about how her mommy made her mash her M&Ms."

That's what she's singing? Wow, you haven't sung that one since choir class. You smile.

"That's a vocal warm-up. Your vocal cords are muscles too. You have to warm them before you use them or else you can damage them," you explain. "I'm going to check on her. You guys keep looking for an outfit."

"[[On it]]!" Sarai says.

passages.name: Walking along the business district
passages.text:
If you did that...

If you took that walk...

You'd take a stroll along your city's business district, admiring the streams of people going by. They'd hurry along in their suits and ties while you leisurely sight-see. <<if $company>>You'd make sure to wear a cap pulled low so no one can recognize you.<<endif>>

And when you'd get tired—because you know you will—you'll sit down on a bench to take a break

That's when a well-dressed woman will come over to you and ask you for the time. There'll be a playing card sticking out her pocket.

And when you look up at her, you'll both buzz with familiarity...

...[[and you'll smile.|theend]]

passages.name: Explain yourself
passages.text:
"I wasn't cheating," you start with that. "My girlfriend knows about it."

"Are you in an open relationship?"

"It isn't like that. We're more exclusive and selective than that." You fight down the urge to throw up.

"An open relationship doesn't work for your image. You're supposed to be wholesome," Shannon says. "Whatever it is that you're doing in your private life isn't going to be reflected in her public one. The one radical thing about you is that you're a lesbian. You're pure other than that."

You flinch like you've been slapped.

Shannon continues, "your sales figures could be burning as we speak, all because you made yourself look like you're two-timing. Do you remember who your main audience is? [[Teenage girls]]."

passages.name: want me to break up
passages.text:
"Things would've turned out much differently if you hadn't gotten greedy, if you'd been happy with the way things were," Taya says. <<if $avoid_3>>"The same might go for me. I could've been happy as a girl with a girlfriend who couldn't kis her in public. Jerri, is that the real reason you picked me to be your paraded-around girlfriend? Was it because I got so upset?"

"That's not why. I've told you so many times why I picked you."

"Sure..."<<endif>>

"We could go in circles blaming each other forever." You say. "You might as well blame my career for putting a strain on everything. What if I never sang?"

"Don't do that," Sarai says. "I'd rather this be [[my fault]] than anyone else's."

passages.name: phonecall
passages.text:
Were your parents right all along?

Everything changes so fast in this industry.

One day you're on top and the next you're on the bottom.

Singing's one thing, but all of this on top of it...

It's <<if $yesconference>>[[unbearable|can't read]]<<else>>[[unbearable|tayaroom]]<<endif>>.

passages.name: in the toilet
passages.text:
You feel like absolute shit the next day. Your head's pounding. You haven't left the bed. The room shakes too much when you do, and you'd rather not put yourself through another marathon puking session.

Sarai lays a wash cloth over your forehead, as if that'll lessen your headache. She smooths down your hair. "You're crashing."

"It's like five trains have run over me." You shudder. "Where is everyone?"

"Nayeli's watching over Taya on the couch. We had to separate you guys since Taya's still throwing up." Sarai says. "Taya's probably in better hands since Nayeli was [[studying to be a nurse]] for a while."

passages.name: Stay with her
passages.text: "I want to stay with you, Nayeli," you tell her.<<set $stayed_second>>\n\nNayeli looks thrilled. Worn-out, but thrilled, [[all things considered]].

passages.name: SoMeOnE gRaBs YoU bY tHe WaIsT
passages.text:
It's Nayeli. No reason to be so AlArMeD.

"We're going the fuck home," she says into your ear. You put your hands on her cheeks and give her a big kiss. Nayeli's so pretty and so nice.

"Where's Taya?"

"Forget about her. She got herself into this mess and she can get herself out of it."

The rest of the night fades away for you. You somehow get home on the train with Nayeli and once you're there, you waste no time in sticking your head [[in the toilet]] to vomit.

passages.name: yeahsarai
passages.text:
"I'm going to stay with you, Sarai," you tell her.

"Me too," Nayeli says.

Sarai [[thanks you both|nextdecision]].

passages.name: starstuff
passages.text:
"Did you know how Sarai would react before we had sex?"

"What? I didn't know jack shit about how she'd react." Nayeli sits up. "It was a shitty thing for us to do and I wasn't thinking clearly. ...Not that I regret it," she clarifies, "but I didn't want to hurt Sarai."

She swings her legs over the side of the bed. "I don't want to hurt her again, so I'm gonna remove any temptations for us an sleep on the floor."

"Hurt her? I thought we were all separate relationships now. You don't have to sleep on the floor. We can do whatever we want."

"I know. I know that...and I know that if Sarai hated it that much, she would've put me on the couch. You wouldn't have had a choice on where to sleep."

"Does that mean the option's on the table?" Your mouth moves faster than your brain.

"Do you want it to be?"

*[[Yes|stuffing]].
*[[No|nostuffing]].

passages.name: Take the middle.
passages.text:
You take the middle.

...

Being in the middle is a lot hotter than you expected, and not hot in a good way. Sarai has her arm across your stomach, almost like you're being guarded. Nayeli has her back to you, maybe looking for a colder spot on the bed or because she'd rather look away from you even in the darkness.

It takes a while, but you do manage to [[fall asleep]].

passages.name: Thank you
passages.text:
"I can't come over tonight. I've got some stuff to take care of," she says. "I'll see you around?"

"That's okay. See you later, Taya."

You hug her goodbye and then walk [[your separate ways]].

passages.name: next time
passages.text:
You tell yourself that there won't be a next time.

You take Sarai up on her offer.

Her apartment has two bedrooms. You have yours to yourself.

Your bedroom's empty, save for a poster of some Asian calligraphy arranged in the shape of a tree. Her roommate took all her furniture with her when she left. The closest thing you have to a bed is a wooden floor and a pile of blankets.

The rest of the apartment is clean, but that may be a result of there not being many things in it. The couch is long enough for several people to sit on it. The legs look like they've been clawed or chewed, maybe both. It faces a TV with the latest video game console hooked up to it. You forgot its name as soon as Sarai said it.

The kitchen's well-stocked with pots, pans, utensils, a rice cooker, a crock pot, and a bunch of other tools you can't make heads or tails of. Years of mooching off of friends and going to the dining hall meant that you could avoid learning how to cook. Those days [[might be over]] now.

passages.name: keep us safe
passages.text:
"It's restrictive. We should be trusted enough to keep ourselves safe," Taya says.

"Why the hell did you enter this relationship then, if you knew you weren't going to be happy with the way it's run? We told you everything upfront." Nayeli says. "We didn't hide a single thing."

"Because I fell harder for you idiots than I realized. You swept me off my feet. Card tricks and guitar...what the fuck?" Taya sighs. "Isn't that how falling in love works? Our pretenses fade away... We make exceptions for people..."

"Were you happy?" You ask her.

Taya gives it some thought. "Yes, but only because it was them. I wouldn't have [[put up with it]] if I was with anyone else."

passages.name: Go for it
passages.text:
You go for it. <<set $starry = "yes">>

It doesn't take long for the heat to turn up. In the pitch black, it's like your other senses have heightened to make up for the darkness. You keep her close, flush up against you as you kiss and let your hands wander.

As she does the same, you hope you're too her liking. You hope you're soft in the right places, that she appreciates your shape and overall feel. You <<replace "want">>have<<endreplace>> to be good. You <<replace "want">>have<<endreplace>> to be memorable. <<replace "You want her to want you again.">>[[She must want to have you again.|SleepA]]<<endreplace>>

links.text: She must want to have you again.

passages.name: Primary/Secondary
passages.text:
"All it is that I want you to do those things so I can feel more comfortable," Sarai continues. "We should all be happy, and this is something that'll make me feel better. I'm still getting used to this being a quad set-up instead of a triangle-line one like it was before."

"It was your idea to make it into a quad," Nayeli brings up.

"She's allowed to doubt herself." Taya says.

"Um...if you guys want to talk this out, I can wait in my room."

"No, you should be here for this." Sarai stops you from leaving. "We're [[figuring out the boundaries]] here."

passages.name: Defend your decision
passages.text:
"Taya was the best choice for this," you explain.

Nayeli scoffs at that. "And why's that?"

"She just does, okay?" You shouldn't have to defend yourself like this. Why's she blowing up on you anyway?

"Because she comes from an Ivy League family? Because she's a nice, respectable girl?" Nayeli spits out. "Bullshit!"

"I am nice." Taya jumps in. "I'm nicer than you."

"It's Taya, and that's it." You can't go back and change [[who you picked|scoffs]], even if you'd wanted to.

passages.name: messed up
passages.text:
"Get down off of your soapbox, Sarai," Taya says. "Jerri's not going to cure polyphobia. That's not her job. She's a gay singer. A lesbian singer."

"She's a poly lesbian singer," Sarai insists.

"Not to the press and all her fans. You're acting like you tell everyone about your poly status."

Sarai holds up her wrist and points to the braided blue, red, and black striped bracelet on it. "People know."

"Only poly people would know what those colors mean, not the public-at-large. How are they supposed to know those aren't your favorite colors?"

"Then Jerri should wear a poly pride bracelet. She'd subtly [[stand with us]] that way."

passages.name: your separate ways
passages.text:
You lay on your couch when you get home, looking up at the ceiling. Your muscles are sore. Nayeli's rummaging around in the kitchen.

"Today's the day I turned 72." Saying it out loud makes it feel more real.

"Weren't you 75 the other day?"

"Yeah, I must've gotten featured on some website or something. [[Who knows]]?"

passages.name: scoffs
passages.text:
"It's bullshit that you picked anyone at all. No one said you had to have a relationship, did they?"

Oh. You hadn't thought of it that way. "...I guess not. My manager already knew about Taya and it made sense. I asked her for advice on where to take her out."

"Heh, I had a feeling you didn't pick that place on your own." Taya says.

"So it all worked out this way," you go on. "I didn't want to lie to Shannon and say I was single. I'm nowhere near single."

"If this is the stage you want to die on, be my guest." Nayeli turns away from you. "Fuck it."

"I don't think that's the right expression," Sarai says to her. "I think it's something else..."

Taya pulls you aside while Sarai and Nayeli chat among themselves. "If you don't want to stay here, I can get a hotel for us. Some space away from the situation might be good for everyone. We'd get cool down time."

*[[Leave][$hotel = true]].
*[[Stay][$no_hotel = true]].

passages.name: tayachoice
passages.text:
<<set $stayed_third = true>>"I'm sorry, Sarai...I have to break up with you. I'm staying with Taya," you say.

Taya lets out a happy breath of air. "Thank God."

"I understand. I knew you'd be leaving me so...[[it's okay|endmoment]]," Sarai says.

passages.name: playing
passages.text:
"She kept it a secret from us too," Taya shrugs.

"It's possible Nayeli won't know until she steps on the stage. She does that sometimes," Sarai says.

You yawn in your seat.

Taya says, "I can get you a coffee if you're falling asleep."

"I cut caffeine out of my diet. It's not the best thing to be drinking all the time..." Then again, you don't want to fall asleep before Nayeli gets on stage. If you do that, you might accidentally sleep all the way through her performance too.

*[[Get coffee|coffee]].
*[[Don't get coffee|nocoffee][$willpower = $willpower + 1]].

passages.name: catch her doing
passages.text: ...Masturbating with a web cam aimed at her crotch.\n\n[[Shut the door and run away.]]

links.text: Shut the door and run away.

destination.name: Shut the door and run away.

passages.name: You shake their hands one by one.
passages.text:
"The Pickford Top 100 chart is generated from several algorithms pulling in data from categories like your sales, social media presence, public relations, and overall star power. If you're not in the Top 100, you might as well be dead. It focuses solely on female solo pop singers." Shannon explains. "We'll get you on it after your debut. As you can see, you're in very good company. Do you ladies have any advice for our newest Estrella Girl?"

Lily Trilly says in a sing-song voice, "give it your all, no matter what!"

Rayna's more practical. "We were all in your shoes once. Things can get...rough at times, but you can't give up on yourself. The reason why we're here where we are is because [[we never gave up]]."

passages.name: over
passages.text:
Ashley Evans bounces over to you, oblivious. She babbles on about her chart position. "There was a silver lining to that scandal after all! It's really given me that boost I needed."<<set $fired = true>>

"Didn't work out that way for me." You shove your stuff into your duffle bag. You rip down the locker poster of Cameo Sarai gave to you as a joke.

"Are you leaving?"

"I got fired."

"That's too bad..." There's something off about the way Ashley Evans is acting. You wonder if she had anything to do with that picture getting out there.

*[[Ask her if she had a hand in it]].
*[[Let it go|ASHLEY]].

links.text: Ask her if she had a hand in it

destination.name: Ask her if she had a hand in it

passages.name: Join her
passages.text: "I'm a big one. You know, save the rain forests and all that." You smile. "I'll get the water running." Taya skips off to the bathroom. You hear the shower squeak on. You switch your cellphone to its selfie mode and make sure you're looking okay. No food in your teeth. Nothing in your hair. Eyelashes curled the right amount. You contemplate some lip gloss, but you realize you haven't taken anything with you and you're about to get in the shower with her anyway, so... Oh. A shower. A shower, that kind of shower. A two-person shower where you might be getting a little more dirty than clean. This is really about to happen, isn't it? Taya calls you. "The water's hot!" [[It's going to get hotter.]]

passages.name: step into
passages.text:
They're as frozen as you are with anticipation. No one says anything. You step out of your clothes, making sure to do it as noisily as possible to make your intentions clear.

You want this.

They want you.

"Aren't you forgetting someone?"<<set $threes = true>>

Sarai giggles. Nayeli moves over to [[give you room|Sleep.]] on the couch. You're in for a night...

passages.name: Watch them.
passages.text:
They left the bedroom door open a crack, just enough for you to be able to see out without being send. You're buzzing with excitement as you creep over to it. What would they do if they caught you? Invite you? <<if $starry or $starry2>>You didn't want to push your luck before, but an invitation is different.<<endif>>

And if you were invited, how good would you be?

Would you let them down? Would you be unable to keep up?

They've been together for so long that they were probably experts at each other's bodies. You'd be new and fumbly. And yes, you'd been with Sarai many, many times, but a threesome is different.

You haven't done [[your research]].

passages.name: Take the bed with Nayeli only.
passages.text:
"I'm going to share the bed with Nayeli tonight," you say. <<if $starry>>You think you catch a twitch of a negative emotion in Sarai's eyes after you say that, but you hope you're wrong.<<endif>>

"Are you sure?" Nayeli asks. She tilts her head.

"Yeah."

"Let me grab some blankets and I'll leave you two to it. Good night!" Sarai pushes you along.

[[...|next]]

passages.name: a music video
passages.text:
"I'm working on it." You take a bite out of your chicken thigh. "The video's got way more energy than the song. They want all of the dance moves to be big, big, big," you say with a sigh. "I have to stay on my A-game if I'm gonna pull this video off."

"You can do it. I know you can!"

"Thanks, girl."

"[[Good luck]]!"

passages.name: requestmoment
passages.text:
