<<if $stopcam>>"There's something else that has to stop too. Sarai, you have to stop drinking," Nayeli says.<<endif>><<if $request>>"Sarai, I'd like you to stop drinking," Nayeli says.<<endif>> "The last time you threw me to the ground. What's going to happen next time?"

"I'm so sorry I did that. I wasn't in control of myself."

"It has to stop. Whenever something goes wrong, you run to the bottle instead of talking to us." Nayeli tells her. "You have three people that are here to listen to you. Why are you drinking?"

"It's because she likes being a hero. She likes having the whole world on her shoulders." Taya says. "Anyway, I don't think it's fair to tell Sarai to completely cut out drinking. It's not like she does it frequently. It's just when she's feeling down...and can't everyone [[use a pick-me-up]] when they're down?"

passages.name: New Relationship Energy
passages.text:
"What's that?" You ask.

"NRE. It makes people do and say stupid things. It's that giddiness you get from being in a new relationship," Nayeli explains.

"And the Primary and Secondary thing?"

"I'll answer that," Taya cuts in. "It's a hierarchy system. One relationship gets held above all the others. That's the Primary one. And then there's the Secondary people who have got to go through all these rules and stuff just to get near anyone in the Primary relationship."

"That's not exactly it... It's all in the name. You can have more than one Primary relationship. Same with the Secondary relationships," Nayeli adds. "All it is is that the Primary is king, queen, quing, or whatever. They're the most important, but that still doesn't mean your allowed to treat your Secondaries like they're shit."

"What's a quing?"

"It doesn't matter. I'm not making this into a [[Primary/Secondary]] situation," Sarai says.

passages.name: Reassure her that she's not
passages.text: "No one's leaving you in the dust," you tell her. "It's not good to compare yourself like that. Remember what you said on our first date? Don't think about everyone else or something like that?"\n\n"It was easier to do that back then." Taya shakes her head. "Anyway, let's go back to what we were talking about before. [[Why me|okok]] instead of one of them?"

passages.name: Give them privacy. Go back to sleep.
passages.text: You roll over and go back to bed. You don't need to get yourself involved in that.\n\n[[Sleep.]]

passages.name: StoryTitle
passages.text: Nowhere Near Single

passages.name: coffee
passages.text:
You let Taya buy you a cup of something with a strong espresso shot. It's warm and more than welcome.

The girl with the guitar/drum gts off the stage. The announcer comes on. He cracks a couple of bad puns that have the audience groaning, then announces Nayeli to the stage.

She steps up to the mic, all cool and [[confidence]].

passages.name: notstarstuff
passages.text:
"How long have you been playing music for? Are you self-taught?"

"...That's what you want to know?" Nayeli yawns the last word. "What a boring question. Okay, I started out on the cello. I had private lessons for that until shit happened."

"Like what?"

"You'd have to get me drunk to talk about it," she evades. "Anyway, I switched over to the guitar. One of my friends had a spare one he didn't want to play anymore. From there, I did the bass and tried a little viola for shits and giggles." You picture a little Nayeli in her elementary school orchestra. It's a cuter image than you'd like to admit, and an inaccurate one based on the timeline of events she just laid down. "Piano's entirely self-taught. It took me years to not look like a monkey playing that thing."

"I had piano lessons until I plateaued."

"Maybe I can push you over the edge."

"Sounds scary."

"Don't worry. I'll catch you," she smiles. And there's just something about her smiling and saying that that makes you [[kiss her]] before you realize what you're doing.

passages.name: a long day
passages.text: You leap off of the bus as soon as it gets to your stop. You push your way through a sea of people in the plaza. Because the bus got stuck in traffic, you're cutting it close to your start time. Cutting it close... Shannon's war swords will be cutting you close if you don't [[keep running with everything that you have]].

links.text: keep running with everything that you have

destination.name: keep running with everything that you have

passages.name: The bed
passages.text: "The bed."\n\n"You got it," Taya [[smirks]].

passages.name: Ask Nayeli about the gecko.
passages.text:
"Nice tattoo. Where did you get it?"

"On my arm," she says, not making eye contact. You glance at Sarai, wondering if that was supposed to be a joke or her way of getting you to shut up. She's no help. She's too busy adding more salt to her ziti.

"Yeah, the one on your arm. It's a cool tattoo."

"Thanks." You think you see the trace of a smile on her lips but it's probably only your [[imagination|yep]].

passages.name: more than welcome
passages.text:
Everyone claps for the guitar/drum girl. The announcer appears to make a couple of jokes and bad puns that has everyone in the coffee shop groaning before he announces who's next.

"Can I have Pussy Lovers Anonymous to the stage?"

People laugh at the name. Taya's laughing the loudest of all, her face turning bright red. Nayeli makes a slicing motion over her neck with her finger. Sarai pats you on the shoulder. You're glad you're wearing a mask so no one can see how embarassed you are.

You follow Nayeli to the stage, carefully carrying her guitar. You sit on the stool and double-check that the guitar's in tune while she steps up to the mic.

"Hi, we're PLA, and we're dedicating this performance to a pair of special ladies in the back," she says.

Someone [[whistles]].

passages.name: Tell Nayeli that accepting help isn't shameful
passages.text:
"Accepting help isn't shameful," you tell her. "We're your support network. Why put yourself through a job that you don't have to do? Why hurt us like that?"<<set $stopcam = true>>

"So you'd rather me hurt myself?" Nayeli asks.

"You're not a single girl. Stop acting like no one cares about you," Taya says, exasperated.

"I don't mind helping you get back on your feet." Sarai says.

"The longer I'm away from school and music, the harder they both seem." Nayeli says. "I don't have any skills other than music, and nobody's hiring. It's like I have no other options. Being a camgirl, that's fast money. Not always easy but it's fast and it pays when the right members are around."

"Is it the job that's important to you, or the feeling of [[not having to depend on others]]?" You ask.

links.text: not having to depend on others

destination.name: not having to depend on others

passages.name: tayaroom
passages.text:
It's Friday. You drop your backpack down in Taya's dorm room. The room's clearly divided in half. One side's decorated in pink and white and the other's a calmer yellow shade. It seems like they couldn't come to an agreement on how they wanted the room to be. The bed on the yellow side's unmade. Its desk is extremely neat, though, with stacks of business textbooks. There's a toy frog on top of the pile. He's wearing a king's crown.

A poster of an alien, monster, and an astronaut hangs above the desk.

The bed on the pink and white side's made, but the desk is in slight disarray. It's got pens, pencils, and everything someone would need for a late night study session. You spy a granola bar. There's also stacks of business textbooks on it. If you were them, you would've shared the costs of books somehow, but they've got obvious problems in here.

There's a few pictures of a happy family taped above the desk.

"This takes me way back to when I was in college," you say. "Hey, can I guess which desk is yours?"

"Sure. There's a prize in it for you if you get it right."

You take a guess...

*[[The neat desk on the yellow side.]]
*[[The slightly messy desk on the pink and white side.]]

links.text: The neat desk on the yellow side.

destination.name: The neat desk on the yellow side.

links.text: The slightly messy desk on the pink and white side.

destination.name: The slightly messy desk on the pink and white side.

passages.name: Start
passages.text:
It takes them twenty minutes to perfect your face and layer the blush just right. You've never had this many people fawn over you before, but you'll have to get used to it. It's part of the business.

Your figure's hidden under cherubic ruffles colored a generic blue.

Although this is only a photoshoot, there's a micophone in your hand. You hold it to your face and [[sing]].

passages.name: Bring them up.
passages.text: <><>"Um..." You wish you had rehearsed what you were going to say. You should've taken some time to practice in the bathroom. "This may sound weird, but are you guys, like, happy with me and stuff?" "Yes." Sarai doesn't hesitate to say something. Nayeli's voice is tired, but she joins in with a "no shit." "Then why aren't we—" You falter, then try again. "Why don't we ever do it together, the three of us?" "You mean fuck?" You appreciate Nayeli's bluntness. "Yeah. We did it together once and that was it. [[What's up]]?"<><><>You're not sure how to go about saying it. You decide to take an angle. "Have you guys ever had...bedroom time with Taya? All at once." Nayeli mumbles, "that's Taya's business." She rolls over. "Are you guys into threesomes in general? Aren't they a big part of being poly?" Orgies are supposedly par for the course. "Not every relationship is like that," Sarai answers you. "Polyships are however the people that are in them want them to be." Nayeli says. "They're all different. Why, do you want to have a threesome?" Sarai laughs. "You're so blunt." "Someone has to ask her. How about you? You've been wanting one since before this started and [[don't you dare lie]]," she says to Sarai. "Stop dicking around already."<><>How do you even start to bring this up? You're not having sex with me and I demand to know why? Who says things like that? You, apparently. "Nayeli, are you asleep? We need to talk." "I'm awake. What?" Sarai checks, "should I go?" You tell her no. She can stay for this. Hopefully her presence inspires [[more strength]] in you.<>

passages.name: all its worth
passages.text:
Dinner goes without incident. The discussion about the rules scrubbed away most of the tension. Later that night, after the dishes have been washed, Taya's gone home, and you've brushed your teeth, you return to the living room.

Gone are the dinnertime smiles. Their faces have sobered up, gone serious as they speak to you one at a time.

"We don't want to put you on the spot or anything..." Sarai starts. 

"...But we want to go on your speed or whatever, so it's up to you. I don't care what you pick," Nayeli finishes.

"What would you like the sleeping arrangements to be tonight? Only one person can fit on the couch and three will be a tight fit on the bed."

Nayeli busies herself with picking at [[the arm of the couch]].

passages.name: what you do for fun
passages.text:
"I always make time for the women in my life. They're how I have fun," she winks. "And video games. I spend a lot of time in front of screens. I used to be obsessed with RTS games but I had to dial it way back when I got to college."

"Do you mean RPGs?" You think you've heard of those. Isn't that when people dress up like medieval knights?

"No, they're way different. They're on two different planets. I'm talking about real-time strategy games. RPGs are too slow for me. I need something more exciting." Taya says. "I like being overwhelmed, so overwhelmed that I go absolutely crazy. It's invigorating."

"By video games?"

"What do you think?"

"Yeah...?" You wonder if you missed something.

Taya slides her chopsticks out of their wrapper. "Do you know how to [[use these]]? How good are you with your hands?"

passages.name: Thanks
passages.text: Once Nayeli is gone, Taya breaks out into a fit of laughter. You can't tell if she's laughing out of stress or amusement.\n\n"What were we talking about again?" Taya recovers enough to start talking. "Right, right, [[the date|continuation]]. Hm..."

passages.name: a new side of you
passages.text:
"And of them too. But it's not new. Their haterade was in them the whole time," Taya says bitterly.

"Do you think they still hate you for it?"

"It's the only black mark on the otherwise perfect-on-paper life they think I have."

The waitress shows up again with the rolls. She lays them out around your table. They look heavenly. They're plated in lines, drizzled with a light sauce. You try a sweet potato roll first. There's a chew and a crunch to it, but a good one. It's close to a soft candy.

Taya takes one and dips it into her soy sauce bowl before eating it. When she happily leans back in her seat, you know you're going to have to thank Shannon again for telling you about the sweet potato rolls.

"How about the polyamory? Do they know about that?" You ask her [[out of curiosity]].

passages.name: the sensation
passages.text:
You meet your manager in her office. Four young women stand poised, at attention, by her desk. Collectively, their ages can't average more than 23. You wonder if one of them is in high school, she looks so fresh-faced. Shannon motions for you to sit down.

"Jerri, these are the Estrella Girls in my cadre. You're joining a fine cohort, one that is known for its excellence and hard work." Shannon leans her elbows on her desk. "Some managers in this company may let certain things slide, but I never do. This is why this cohort has been able to successfully rank up so fast.

"We have our second newest member, Ashley Evans, already at Rank 93 on the Pickford Top 100 Chart. Then, we have Rayna, Rank 54, on a comeback after a two year hiatus. Miya K at Rank 43, known for singing on the soundtracks for some popular Estrella Entertainment cartoons. And finally, we have Lily Trilly, Rank 38, particularly popular with our younger demographic."

You didn't recognize them out of their glitz and glam at irst, but these girls are no joke. You can't walk into a Claire's without hearing a Lily Trilly song, and Miya K has been featured in national ad campaigns. Rayna had a hit song a few years back that was featured in all sort of movie trailers.

[[You shake their hands one by one.]]

links.text: You shake their hands one by one.

destination.name: You shake their hands one by one.

passages.name: be my girlfriend
passages.text:
"You're late on that one, Jerri. I've been your girlfriend." Taya takes the lid off her smoothie to stir it up more.

"In the public eye."
<<if $avoid_3>>
"Funny how things change. Fucking figures," she mutters under her breath. Louder, she says, "now everything's okay because it'll help your career?"

"It's not like that. It's a good thing for us," you say.<<endif>>

"Why me? Why not Sarai or Nayeli? Sarai's responsible. She's a fine wine, y'know? I barely know how to adult. I'm fucking cola." She points out. "Nayeli's a musician already. It would help both of your careers at once if you picked her. You can duet and everything.

"School's making it hard enough as it is for me to <<if $threes>>[[be the girlfriend you need|ahhhh]]<<else>>[[be the girlfriend you need|okok]]<<endif>> me to be."

passages.name: tayaend
passages.text:
<<if $stayed_third>>You make as much time for Taya as you can. Movie dates where you're not doing a whole lot of watching the movie. Trips to art museums where you both take turns mimicking the paintings. Nights getting dressed up just for fun and not going anywhere at all. There's something about Taya that you can't get enough of. <<if $company>>The public eats it up.<<endif>>

She's there for you on nights where work stresses you out too much, with candles and a back massage. You're there for her when school's gotten too much and she needs someone to cuddle with. <<if $love3>>Is that what being in love means?<<endif>>

One day, Taya's going to become something powerful. You'll find her featured in a magazine or on television, the CEO of an investment company or something like that. And you hope you'll be by her side, just as powerful in another field.

[[You know it will happen|andyou]].<<else>>You've lost contact with Taya. It hurt at first, but as time went on, you understood why. <<if $thank3>>She's the girl who told you she loved you and you said thank you.<<endif>> <<if $love3>>She's the girl you said, "I love you" to and then shattered her heart into pieces.<<endif>> You let her down. She considered you her world, and you crushed her.

You know she's going to become something powerful some day. You'll read about her in Forbes magazine or find her featured in a "30 under 30" article about movers and shakers in the city. She'll become the CEO of a Fortune 500 company. She'll move on to something great.

[[You know she will|andyou]].<<endif>>

passages.name: Kiss her
passages.text:
You can feel Taya smiling into the kiss.<<set $kiss_3>>

"Hey, if you don't want this night to end yet," you tell her, "then neither do I."

She places her finger on your bottom lip. "Not so fast. This is all part of the dance. I'm going back to my dorm alone."

"Alright, that's not a problem with me," you say. "Do you want me to walk you back to the station?"

"That'd be great, thanks." She hugs you, and you start walking together, [[laughing all the way]].

passages.name: the arm of the couch
passages.text:
<<if $route_a>>Is it fair for you to take the bed a second night in a row? But then again, the couch is bound to cause you problems you shouldn't have during practice. You have to protect yourself, and they are letting you choose.<<endif>><<if $route_b>>The last time you took the couch, your back acted up during practice. Can you afford to put it through that kind of stress again? It's your choice.<<endif>>

*[[Take the couch.]]
*[[Take the bed with both of them.]]
*[[Take the bed with Sarai only.]]
*[[Take the bed with Nayeli only.]]

links.text: Take the bed with both of them.

destination.name: Take the bed with both of them.

links.text: Take the bed with Sarai only.

destination.name: Take the bed with Sarai only.

links.text: Take the bed with Nayeli only.

destination.name: Take the bed with Nayeli only.

passages.name: same answer
passages.text:
Shannon says you're getting stagnant. Everyone understands that you're cute, but you've got to develop more sides to yourself. The marketing team has to figure out what your other side will be. It's too soon for you to make the transition from cute to sexy.

You don't want to be stuck in a rut. You may have to come up with something on your own.

Taya sits next to you on the couch, highlighting pages in her textbook. In the bedroom, Nayeli is writing a song about sunrises. She finger picks the melody.

"I hate watching myself on TV," you complain.

"That's no good," Taya says without looking up from her book. "[[You're everywhere]]."

passages.name: can't read
passages.text: <>A week later, y<>Y<>ou watch yourself on television, dressed to the nines. You stood at the podium, fielding question after question<> at your rescheduled press conference<>. At first, they wre soft ball questions about how things have been going for you at Estrella Entertainment. <>They got progressively harsher as time went on.<> Then someone asked you that question: "Who was she?" Nayeli... Your publicist warned you to distance yourself from her as much as possible. What did you call her to the reporter? *[["A mistake."][$mistake = true]] *[["My other girlfriend."][$othergirlfriend = true]]

passages.name: your image
passages.text:
"Our research team was able to confirm that the LGBTQ movement is trending. We're going to embrace it for your image." Shannon says. "Your next song will be more in line with LGBTQ ideals. A love song, perhaps. How photogenic is your girlfriend?"

"Very," you guess.

"We could drum up 'paparazzi' to follow you around."

"Isn't that supposed to happen naturally?"

"We need a way for people to start talking. Photographs are a nice way to do that. Besides," Shannon tells you. "No real paparazzi would chase around a 97."

"I don't know if I'm ready for this sort of thing."

"We could arrange for you to speak somewhere about it. You need more impact than social media can provide." Shannon types in something else. "That, and we need to get you working on your next single. We'll do all of those things in conjunction so you can rise in rank. Maybe we can even get you [[some sponsors]]."

passages.name: want too much and get too little
passages.text:
"You can't sleep out here tonight," you tell her. "You're going to have to come back and face everyone."

"What's the point?" Nayeli says. "Taya wasn't wrong about me. There's only two things I'm good for.<<if $starry>> You should know that. You slept with me the first chance that you had."

"There's nothing wrong with that. I liked it. We both consented. So what's the problem?"<<else>>"

"Those aren't the only things you're about."<<endif>>

Nayeli sighs. "Being 'sex and music' is fine for friends or whatever, but a girlfriend? I should be more than that for the three of you. I should be more than a body. I fucked up."

*[[Blame yourself for this]].
*[[Let the blame rest with Nayeli]].

links.text: Let the blame rest with Nayeli

destination.name: Let the blame rest with Nayeli

passages.name: Leave it alone
passages.text: No, it's better if you leave it alone. It's not yours and you don't want to do anything to piss Nayeli off.\n\n[[You lay down on the couch.|tayaintro]]

links.text: You lay down on the couch.

passages.name: Back out of the press conference.
passages.text: "I won't go. It's not like they'll miss me or anything. I'm one star among many," you say. "I'll tell Shannon I got sick or something."<<set $noconference = true>>\n\nTaya hugs you close. "[[Thank you]] so much."

passages.name: space
passages.text:
"You know what else has a lot of space? This one." She held the deck in one hand, splitting it in half expertly and turning the two piles. A card slid out from between them. "Catch it."

The card shot into your hand. You turned it over to its face.

It was an Ace of Hearts with SARAI GREEN, CALL ME, and a phone number on it.

You spent your [[first date]] together berating her for her cheeseyness.

passages.name: Who knows
passages.text:
You learn why the next morning when Shannon calls you into her office. The way she called you in reminded you of being called for a detention in high school. Someone would call the classroom telephone, and then the teacher would tell you to go to the office. The same thing happened with you and your vocal coach.

"Is this about me slacking off during practice?" You take a stab in the dark.

"You've been doing fine during practice. That's not the problem that I'm addressing today. It's about what you've been doing outside of practice that's [[the problem]]."

passages.name: Take the bed with both of them.
passages.text:
"Let's all share the bed."

It's interesting being able to compare their reactions. Nayeli's frozen. Sarai looks like she is ready to hug-tackle you the first second she gets.

"I call the middle!" Sarai says.

"Would it be more fair for Jerri to have the middle?" Nayeli speaks with the most disinterested voice possible. You're starting to wonder if you're ever going to figure this girl out.

"What about you? Do you want the middle?"

"No, I'd rather die. The middle makes me feel too trapped."

"It's up to you then. I'm just happy that we're doing this, so either option works for me."

*[[Take the middle.]]
*[[Let Sarai be in the middle.]]

links.text: Let Sarai be in the middle.

destination.name: Let Sarai be in the middle.

passages.name: been a week
passages.text:
"You know what I mean," Taya says. "You can't mess with people's emotions like that."

<<if $stayed_with_first>>"What were you guys up to while you were gone?" You ask.

"We did a lot of talking." Nayeli looks over at Taya for support. "We tried to figure out if this arrangement is really a good thing for us at this point in time."

"I've been thinking about it, too. There's not much else I can think about," Sarai says.<<else>>"What have you been doing while we were gone, Sarai?" You ask.

"I've been doing a lot of thinking about the four of us as a group."

"So have we," Nayeli says.

"It was impossible for me not to think about, no matter how hard I tried."<<endif>>

She goes on, "we obviously went wrong somewhere. I wish I could figure out [[when and where]]."

passages.name: Are you?
passages.text:
"Heh, I'm ready for it. I'll be getting famous without all of the extra work. Why the hell not go for it?" She passes you the menu. "I might not ever get a chance like this again. I've got to take it."

You scan the list for something to eat. You wonder if tonight's special enough to throw your dietary restrictions to the wind.

*[[Mandarin shrimp salad.|foodtime][$ willpower = $willpower + 1]]
*[[Roast beef with fried onions and a side of mashed potatoes.|foodtime]]
*[[Medium-rare cheeseburger with onion rings and barbeque sauce.|foodtime]]

links.text: Roast beef with fried onions and a side of mashed potatoes.
Medium-rare cheeseburger with onion rings and barbeque sauce.

passages.name: bank comment
passages.text:
"Anyways...you went to school? For what?"

"I wasn't there for very long. I dropped out. My own dreams were too important for me to keep denying." You say. "I was a Chemistry major."

"Oh, jeez, Chemistry of all things. I get why you quit. I took an Intro to Chemistry class and it kicked my ass. I had to drop it."

"Was that a requirement?"

"We needed to take at least two science classes. I took Physics, instead. It was better." Taya says. "Do you feel like you're lucky, Jerri? You went after your dreams and it worked out for you."

"It's not all luck. There's a lot of hard work involved. It's not enough to be a good singer." And you know that there's [[more work]] to come.

passages.name: Ask her to stay the night
passages.text:
Taya taps the table. "Let me tell you something I'll tell you a hundred times if I have to. I'm not interested in, and will not ever be interested in a pity fuck. That's not my style." She grimaces. "I'm not as crazed for it as certain people...just wave a little sex in their faces and they come charging like bulls on red."<<set $bull = true>>

"It's not red that the bulls go after. It's the movement."

"Whatever, you get what I mean."

"I guess so. I'm sorry."

"Yeah, let's just get back to what you were saying before. Why'd you [[pick me|okok]]?"

passages.name: return home
passages.text:
You come home to an air of unease. Taya's sitting on the couch, her gaze downcast. The bedroom door's closed. Two empty whiskey bottles sit on the coffee table in front of her.

"What's going on? Did you drink those?"

"No... I don't know. They locked the door and won't let me in."

You bang on the bedroom door. There's no answer.

Taya says, "they're not answering their phones."

You press your ear to he door. "It sounds quiet in there. Maybe the door got stuck and they're out somewhere."

"You can't be that naïve, can you?" Taya sighs.

"We'll [[wait]], then."

passages.name: most selfish genre
passages.text:
That gets under your skin. "So what if I'm a pop singer? That doesn't mean you get to say things like that. I do treat my guitars with respect, and it's nasty that you even said that." Your face burns as you speak. "I worked my ass off to get where I am. It wasn't easy."

Nayeli raises her shoulders, then slowly lowers them. "Good for you. Mind turning out the lights and getting in bed? There's more than enough room for both of us to do whatever. It's a queen."

"Ha," you let out a nervous laugh. "Do whatever, um, together?"

"Shit, I didn't mean it like that...unless you want to. I don't care. Sarai practically gave us the green light to do it."

"Do you think [[she wants us to]]?"

passages.name: a royal bitch
passages.text:
Taya leaps off of the couch. She stands in front of her. "You need to get out of here. Sarai's about to go on a rampage."

"You bet your ass I'm about to. Give her the fucking phone, Jerri."

You toss it over to Nayeli. She scans it over, looking more and more ill the longer she looks. "What's this...? This isn't true. They made this shit up about me!" She moves around Taya.

"Stop lying. There's pictures, you dumb bitch." Sarai says. "I had a feeling you were prostituting yourself. Whose cock did you suck for your piano, huh?"

You hear the [[SLAP]] before you know it's happened.

passages.name: edge of the bed
passages.text:
"I hope I didn't make a mistake by introducing you guys," Sarai says, frowning.

"You didn't."

"Look at you, though. I'm not doing a good job of protecting you."

Your head hurts too much for you to go on with this conversation. You [[doze off]].

passages.name: speechwriter
passages.text:
"Does it matter what her answer is? Everything's gonna happen on its own pace," Taya interrupts you before you can say anything. "Let everything happen naturally and shake out in its own way. Huzzah, the end, congratulations. We've solved the puzzle."

"Is that it? We're done then, right?" Nayeli asks.

"Thank God that's settled." Sarai's relieved.

"Jerri and I are going on a date this weekend if anyone else wants to come along."

"No thanks. I'll take Sarai out somewhere else." Nayeli says.

"Ooh, but we can finally double date! No more awkward third wheeling." Taya cheers.

"What are you talking about? We've never had a third wheel." Nayeli sighs. "You're always making shit up..."

Sarai jumps in before their conversation takes a turn. "Hey Taya, are you [[staying for dinner]]?"

passages.name: benefits
passages.text:
You don't say anything. You shut off the lights and crawl into bed.

* [[Stay on your side.]]
* [[Move over to Nayeli's.]]

passages.name: stand with us
passages.text:
Nayeli interjects, "it's all bullshit, especially the fact that you picked Taya."

"What the fuck? You need to chill." Taya snaps at her.

*[[Defend your decision]].
*[[Stand down]].

passages.name: out of curiosity
passages.text:
"They don't get it," she pauses to eat some more sushi. "The way they see it is that I'm a single woman dating around, and that's it. It's like I've got a bunch of longterm flings. I don't think they'll ever see any of my girlfriends as serious and that's just...I try not think about it. How about you?"

"I'm sort of new to being poly. I was more like the way that your parents see you. Lots of casual relationships all at once. I couldn't see myself settling down with one person. I still don't. Who wants that much pressure?" You rub a sushi into a line of sauce. "So yeah, I've been polyamorous by practice for years and polyamorous by name for a week."

"Babypoly."

"Is that like babydyke?"

"Yep, you're like a babypolydyke."

*[[Agree]].
*[[Disagree]].

passages.name: honest
passages.text:
"He's a she." You take the plunge and a frequency noise goes through your head. "He's a she and she's great. A lot of fun." You can't stop talking once you get started. "I don't know a lot about her yet, but she seems really nice. She's a business—"

"Are you a lesbian, bisexual, or a straight girl who's flexible?"

"There's more options than that..."

"Which one are you? What's your identity?"

You've never been asked that point-blank like that. "[[Lesbian]]."

passages.name: Promise
passages.text:
"I promise," you say.<<set $yes_promise>>

Taya's quiet. "I never make promises, no matter who they're for."

"I promise too," Nayeli says.

"Thank you," Sarai says, [[wiping her eyes|airtime]].

passages.name: You scroll through the list from 100 to 1.
passages.text: 100. Ikki Panda 99. Wen 98. Sam Hightower 97. Scottie Dayne 96. Petula 95. Greta Edwards 94. Joan Coolidge 93. Ashley Evans 92. Kiki Page 91. Marnie and the Spades 90. N2U 89. Sarah Twig 88. Ir3ne 87. Yvonne Johnson 86. Live Wire 85. Senorita Jamison 84. Snacks for Two 83. Natalie I-C 82. Warri 81. Vanessa Miles 100-81 >> [[80-60]]

passages.name: Good luck
passages.text:
That night, you borrow Sarai and Nayeli's computer to search for "Jerri +singer +Estrella +Girl." You're trying to find any mentions of your name on blog sites, social networks, Estrella Girl wiki pages, all of that.

Sarai puts her head on your shoulder. "I thought the rule was to never look at the comments."

"It's part of my job," you explain. "I have to read this stuff in order to know if I have to pivot in any way."

Nayeli pipes up from the corner of the room, "tell the comments to fuck off." She's restringing her guitar.

"Amazing advice from our lovely dear Nayeli. You've got a way with words," Sarai laughs.

"No, seriously, your integrity's at stake or whatever. Don't change because of a bunch of comments. Do your own thing." Nayeli tests out the E string.

"Tighten that," you say.

"Got it."

*[[Don't read the comments ever.|oldman][$comments_no = true]]
*[[Read comments regularly.|oldman][$comments_yes = true]]

passages.name: taken more money
passages.text: It's because of those meetings with the Estrella Entertainment Executives, the ones where they looked you up and down to see if you were truly Estrella material. They couldn't take your manager's word for it. They had to know for sure if they were going to pour tons of money into making you an Estrella Girl.\n\n[[You passed the test.|sing]]

passages.name: my fault
passages.text:
"You're shouldering too much," Nayeli says.

"That's because Sarai likes feeling like the hero," Taya explains.

"Watch it. We're not fighting today." You warn her. <<if $quit or $fired>>"Anyways, my career won't be a problem anymore. It's over.<<endif>> <<if $quit>>I quit. I couldn't take it anymore.<<endif>><<if $fired>>They fired me. I wasn't what they wanted.<<endif>><<if $quit or $fired>>"

Nayeli's shocked into silence. Taya says, "that sucks." How eloquent of her.

"It hasn't fully hit me yet... No more waking up in the mornings to get to Estrella. No more makeup teams. No more red carpet treatment. No more of that pressure to be a role model." You sigh, "I'm a regular person now."

"I'm sorry," Sarai says.

"We can talk about this later. This isn't as important as the conversation we're having right now," you say.<<endif>> <<if $quit and $mistake>>"One quick thing, though. I'm sorry for ever calling you a mistake, Nayeli. It wasn't true, and it hurts that that's the idea ha people will have in their head."

"Whatever. You were forced to say that," Nayeli says, regaining her voice. "What could you do? Nothing."<<endif>>

There's more [[razor's edge silence]] as you stare at one another.

passages.name: texting on her phone
passages.text: Nayeli's tapping on her phone so rapidly that at first you think she's playing a game. Is she writing [[a novel|might be over]]?

passages.name: the pockets of her jacket
passages.text:
"I've got some errands to run, so I'll be going," Sarai says.

"I should get going too. Homework." Taya says.

"I'm going to finish working on my song. Yeah," Nayeli says.

"Um...it's time for me to go on a run."<<if $stayed_first_third>><<set $stayed_first = true>><<set $stayed_third = true>><<endif>>

You go in [[your own directions|...]].

passages.name: push the blankets away
passages.text:
Nayeli shrugs. "Dunno. I've gotta get to sleep. G'night."

At least you were able to get in a conversation that long before she had to go to bed.

Baby steps.

"Good night." You make yourself as comfortable as you can.

[[Sleep.|SleepB][$backpain = true]]

passages.name: Sacrifice...
passages.text:
You're feeling close to death at lunchtime. Luckily, Ashley Evans is with you to help cheer you up.

<<if $backpain or $backpain2>>"Is something wrong? You keep flinching every time you move..." She looks at you, concerned. "I know a good chiropractor!"

"No, it's okay. I just had a rough night on the couch, that's all. It's catching up to me."

"Oh no, you can't do stuff like that. You owe it to your fans to take care of yourself." Ashley Evans sticks a straw into her strawberry milk carton.

"That's easy for you to say. You've got fans."

"You'll get some too soon. All you have to do is [[debut|hqtuff]]."<<else>>"When do practices get any easier?" You groan.

Ashley Evans sticks a straw into her strawberry milk. "Want me to be real with you?"

"Yes."

"Never!" She laughs. Every second of her laughter feels like a stab to your heart. You need to get in [[shape|hqtuff]].<<endif>>

passages.name: Excited
passages.text: "That's the way to be!" Ashley Evans says, not caring about how loud she is at all. "You've got the [[whole world|fear]] ahead of you."

passages.name: "I love you too."
passages.text:
"I love you too."<<set $love3 = true>>

Your heart sounds in your ears. When was the last time you said that and meant it?

Taya moves closer and presses her lips against yours. The kiss is slow. It makes you feel dizzy. When she moves away, you see that her eyes are shining with tears.

"I'm so happy," she says.

You grab her hand. "Taya..."

"Yeah?"

"Is there any way we can get out from under the blanket now? I love you but it's like a sauna in here." You like the way that word sounds on your tongue. Love.

"Yes, [[silly]]. C'mon."

passages.name: Don't back out of the press conference.
passages.text:
"I'm sorry. I have to go," you tell her.<<set $yesconference = true>>

"That's okay. I'll invite Sarai over instead."

"Ouch. That's nice of you."

"Nice? That's just how it is. If you can't be there for me, why can't I call on someone else to take your place?" Taya asks.

"You didn't have to say it in such a shitty way. Whatever..."

"You've been around Nayeli too much," she says.

"Is there something wrong with that?"

"No, not really. It [[doesn't matter|Thank you]]." She drops it.

passages.name: Break up with Nayeli
passages.text: "Sorry, we have to break up."\n\nNayeli shrugs. "Whatever. There must've been something missing for us. I'm okay with [[never knowing|itsover]]." Is she really?

passages.name: first night
passages.text: Night number one and already sharing a bed with someone who may or may not <<replace "hate your guts">>think you're a worthless bug<<becomes>>want you out of her life as soon as possible<<endreplace>>?\n\nNo, thanks. You'd have to be a brave soul to agree to [[that|take my half]].

passages.name: when and where
passages.text:
"That's a stupid wish," Taya tells her. "Even if it came true, what would happen after that?"

"I could use that knowlege to work towards keeping us together...or for a future relationship if this is the end," Sarai explains. "I love you guys, but I also know that the best thing for you might be for you to let me go. I drove a wedge into things.

"I can be whatever you want me to be. A friend or something more. I'll always love you, even if you don't love me anymore," she has to stop to look away. Her eyes fill up with tears. "I don't want to be cut out of your lives. Please, promise me you won't."

Nayeli grips the edge of her chair, as if she's fighting against an urge to get up and comfort Sarai. You do your best to resist, as well.

"Do you promise?" Sarai chokes out.

*[[Promise][$yes_promise = true]].
*[[Don't promise][$no_promise = true]].

passages.name: never leave
passages.text:
You get up. You feel the power of song surging through you.

"I've got to sing!"

Nayeli grabs you and tells you not to do it. <<if $willpower >= 2>>You struggle on the inside for, like, a split second and then fall onto the couch. There's a pillow there that you've got to talk to. It's got the coolest pattern in it and it's so soft.<<else>>You do it anyway. How can anyone deny the power of music? It's way above the power of friendship on the importance scale. You belt out one of your songs. It's the one most appropriate to this moment, all about having fun and being in love with everyone. Life's beautiful. Taya screeches along with your song. Cute.

Nayeli stops your song by shoving a pillow in your face. You rub your cheek against it. It's soft, which is pretty cool. You like the pattern that's weaved into it.<<endif>>

You whisper to the pillow that you want to perform for everyone at the club. You make it promise to keep your secret. Taya overhears. She tells you that it'd be awesome.

"If you sang downstairs, you'd bring the house down," she tells you. Her eyes look [[freaky]].

passages.name: Let it go
passages.text:
You let it go. "Yeah, you're right," you say. "Good night, Nayeli. It was nice to meet you."

"Same to you. Night."

[[Sleep.|SleepB][$backpain = true]]

passages.name: Press
passages.text:
"Are you sure about that?" You're not letting her shrug the issue off that easily. "Because you can tell me if you're not."

"Yes, I'm sure," Nayeli huffs.

"You don't look like you're sure."

"If I said I'm sure, then I'm sure. Stop being so pushy." She crosses her arms over her chest. You've never seen someone look so intimidating in pleather shorts. "Not everything can be as instantly perfect as Sarai wants it to be."

"Yeah, I know. It's not realistic."

"Exactly. We've only known each other for a couple of hours. Just because we're called girlfriends or whatever doesn't mean we've actually reached that level."

"Do we have to call each other that?" You [[push the blankets away]]. They're making you too warm.

passages.name: Let Sarai be in the middle.
passages.text:
You let Sarai be in the middle. Why rob her of that happiness?

...

Lying in bed with the two of them, it feels like Sarai's a barrier between you and Nayeli. It's so dark that you wouldn't know if Nayeli was even there, beyond Sarai's body. For all you know, Nayeli could be gone, off to the couch after feeling uncomfortable or not wanting to deal with being around you.
<<if $route_a>>
It seemed like she was starting to like you more until you put your foot in your mouth.
<<endif>>
It take hours, but you calm yourself down enough to [[fall asleep]].

passages.name: more strength
passages.text:
"Um, so, Nayeli, we've been going out for a while..." You stumble through your words. "I like you a lot. Do you like me?"

"No shit."

"Okay, that's good. Yep. So since we like each other and all, I was wondering when you wanted to take the next step. I'm ready for it."

"Damn, you sound like you're in middle school." Nayeli laughs.

"You can't blame me for that. You try asking that question."

"Sarai," Nayeli says. "How would you feel about me having sex with Jerri?" There's no waver or hint of nervousness in her voice. You wish you knew how she does it.

"Great! That'd be great for you guys."

"Then it'll happen whenever you want it to."

"I can sleep on the couch tonight," Sarai says. "It's better for you guys to learn each other's bodies first before I get involved in any way. I learned that [[the hard way]]."

passages.name: charity case
passages.text:
She stops herself. "Okay, that's gonna be the last time I talk about them. Tonight's aout you and me, and no one else."

The waitress comes back over. She asks if you're ready to order.

"Just drinks for now. I'd like a Midori Sour and an Autumn Delight."

You're surprised (and grateful) when you don't get carded. The waitress jots down your order and goes away.

"How'd you do that?"

"Confidence." Taya says. "It works most of the time. It also helps that [[we're dressed up]]."

passages.name: mikael
passages.text:
The next weekend, you and Nayeli sign up to perform at some cafe's open mic.

Sarai and Taya are busy creating your disguise. They rummage through your closet, Taya indiscriminately tossing things out.

"Don't you have money now, Jerri? What's with your wardrobe?" Taya holds up a shirt that's three sizes too big. It says PAWAAA on it. "...Why?"

"I haven't had the time to organize it, or do anything else with this room." It's still bare. Then again, do you have any reason to do something to it? You pretty much exclusively use Sarai and Nayeli's bed these days.

"Who cares about the room? We've got to do [[something about your closet]]."

passages.name: punish
passages.text:
"That depends on what you want your punishment to be," you say.

"It's not fun if I have to pick it. That's not how punishments work." She pouts. "Unless...you want to be punished for not being good at giving punishments. The punishee becomes the punisher."

"Where are we going with this?"

"I dunno. It could lead to all sorts of places. The wall, the shower, the floor..."

*[[The bed]].
*[[The ceiling]].

passages.name: gets quiet
passages.text: "Why'd you do it?" Sarai asks her. "Don't you know how many hours I slaved to be able to have you live here for free? Do you know how much I had to sacrifice for you?" Taya says, "Nayeli never wanted you to do those things for her. You never had to be a martyr." "That's rich coming from you, seeing how much you belittle Nayeli on a daily basis. Now you want to act like a loving and caring girlfriend. Please." "Stop it. You know I'm joking around when I say those things to her." "You can both get the fuck [[out of my sight]]." Sarai points to the door. <>"Rent her a fucking hotel room like you did for Jerri, Taya. I don't care. Just go."<>

passages.name: girls like Cameo
passages.text:
"Who's Cameo?"

"You don't know who Cameo is?" Ashley Evans gasps. "She's only one of the bet pop stars ever! She's not with Estrella. She's with Simon-Timmons Music. Here, I'll show you where she is on the Pickford Top 100. Check it out on my phone."

[[You scroll through the list from 100 to 1.]]

links.text: You scroll through the list from 100 to 1.

destination.name: You scroll through the list from 100 to 1.

passages.name: first date
passages.text:
It's been bent to hell and back, but you've kept that Ace of Hearts. You run your thumb over its creases whenever you need luck. Today, though, you know you need more than just luck so you've asked for the source of it to meet you for coffee.

At this point, your latte's a light brown nothing, a blend of espresso, coffee, foam, and milk.

"You know, it's not easy to make those." Sarai says. "I used to work in a coffee shop. Valentine's Day was killer. Everyone wanted a heart."

"We're forced to ask customers if they want their sandwiches cut into hearts." You groan at the memory.

"It's the holiday for love."

"If it was really a holiday, they'd [[give us off from work]]."

passages.name: didn't even mention it
passages.text:
"What are we supposed to do?" Nayeli's the next one with a question.

"Nothing's gonna change," you reason.

"We just can't be seen with you in public as anything more than friends. I'm not your fucking friend, Jerri."
<<if $threes>>
Taya mutters that "fucking friend" suits her just fine. Nayeli tells her to go fuck herself. Taya blows her a kiss in response. Sarai's too caught up in this conversation to tell them to drop it.<<endif>>

"Sorry, but that's the way it has to be." You tell them. "I don't want to jeopardize things for myslf this early."

"The world could use more poly representation... You could be that for people," Sarai says. "What happens when I get married? I have to choose only one woman to be my wife? So she gets all of my benefits and my girlfriends get nothing at all? That's [[messed up]]."

passages.name: Join them.
passages.text: You breathe in a deep breath of confidence.<> You can do this. They think you're hot. That's right, you're the hottest ever. You get out of bed and give yourself a pep talk. You've been with them both before. You can handle a threesome. You got this. You punch the air a couple of times, like a boxer about to get into the ring. You don't want to disappoint them in any way. You want them to be happy and satisfied. And you can do it. Get 'em, tiger. You [[step into]] the other room.

passages.name: nocoffee
passages.text:
You turn down the coffee. You don't want the caffeine to mess up all the hard work you've put into maintaining your diet.

The girl with the guitar/drum gts off the stage. The announcer comes on. He cracks a couple of bad puns that have the audience groaning, then announces Nayeli to the stage.

She steps up to the microphone, all cool and [[confidence]].

passages.name: kick in
passages.text:
Taya starts laughing hysterically. You're not sure at what. This situation? How Nayeli looks when she's pissed? Nayeli holds Taya up to keep her from falling on the floor.

"You should've done it too, Yeli! Now you're the one left out.<<if $threes>> This is something special for me and Jerri only. Go away." Nayeli doesn't move.<<else>>"<<endif>>

"Are you tripping yet?" She asks you.

"I don't think so. How do I know?"

"Fuck... Let's get a private booth. If you're not going to go home, let's just get away from everyone to save face." Nayeli's so tense. She needs to relax.

"Save face? More like chew face," Taya says, proud of herself.

"That only happens with bath salts." You're [[helpful]].

passages.name: Put some money in their cup and then go home
passages.text: You drop the handful of change you have in your pocket into their cup. The drummer speeds up his drumming in thanks.\n\nYou head off to get to [[your apartment]].

passages.name: Stay with Nayeli
passages.text: "I'm not breaking up with you, Nayeli."<<set $stayed_second = true>>\n\nShe [[smiles|itsover]] at this. <<if $stayed_first is true and $stayed_third is not true>>You think you hear Taya mutter that she called it.<<endif>>

passages.name: theend
passages.text: The end.\n\n[[Credits]].

passages.name: lost her smile
passages.text:
"When do you want to hang out?"

"Friday night. My roommate's going to be gone and we can have my dorm room to ourselves."

"Friday night? Um...I've got a press conference Friday."

"At night?"

"During the day, but it's a few hours away. Other stars are going to be there. It's important for networking." It's something that could help you with your Pickford Top 100 Chart ranking.

"Yeah," Taya says. "Work comes first, I guess."

*[[Back out of the press conference.]]
*[[Don't back out of the press conference.]]

links.text: Back out of the press conference.

destination.name: Back out of the press conference.

links.text: Don't back out of the press conference.

destination.name: Don't back out of the press conference.

passages.name: silly
passages.text:
Love.

What is it about that word that strips everyone down to their most raw and vulnerable?

The weight of that word isn't something you think about very much. It's a heavy thing that never seemed to suit you. Yeah, you've had lovers in the past, but being someone's lover and being in love are two different things for you.

Do you love all of the women you're with?

Do you have to? Is that's what's expected of you after being with them for so long? Is love a given at this point that you don't even need to say?

[[You don't have the answer to that.|can't read]]

links.text: You don't have the answer to that.

passages.name: feeling
passages.text:
You sit with her on her bed as you talk. "How have you been feeling? Nayeli told me all about the Ecstasy comedown."

"Ugh, I don't even want to think about that night," Taya says. "I regret it, okay? I wish that night would disappear."

Your stomach drops. "It won't disappear for me. Someone took a picture of me kissing Nayeli and now everyone thinks I'm some kind of cheater and," your voice breaks. "This could be it for me."

"Fuck," Taya embraces you. Her touch is enough to make you openly cry. "I can fix this. I can hire people to write better things about you or something... Money talks. Fuck it, I can talk to the media, the newspapers, anything and everything."

"It's my problem to fix, not yours." You sob, "I shouldn't have picked you. I fucked up."

"...Who should you have picked instead?"

*[[No one.|oh]]
*[[Sarai.|oh]]
*[[Nayeli.|oh]]

passages.name: Stay with Taya
passages.text: "I'm not leaving you, Taya."<<set $stayed_third = true>>\n\nShe [[smiles|okdecision]]. "Thanks."

passages.name: raw
passages.text:
On your way getting home late, you pass by a pair of street musicians. One's sitting on the sidewalk, drumming on overturned buckets. The other stands next to him, plucking a guitar that's missing a string. Their performance is listless, uninspiring. It's not the sort of thing that would make people stop, listen, and more importantly, drop a few dollars their way.

*[[Sing along to help]].
*[[Go home. It's not your business]].
*[[Put some money in their cup and then go home]].

links.text: Go home. It's not your business

destination.name: Go home. It's not your business

links.text: Put some money in their cup and then go home

destination.name: Put some money in their cup and then go home

passages.name: her bedroom
passages.text:
"Sit on the bed," she orders.

You give her a hard look.

"...Please?" Nayeli tries. You comply. The next thing you know, she's holding her guitar out to you.

"Is that a peace offering?"

Nayeli shakes her head. "Hear me out. I suck at talking sometimes."

You give her another hard look.

"Most of the time. Music on the other hand, that's what I'm good at. So I think we should play together so we can get on the same wavelength. Do you want to play something sad or cool?"

"Happy's not a choice?"

"I don't do happy. Pick one."

*[[Sad|player][$sad_song = true]]
*[[Cool|player][$cool_song = true]]

passages.name: staying for dinner
passages.text:
"Only for that. School sucks." Taya grumbles. "I should quit and become a pop star instead."

"We only have room for one of those in this relationship." Nayeli says.

"I'm pretty sure the fame would go to your head, Taya." You tease her.

"Hell yeah! And why shouldn't it?" She smiles. "I'd milk it for [[all its worth]]."

passages.name: some sponsors
passages.text:
"Yeah...maybe."

"It's a good thing. These are all very good things for your career."

Shannon has a point. If no one is talking about you then you might as well not exist. She excuses you from the room, and you briefly wonder what you may have [[gotten yourself into]].

passages.name: dancing
passages.text:
"You're so lucky Estrella gave you that image. My rank's been sliding. I need a gimmick as good as yours."

"It changes with the seasons," you say. "Crowds can be fickle."

"Not yours. They love you. You're going to be remembered forever. You've got staying power, girl."

For your music or for your image?

"I've gotta go. I've got someone waiting for me. Bye!" She bounces away into the crowd. The girl she goes over to looks vaguely familiar, but you're not sure where you've seen her or her sunglasses before.

Seems like Taya's not the only one rocking the nightclub sunglasses look.

You [[make your way back]] to where you left Taya and Nayeli.

passages.name: couch
passages.text:
Good riddance.

And now you're swirling the pattern in your latte into something unrecognizable, sitting across from Sarai, a woman a few years your senior that you've been seeing for a couple of months.

Seeing, in a [[casual]] sense.

passages.name: Credits
passages.text: Story by kaleidofish of Kaleidofish Studios Playtested by Thestral and r-bit Thank you for playing!

passages.name: doze off
passages.text:
That "absolute shit" feeling doesn't wear off. You move through the motions during the morning group exercises, and sit with Ashley Evans at lunch. She's back to looking like her usual chipper self, no longer the Ashley you met at the club. She shoves a grilled cheese sandwich into her mouth.

You went for soup today, something hot and easy to eat.

"Do you still have a hangover from Saturday night?" She keeps her voice low. The last thing you need is for anyone to overhear you two. Estrella Girls aren't exactly supposed to be party girls.

"You could say that."

"What do you have going on later today?"

"Studio time. I'm working on [[something big]]." Estrella Entertainment never gives you a break.

passages.name: Side with Taya
passages.text:
"Since it happens on such a rare occassion, I have to agree with Taya," you say. "Sarai threw you like that because you slapped her. Notice how even as drunk as she was, she didn't hit you with her fists or hands."

"So are you saying I asked for it?" Nayeli asks. "And you think she wouldn't have fucked me up if you guys weren't around...okay, wow. You and Taya have a fucked up view of the world."

"I didn't say that," you try to reason with her. "You hit Sarai first. You provoked her."

"I shouldn't have touched her, regardless of if she hit me first or not," Sarai says. "I'll never forgive myself for what I said and did that night."

"I'm probably going to have to leave you, sorry... We're [[not going to work out]] if you can't promise me you won't drink." Nayeli says.

passages.name: starts singing
passages.text:
Her words are nonsense. Nayeli's not an on-the-spot lyricist, but you overlook that in favor of the clarity of her voice. She's a belty singer, loud and unapologetic. You jump in to harmonize on the third time she repeats what you're guessing is her chorus: <>Crows are lonely
Vulture culture
On top of black wings
Vulture culture
On top of the General
Crows are lonely<><>Bad boys getting wrecked
Bad girls getting wrecked
Bad kids getting wrecked
Get wrecked under this hailstorm
Tater tots for breakfast<> You're going to have to ask her how she comes up with such [[beautiful lyrics]] later.

passages.name: keep running with everything that you have
passages.text:
You run SMACK into someone, hard enough to knock her over. Her bag flies out of her grasp. Dazed, you hurriedly say that you're sorry and help her back to her feet. She picks up her fallen purse, her arms shaking as she does.

Her hair's an ombre gradient of teal and pink. She's small in stature, a pair of dark sunglasses obscuring her eyes.

The sunglasses do little to block out the glare that's radiating from behind them. "Watch where you're going!" The girl shrieks.

"I said I was sorry."

"Sorry isn't good enough. I demand a real apology."

*[[Tell her to deal with it.]]
*[[Tell her you're in a hurry.]]

links.text: Tell her to deal with it.

destination.name: Tell her to deal with it.

links.text: Tell her you're in a hurry.

destination.name: Tell her you're in a hurry.

passages.name: sure
passages.text:
Your date goes on. Taya tells you a story about a time when a dog bit her that almost has you rolling on the floor laughing. Dog bites shouldn't be that funny. It was all in her delivery.

You trade stories of hair dye fails, like that time you dyed your hair "vampire red." It faded to black within days. That didn't beat what happened to her when she dyed her hair orange. Everyone called her traffic conehead.

She covers the check when you're finished, telling you that it's not a problem since she had such a good time. You leave the restaurant holding hands.

Taya gazes into your eyes. You're conscious of being in a public space where anyone can walk by and see you. What if someone takes a picture of this and uses it against you later? You have to protect yourself.

...Or you can throw caution to the wind.

*[[Kiss her][$kiss_3 = true]].
*[[Avoid the kiss][$avoid_3 = true]].

passages.name: Convince her to compromise
passages.text:
"Can you try to compromise with them, Nayeli?" You ask her. "I know you can't quit this instant, but why not quit on some kind of schedule? You could make a goal for yourself and quit then. Sarai and Taya will leave you alone until then."<<set $request = true>>

"I'll consider it... I'm not going to say yes or no right now." Nayeli says.

"A schedule is better, since that means you'll actually quit." Taya says. "I can live with that."

"Same here," Sarai says. "That means it's on the horizon."

"Okay," Nayeli says. "If you want any chance of us being together, I'm going to have to make a [[request|requestmoment]] of my own."<<set $request = true>>

passages.name: this afternoon
passages.text:
"Yeah, I'm going to be in one of the recording studios working on my debut single."

Ashley Evans squeals. "This is so exciting! I can't wait to hear your single."

"After this I've got a music video and promotional touring to worry about. I'm not even sure what my image is supposed to be, but all of these things are happening so fast."

"Are you excited or scared?"

* [[Excited]]
* [[Scared]]
* [[Both]]

passages.name: Let the lie go
passages.text: You let the lie go. You know Taya's lying to cover Nayeli's ass. <<if $taya_covered>>It's not like she hasn't done that for you before.<<endif>>\n\n"Get the fuck out of my apartment." Sarai points at the door. "You're bullshitting me. You're a liar and she's a whore. You can both rot for your lies somewhere else.<<if $hotel>> Get her a fancy hotel like you did when you ran away wih Jerri.<<endif>> [[I don't care|out of my sight]]."

passages.name: sing2
passages.text:
You feel like you're bouncing on air at lunch the next day. You let yourself have an extra spoonful of yellow rice with your herby chicken to celebrate. You hum as you chew on your food.

"Hey Miss 97!" Ashley Evans sits beside you. She opted for the grilled ham and cheese and tomato soup meal.

"96 more spots to go," you say. Your single helped you make it on to the Pickford Top 100 Chart.

"That's only if you don't fall in any way. The 90's are tooooough to stay in."

"Can you bring the positive Ashley Evans back? I miss her."

"Oopsie. Um, I'm sure there's no way you'll fall, because you're great!" Ashley Evans cheers. "How about that?"

"That's better."

"Does your song come with [[a music video]]?"

passages.name: Tell her you're in a hurry.
passages.text:
"I'm in a hurry here. Sorry if I sounded like I was insincere. I've got to go." As you're about to, she grabs your arm.

She lowers her sunglasses. "Don't you know who I am?"

"No." You break out of her grasp, and run to get to the front doors of Estrella Entertainment HQ. You don't have time to talk to this girl, whoever she is. You've got better things to do, like not getting fired for [[being late]].

passages.name: Blame yourself for this
passages.text:
"You're not the one who fucked up," you tell her. "We're the ones who fucked up by making you feel that way. No one should feel used."

A body? Is that all she is to you?

You think over your memories with her. <<if $kissed_n>>The first kiss you shared.<<endif>> <<if $starry>>The first time you shared together.<<endif>> <<if $threes>>The first time you were with her and Sarai.<<endif>> <<if $cool_song>>The tater tot song.<<endif>> <<if $sad_song>>The vulture culture song.<<endif>> Her coaching you through difficult guitar parts. Your voices melding together when you sing.

Is that all you have with her? A bunch of memories related to the two associations that hurt her the most.

"I'll take you out more often. We can do other things that you like," you say. "Movies? Art? Rock climbing? A restaurant? [[Anything]]'s fine."

passages.name: one-time deal
passages.text:
She makes sure to remind you that you have dance practice tomorrow at the Estrella Entertainment HQ, and for you to not be late or she'll have your head.

After seeing her collection of Chinese war swords, you believe her when she says that.

She also tells you that you need to make a good impression on the other Estrella talents. Allies are valuable. Making friends with the right girls leads to better buzz.

"It would be nice for your friendships to be real, but that isn't required. What is required is for you to make your fans believe it."

The best thing she tells you, though, is that she's put an advancement in your account so you can get yourself a hotel [[next time]].

passages.name: tell her to calm down
passages.text:
"Which bathroom did Nayeli go to? We shouldn't lose her in a place like this." The crowd's gotten thicker all around you.

"Don't leave me too..." Taya wraps her arms around you. "We've both been so stressed lately. I wanna have fun. I used to have fun with this stuff all the time. Oh, Jerri Dairy, did you know what you took just now? You must've, because you're Jerri Larry, and Jerri Larry's real smart. Why else would you have swallowed it, yeah? Yeah?"

You look into Taya's eyes. They're practically all-black, her pupils are blown out so wide. Someone taps you on the back and you nearly jump out of your skin.

"Water," Nayeli says, jamming a water bottle into Taya's hand. She takes the empty glass from her. Then she starts yelling, saying all sorts of stuff about how irresponsible Taya is, and that she can't believe she did this. What did she do? Is Taya in trouble? Do you have to protect her? Taya never needs saving. Taya does all the saving on her own. Why's Nayeli [[so angry]]?

passages.name: oldman
passages.text:
<<if $comments_yes>>You decide to disregard their advice.<<endif>><<if $comments_no>>You decide to take their advice.<<endif>>

"Are you up for playing something?" Nayeli finishes up what she's doing to the guitar.

"I've got to rest my voice because of that music video shoot."

"Don't you mime the words?"

"They want me to sing it so it looks more real. It's rough," you rub your throat. You'll have to make yourself some tea later.

"Lasagna's going to be done soon. It's [[in the oven]]." Sarai announces.

passages.name: Stay on your side.
passages.text: You'd rather not make things complicated this early on. You wish her a good night, then turn over to get to [[sleep.|SleepA]]

passages.name: The door opens.
passages.text:
What you see when you go to greet Sarai isn't the Sarai you're used to seeing. This Sarai looks worn out, weathered. Her clothes are wrinkled. Nayeli keeps her distance.

"Sorry, I'm going to need the bed tonight." She goes straight to the kitchen and checks the bottom cupboard.

"What's wrong?"

"It's not something for either of you to worry about." She pulls out a bottle of bourbon and a two liter of ginger ale. "I'd rather work stay at work. How were your days?"

"I slept all day and played guitar with Jerri when she got home." You notice a key detail missing. Is it a secret?

"I started working on my first single today."

"That's nice. I'll blast it in my car when it comes out." Sarai mixes the liquids together in a [[glass of ice]].

passages.name: Initiate sex.
passages.text: Sarai's more than receptive to it. She turns you onto your back and holds her body over yours. You help her lips find yours in the darkness. <<if not $starry>>She happily gives you the attention that you've been craving.<<endif>><<set $starry_s>>\n\n[[...|fall asleep]]

passages.name: Tell her she didn't have to.
passages.text:
"You look amazing."

"I know," Taya smiles widely. "Thanks for noticing."

"How [[couldn't]] I?"

passages.name: walking
passages.text:
"It's not like that at all. I had a great time. I like you," you hurry after her.<<set $avoid_3 = true>>

"I've got to get back to my place now. Alone. Not because I'm butthurt," she says. "But because this is part of the dance, okay? A little back-and-forth."

Taya stops and turns around. "I'm not mad at you. I just think it's shit you can't kiss somebody you like because you're afraid of what everybody else thinks."

"It's part of the business."

"Try not to let it rule your life. Wanna walk to the station with me?"

"Yeah, [[let's go|laughing all the way]]."

passages.name: spring into action
passages.text:
You race down the stairs, nearly tripping in your haste. The streets race you by, your hair flipping back and forth as you turn your head left and right to find her. She can't have gone far.

What if she got on a bus? What if she got lucky and is halfway across the city? She could be anywhere.

Nayeli could be...

gone.

And if she's gone, that means you failed. You failed her. You failed Sarai. You failed Taya. You failed yourself.

How can you [[call yourself an idol]] when you can't even make the people you care about the most happy?

passages.name: gold
passages.text:
"You're both babies. You're definitely not adults," Nayeli says.

Taya whines. "How come you only call me baby when we're having sex?"

"Hey! She calls me that too!" You can't believe this shit.

"No way! Nayeli, you're such a dickhead. You have to come up with different nicknames for everyone. We can't all be your baby."

"I'm not talking to you guys." Nayeli totally lies when she says that. "You're worse than Sarai when she's drunk. God..."

"I'm dating a drunk-o, a robot, and a fairy princess." Taya says.

"And I'm dating an asshole." Nayeli's not looking so good. What's wrong with your Yeli baby? Can you call her that too? You can understand why she calls everyone the same thing. It's easier to remember that. And, come to think of it, it's more fair if everyone has the same nickname. You like Nayeli's plan. She has lots of good plans.

You're happy you're dating Nayeli.

"You like it. That's why you'll [[never leave]]," Taya tells Nayeli.

passages.name: On it
passages.text:
You walk into Sarai and Nayeli's bedroom. "Hey, Taya told me you were punching candy or something."

Nayeli gives you a playful shove. "Are you ready?"

"You're a rock star! Are you stressed?"

"I used to be one," she says quietly.

"And you still are tonight. Seriously, are you ready to do this? Because if you're not, we can cancel."

"We're not cancelling shit. I'm ready." Nayeli says. "I'd be more confident if Sarai and Taya weren't around for my comeback performance, but, hey. That's girlfriends for you, worming their way into everything."

Comeback performance. You smile at that. That means that tonight could be [[the first of many]] if nothing goes wrong.

passages.name: JS
hard-to-reach
passages.text:
When she's done scrubbing your back, you ask her, "what about the front?"

Neither one of you behaves after that.

And [[no one's complaining|nextscene]].

passages.name: fear
passages.text: "It doesn't seem like you have any room in your life for fear," you tell her.\n\n"Ooh, really? You think I'm fearless? That's great." Ashley Evans takes a long sip of her milk. "That's one of Shannon's rules. You can't let anyone see you [[sweat]]."

passages.name: Finish searching.
passages.text: smokehouseblues posted 4 days ago, "i feel like jerri's all over the news" Pinky posted 4 days ago, "Estrella Entertainment is pushing Jerri hard. I like it! She's adorable." hardboiledeggs posted 4 days ago, "jerri is bae. she's 75 on the pickford chart" estrellaisbestrella posted 4 days ago, "Jerri is so nice in-person too. She's personable." JNFan posted 4 days ago, "Jerri and Taya are SO CUTE!!! AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH" The rest of the conversation devolves into a series of posts gushing about you and your relationship with Taya. [[Close your laptop]].

passages.name: your research
passages.text: Your self-doubt drowns out your excitement. It's too dark to see what they're doing on the couch, anyway. You retreat back to the bed, content with just listening.\n\nYou fall [[asleep|Sleep.]] some time later.

passages.name: don't
passages.text: "Some people think it's easier to get ahead when other girls get dragged down." Ashley Evans sighs. "I'm not like that, though. I'd never stab an Estrella Girl in the back. It feels like some of the girls here would do it in a heartbeat." "In a heartbeat, with a smile." "Yeah! Whatever it takes to get to #1 on the Pickford Chart." You line up together for the Asian noodles at the Around-the-World station. When it's your turn, Ashley Evans scoops up as much chicken as she can into her noodle bowl. You load up on vegetables and sauce. You sit at the nearest empty table. Beep, beep. "Is that your phone?" You ask. "[[Yeppers!|phone]]"

passages.name: airtime
passages.text:
"Is this 'clear the air time?'" Taya asks.

"...Yes," you tentatively say. "No one should attack anyone. Discussion needs to stay calm. If it doesn't, then we're not going to get anywhere."

"I know where the problem started." Taya says. "It was when Sarai laid down so many rules and forced group monogamy on us. We had these stupid rules even before you showed up, Jerri. They were around when I first joined and maybe they were there before that."

"I've had bad experiences without them. The rules make me comfortable." Sarai shakes her head. "So what if that means I'm pushing 'group monogamy?' That's what makes me happy."

"'Group monogamy' is still polyamory," Nayeli says. "The rules are my fault. Something happened with me, one of our exes, and someone else. It's to [[keep us safe]]."

passages.name: Get coffee
passages.text:
You let Taya buy you a cup of something with a strong espresso shot. It's warm and more than welcome.

"You're going to love the name that I gave you guys," Taya says.

"I'll kill you if it's something bad." Nayeli says, glaring at her.

"Oh, it's certainly not a lie... [[You'll see|more than welcome]]!"

passages.name: too much of one thing or the other
passages.text:
"What kind of look are you going for?" Sarai asks.

"Whatever look that Taya's into." You spin the dress rack around.

"Something that's a bit of Nayeli's style and a bit of mine."

"You're, like, tailored. You always look smart and sharp in whatever you wear."

"That's part of working in an office," she says.

"No, it's not just your business attire. It's your casual clothes, too. You're always put-together. It's like you never have an off-day." You sigh. Your life feels like [[a perpetual off-day]].

passages.name: Tell her she looks amazing.
passages.text: "You didn't have to. You didn't have to put that much effort in for me."\n\n"Oh, it was worth it." Taya smiles at you and something in your chest [[flutters|couldn't]].

passages.name: this girlfriend of yours
passages.text:
"Y-you want to know about her?"

"Yes. Is that a problem?" Even if it was, you feel like you couldn't say it. You're relieved that she seems genuinely interested, though.

"No, not at all. She's studying Finance and Management Information Systems."

"That sounds impressive."

"I know." You want to pat yourself on the back. "Honestly, I have no idea where to take her for dinner. I want to blow her away."

"Your presence is enough to do that. You're an Estrella Girl." Shannon takes out another sticky note and [[starts writing something down]].

passages.name: Nevermind
passages.text:
You stop yourself mid-step.

Nah...

You're good.

[[You smile to yourself and head back to your apartment.|theend]]

links.text: You smile to yourself and head back to your apartment.

passages.name: over a webcam
passages.text:
"It makes me feel like a piece of shit! What the fuck is wrong with me if you're a camgirl? I've got money. I can help you. I've got everything you want. So what the fuck does that make me, huh?" Taya holds her hand over her chest. "A fucking loser, that's what."

"This is all about you then? You can't feel shitty but I can? What the fuck is that, Taya?"

"What do you want me to say? I'm sick of talking about this. I've tried to help you but you don't want it."

"Maybe I shouldn't be with you guys... I can't stop, and you can't accept it. Why should I be with any of you?"

*[[Convince her to compromise]].
*[[Let her go]].

passages.name: Leave
passages.text:
"Yeah," you whisper to her. "Let's go."

Taya announces your plans to the others. "We're going to go."

"Is something wrong?" Sarai frowns.

"We all need time to breathe and let what's going on soak in. Don't deny that you're as upset as Nayeli about this. You're just showing it differently, Sarai." Taya says.

"Sure..." She looks at the floor.

"We'll come back tomorrow and we can talk about it more then. Okay?"

You're glad that Taya showed up to do damage control. You're not sure how you could've handled everyone's reactions on your own.

After shoving a few of your things into a backpack, you leave with Taya for a hotel. She makes a phone call on the way out the door, like it's absolutely no problem for her to spend a couple hundred dollars for a breather. She has her credit card number [[memorized]].

passages.name: the subject
passages.text:
"Um...this is weird to say, but I'm kind of homeless right now."

"What happened to your drummer friend? Uh, what was her name again...?"

"Alison."

"Right."

"Kicked me out."

"Too bad. She was hot. And the cute Norwegian girl?"

"She was Finnish and finished with me."

"How about the shark bite girl?"

"What? She got stung by a jellyfish. I broke it off with her. She wanted to get too serious too fast." You blow into your cup, spreading what's left of the foam. "I told her I didn't want to stop seeing other people and she freaked out."

"Because the only way to show you're serious about someone is to [[only be with them]]," Sarai says sarcastically.

passages.name: something big
passages.text:
"You're back in the studio already? Didn't your CD just come out?"

"An Estrella Girl's work is never done." You slurp on your soup. "Shannon says that since my sales are looking good, they want to get me recording again."

"I hope they give me a new song soon too. I've been stuck in 71st place forever."

"You better watch out. I'm gaining on you," you tease her.

Ashley Evans smiles. "I am. I'm definitely watching out for you."

You [[finish eating together]] and then go on with your days.

passages.name: the problem
passages.text:
"You're supposed to be a good example for people everywhere. Going into this, I warned you that you had a lot of bad stereotypes to overcome. This meant that you were supposed to be as upstanding of a citizen as possible," Shannon goes on. "You were supposed to be the perfect girl-next-door, normal besides that one factor to your personality."

"I'm as normal as anyone else," you speak up.

"You were supposed to be better than that. That's what being an idol is about." She says. "You're supposed to be unreachable, the impossible, the perfect mold that others want to fit themselves into. You're suppoed to be something special for the downtrodden, instead of...[[whoever this person is]]."

passages.name: otherend
passages.text:
<<if $company>>Your star continues to rise. You're somewhere in the Top 60s on the Pickford Top 100 Chart. It's been a while since you last checked. There are rumors that you'll be doing cross-promotional duet with Cameo. You wonder if she remembers you from way back when, when you were new to the industry and its undercurrents...

But rumors are rumors. Until Shannon says something for sure, [[you'll just wait|be a laugh]].<<else>>No longer being an Estrella Girl has given you time to pursue other things, like getting yourself a job at an ice cream shop so you won't burn through your earnings from your pop star life.

You're saving up money to return to school. You're thinking about studying something music or business-related, since you have an insider's view to the entertainment industry you'd like to put to good use. Maybe one day, you'll take Shannon's job.

That'd [[be a laugh]].<<endif>>

passages.name: bar
passages.text: You're a year away from 21, but the bar overlooked your age. That's a perk of being [[cheap entertainment|casual]].

passages.name: you wanted us
passages.text: "I thought you wanted to, with me." Nayeli looks straight at you. "I didn't think it wouldn't be okay. Didn't you and Taya do the same thing when Sarai set you up?" "No! Don't drag me into this." Taya takes a step back. "This is you guys' drama." "I didn't set anyone up. I was trying to be nice and give you guys your space to be able to talk. Then, this happened." She keeps her eyes away from you. "You make me sound like a Madame, goddammit. What kind of person do you take me for?" "I'm sorry." Nayeli says it first. "I must've gotten my signals crossed somehow." "Same here. I'm sorry," you [[follow suit]].

passages.name: part3
passages.text: <<if $for_the_best>>[[...|melancholy]]<<endif>><<if $all_together_now>>[[...|quadend]]<<endif>><<if not $for_the_best and not $all_together_now>>[[...|otherend]]<<endif>>...{on.}
