passages.name: we never gave up
passages.text:
"If you give up, it's over," Miya K agrees. "And be aware of your weaknesses so you can work on them. When I started out, it was like I had two left feet. Shannon can tell you this, but I made sure I was in the dance studio every day, even the days when I wasn't scheduled for it, so I could get better. It's what you have to do."

"Don't forget to have fun!" Ashley Evans gives you a thumbs up. "Having fun is important."

"But not too much fun," Shannon clarifies. "Fun can have its consequences. Now, Jerri, do you have any questions for your cohort?"

"Ah, none that I can think of right now..."

"Alright, then, you're all dismissed for lunch. They're serving tilapia and rice today."

"Great, we can all eat together and everything." Lily Trilly says. Rayna and Miya K nod in agreement. "That way if you have any questions, Jerri, we can let you know."

"That's exactly what I want to hear. [[Have a nice day, ladies.|tilapia and rice]]"

passages.name: Move over to Nayeli's.
passages.text:
Her body tenses up when you cuddle up to her. It's too dark to read her facial expression. You ask her if she's okay.

"We don't have to do this," Nayeli whispers. "We don't have to go any faster than we want to. Just to make that clear."

"Do you want to?" You ease yourself against her slowly, testing her for a reaction. She puts her hand on your hip. Her thumb rubs against the patch of skin revealed when your shirt rode up. Nayeli's as tentative as you are. You can feel the tension in her palm.

"Yeah... You're attractive and I'm weak. Good combination."

You get a surge of confidence from her compliment. The darkness is helping a little too, you're sure.

A small voice in the back of your head still wonders if this is something you should be doing. You can either drown it out or listen to it.

* [[Back off.]]
* [[Go for it.|Go for it][$starry = true]]

passages.name: official
passages.text:
Official's such a loaded word, as if everything you did together before this week didn't count for anything because it wasn't "officially" on the books. You've had good times with Sarai: trips to farmer's markets, trips to the park to read books aloud to each other (usually a sci-fi novel she picked out), store browsing, and private card trick shows.

You haven't had the time to do those things together again, but those were all things that you cherished, and continue to cherish.

"Told you my bed was more comfortable than all of those hotel beds," she grins.

"And my friends' beds and such..." You relive the embarassment of the places that you [[took her to]].

passages.name: overwhelm
passages.text: She's too overwhelmed with her emotions to say anything to that. You help her into her pajamas and get her into bed.\n\nYour sleep's <<if $othergirlfriend>>[[fitful|the coldest]]<<else>>[[fitful|mistaken]]<<endif>>.

passages.name: have to walk
passages.text:
"What do you want, Taya?" You ask her. "Is whatever you're asking for something you'll actually appreciate having or will you still want 'more?'"

"It's not about having more." Taya says. "When you're with Sarai, you're with her 'family.' You can't just be with Sarai. You're with her network, her rules, her everything. It's...it's too heavy sometimes."

"Is it heavy enough for either of you to leave?" Nayeli asks.

You wonder if part of Taya's problem is that she wasn't reassured enough. She can act like she's full of herself sometimes, bu she may have needed more reassurance than all of them combined.

Having no structure would mean that she'd be able to freely get reassurance from whoever she wanted. No rules, no bridges to cross. None of that. You lived that life [[before you entered this quadship]].

passages.name: to admit that
passages.text:
"Is that how you feel?" Sarai takes her hand off of her. "Are we all mitakes to you? Are we just holding you back?"

You don't say anything. You just let yourself quietly cry.

For the first time in your life, [[you wish you were alone]].

passages.name: fail
passages.text:
It doesn't work.

You try to win someone over with a different set of nouns:
* [[Exuberance|fail2]]
* [[Sophistication|fail2]]
* [[Desperation|fail2]]

passages.name: changing parties
passages.text:
"I forgot how old I was, but it was definitely early middle school. I realized that I didn't want to be the hot girl, I wanted to be with her."

"Hey, and look at you, you've gone and done both." Taya smiles. "Do your parents know?"

"It wasn't my choice. They forced it out of me."

"I blurted it out one day at dinner. We were having cilantro-lime chicken. All these years and I haven't forgotten... That chicken was damn good," she sighs at the memory. "They were shocked, but they shouldn't have been. I mean c'mon, I had pictures of girls all over my room."

"They probably thought you were collecting art."

"Of two girls kissing?"

"Denial, then. It's a lot to take. It's like uncovering [[a new side of you]]."

passages.name: the quality
passages.text:
You're alone in a room with someone whose heart you're breaking. Who's going to comfort you now?

"I don't want to fucking break up with you," you wipe some of your tears away. "Stop talking like that."

She lets go of you. "I'm getting under the blanket. Come with me."

You take off your shoes and get under the covers with her. She pulls the blanket all the way over your heads. It's like you're in a hot cave.

"I used to hide like this when I was a kid. It helps when you're feeling vulnerable. God knows that's exactly how I feel right now." Taya places her hands on the side of your face. You know she can feel how wet your cheeks are. You [[sniffle]] pathetically. You're feeling rather vulnerable yourself.

passages.name: Grab Nayeli and kiss her first.
passages.text:
You kiss Nayeli first. It's fast, cut off when Sarai eases you over to get on top of her.

"You don't have to be so gentle with her," Nayeli tells her. "She can handle it."

You're in for [[quite the night|waiting]] (in a good way).<<set $tired = true>><<set $threes = true>>

passages.name: smirks
passages.text:
"Anyway, how about that private concert?"

"You're making me nervous." You don't know why it's so easy for Taya to get to you like this. You cover your face with your hand.

"Oh no, no, no. That kind of attitude won't do for a pop star."

"I know...but it's weird doing this in front of you."

"You sing with Nayeli all the time."

"We only do covers and random stuff. I've never sung my own stuff with her." You look off to the side. "This song's going to sound weird without the dance track with it."

"I'll be the judge of that," Taya says.

"Promise not to laugh."

"I promise."

"And um, put a pillow over your face."

"What? What kind of private concert [[forces you to be blind]]?"

passages.name: groundrules
passages.text:
Your head starts to spin as Sarai goes over everything. Exclusivity to one another. Regular testing. Nayeli and Taya have to inform Sarai of anything they do with you first. She has to stay in the loop. Nothing secretive. <<if $starry>>You hang your head.<<endif>>

"What was that last rule again?" Taya puts her hand on her hip.

"You have to keep me in the loop."

"No, no, no. What's with this Primary and Secondary shit you're pulling out of nowhere?"

"You know that's not what it is."

"[[New Relationship Energy]]," Nayeli says as if that's the answer to all of life's questions.

passages.name: Join them
passages.text:
You decide to join them.

"I wouldn't miss this for the world," you say.

This is going to be it...

After tonight, everything changes.

[[...]]

passages.name: You remained with the company
passages.text:
Ashley Evans bounces over to you.

"Hey, Jerri! Are you leaving for the day or are you staying for extra studio practice?"

You consider it. "I might."

"Ooh, did you check the Pickford Top 100? That scandal's done wonders for everyone's popularity. Our ranks have gone up." She pats you on the arm. "I'm glad you're staying with Estrella. I was worried this would make you leave."

"No. It'll take more than this to make me quit. I've worked too hard for this to give up now."

"Perfect! The world needs its favorite gay idol."

"I'll see you next week." You close up your locker. "I forgot that I'm needed at home."

"[[Bye|go home]]!"

passages.name: raise your blanket
passages.text:
The sound of covers shifting wake you up. It's still dark in the room.

"Stop, we can't do this here," you hear Nayeli whisper. There's a whine sound before you feel them get off the bed. They leave the room.

The couch in the other room creaks.

*[[Give them privacy. Go back to sleep.]]
*[[Watch them.]]
<<if $starry or $starry2>>* [[Join them.]]<<endif>>

links.text: Give them privacy. Go back to sleep.

destination.name: Give them privacy. Go back to sleep.

passages.name: Next page.
passages.text: rahul_cookie posted 1 day ago: "mayb its not what we think. mayb this girl kissed jerri. a fan???" estrellaisbestrella posted 0 days ago: "No, the angle of the kiss and the way that their bodies are positioned implies familiarity. They knew each other." nerdygirl14 posted 0 days ago: "LOL! GO SIMON-TIMMONS" Pinky posted 0 days ago: "That's off-topic. I'm reporting you to the mods." estrellaisbestrella posted 0 days ago: "Don't back-seat moderate." nerdygirl14 posted 0 days ago: "ESTRELLA SLUTSTRELLA" You <>[[can't read]]<>[[can't read|tayaroom]]<> anymore. You shut your laptop down.

passages.name: be a star
passages.text:
You step out onto the stage. You're in a frilly dress that reaches passed your knees. A microphone's waiting for you. Cameras flash. The overhead lights prevent you from seeing more than the first two rows of your audience. Shannon's chewing on her pen, a notepad in her lap. Your vocal coach sits next to her, fists balled up in anticipation.

You won't let them down.

You close your eyes, count to ten, open them, and [[sing|sing2]].

passages.name: guitar
passages.text: That guitar's been sold since then. You needed the money for food.\n\nNowadays if you do play somewhere, you have to [[borrow one|casual]].

passages.name: like it
passages.text: The three of you retire for bedtime. You had to slink into your room to change. Even if Nayeli's your girlfriend too, you'd rather her see you undress under more confident circumstances. You want to be the one in control, rather than feeling like you have to appease this girl at every second.\n\nYou're thankful that Nayeli's already wearing her pajamas when you [[enter the bedroom]].

passages.name: Walking through a college campus
passages.text:
If you did that...

If you took that walk through a college campus...

You'd see students rushing by in a hurry, this way and that way. It'd make you think of when you were one of them. <<if $company>>You'd have your cap pulled down low over your eyes so no one could recognize you, because on a campus like this one, you're bound to be.<<endif>>

You'd go to the lion statue and take a seat on a nearby bench.

A girl dragging along a too-heavy backpack would pass you by. Something would make her turn around and see you, maybe the cold breeze. And when she'd see you, she'd light right up.

[[And you'd both smile.|theend]]

passages.name: Let her go
passages.text:
"Nayeli, you're right. If you want to be free, then be free," you tell her.

She sighs, closing her eyes. Sarai looks like she's been struck in the stomach. She mumbles something about being understanding.

"I'll think about it," she says. "If you want any chance of us being together, I'm going to have to make one [[request|requestmoment]]."<<set $request = true>>

passages.name: you wish you were alone
passages.text:
You stumble during practice. You're not doing so well. You hardly eat anything at lunch with Ashley Evans. You've got a plate of spaghetti squash you keep stirring around with your fork. Everything's getting to you ten times worse than it should.

<<if $othergirlfriend>>Shannon let you know that you're at risk of losing your sponsors. No one wants you to be the face of anything anymore. You're losing your funding and becoming too much of a liability for Estrella Entertainment. If one more thing goes wrong, then that's it for you. You can kiss being an Estrella Girl goodbye.<<else>>Shannon let you know that you're starting to improve in the eyes of your sponsors. Your audience, though...you've still got a black mark with them. You've been humanized by saying you made a mistake (to err is human), but at the same time, you're villainized. If you don't fix that soon, everything could be all over for you.<<endif>>

"I'm 67!" Ashley Evans announces to you. "Shannon says I'm on the fast-track to reach 50th place in no time at all. You were right about the season. Everything's perfect for me now. Oh... Sorry about that picture. That sucks. At least it shows you who [[your true fans]] are."

passages.name: It's stupid
passages.text:
Your conversation drifts into a comfortable silence until you reach the front steps of the hotel. Taya didn't hold back in her choice. She went all-out.

She continues where she left off before, as if she finally reached a conclusion. "If this isn't the platform that you want to take, Jerri, then you shouldn't have to. It's up to you."

The inside of the hotel is more extravagant than the outside. Clean-cut families in polos walk alongside sweaty workers pushing too-heavy luggage carts. The parents look tired, probably from long hours spent driving or from loud babies on their first-class airplanes.

Young businessmen wearing luxury watches worth more than your entire lifetime salary sit and chat in the lounge. They peek over at a group of ladies nearby, planning out wingman techniques. A couple off to the side watches the two groups, giggling into each other's ear.

A woman decked out in fine jewelry looks at the two of you in confusion. In your casual clothing, you stick out, but what they don't know is that your girlfriend has as much spending power as they do. Looks can be deceiving.

The check-in line is short. Taya hands over her credit card, says something to the receptionist that's poised and concise, then you're off to the elevators. She lets you hold the room key, a swipe card for [[607N]].

passages.name: fail2
passages.text:
Nope, no luck.

You decide to wander. You know that there's a library that will open after 7 AM. You have to walk around until then, to keep yourself from accidentally falling asleep in the street. Your heart's pounding. It's not like you're a stranger to doing something like this, but experience doesn't make it any easier.

A car whips by you, nearly splashing you, as if your night could get any worse. It drives on ahead and then circles back. You're ready to bolt when you spot [[a familiar face]] behind the wheel.

passages.name: memorized
passages.text:
"We could've gone to your dorm," you say to her. Your shoes crunch the leaves on the sidewalk as you walk. The nighttime air is chilly enough for you to pull your sleeves over your hands.

"Nah, my roommate's not the most welcoming person. She's a bitch. That's why I didn't like what Sarai was saying." Taya sighs. "We know exactly what it's like to get shit on for our choices. My roommate thinks I'm the world's biggest slut. Sarai's gotten her heart ripped apart by girls who'd rather be monogamous. She wants it all, and she wants to pretend like no one else has a problem with her wanting it all."

"What about ignoring the haters?"

"You can only do that for so long... Like, I get it, I'm out in other aspects of my life, but this is something different. You can only be so out about being poly since this isn't something everyone's rallying behind." Taya says. "Sarai expects you to be 100% out constantly. It's not like she hangs up a rainbow and poly flag at work, so why do you have to? Why does she get to treat you like you're betraying some kind of cause? [[It's stupid]]."

passages.name: nextdecision
passages.text:
"So, Jerri, where does that leave me and you?" Taya asks. "I might as well go around the circle asking who wants to stay with me."

"I'd like to, but that's up to you," Sarai says.

"We don't see eye-to-eye on a lot of things. If we did stay together, we'd have to work on that," Nayeli says.

*[[Stay with Taya][$stayed_third = true]].
*[[Break up with Taya]].

passages.name: out of my sight
passages.text:
"You're out of control." Taya says.

"You think you're in control? None of this would've happened if it weren't for you." Sarai shoots back. "You and that stupid night."

"Fuck you. Stop acting so high and mighty when you were the one who talked me into bringing the MDMA."

"You told her to?" Nayeli mutters.

"She practically forced them into my hand. Said that she wanted us to have a good time since we weren't ourselves."

Nayeli shakes off her sadness. Her fury's back. "You left me alone with them!"

"While I busted my ass at work for you and it turns out the whole time you didn't care."

"I did care, I did. I just couldn't [[be a freeloader]]."

passages.name: roll over onto your side
passages.text:
Some time later, footsteps enter your room. You don't have to look up to know that it's Nayeli.

"You shouldn't come into someone's room uninvited."

"Isn't that what you just did?" You hope a little humor will defuse the situation.

"Quid pro quo."

"Sorry." You sit up. She's got her clothes back on. Looking up at her like this makes your neck hurt. "Tell Taya I'm sorry too. She's probably real pissed off I interrupted you guys...or she's laughing her head off. Probably the last one, now that I think of it."

"It wasn't Taya." Nayeli gets down to your level. "It was bdchuck, some guy from my chatroom."

"What? You're [[seeing someone else]]?"

passages.name: forgotten
passages.text:
"Sarai seems like she'd be accepting of it," you say.

"She's not." Nayeli shrugs. "Do we have to talk about this?" She plays a C scale and then a D# scale. "We should play something in the key of G."

"Does that include E or E minor?" Playing with Nayeli has really tested your knowledge of music theory.

"Let's go with G, A minor, B minor, C, D, E minor, and F# diminished."

"Can you play the last one on the piano?"

Nayeli presses the F#, A, and C together, letting the chord ring out. "It's a triad."

"See, even music supports polyamory. There's a [[triad]] right there."

passages.name: wrangling children
passages.text:
Their squabbling continues into the night club. They're arguing about the right way to pronounce something. Part of you wants to push into a crowd of people and be carried away. The music pumps out of the speakers loud enough for the bass to shake the floor. Would they miss you if you disappeared?

"I'm gonna get drinks." You yell over the music. You need a strong one.

They're [[too busy]] talking to acknowledge you.

passages.name: continuation
passages.text:
"How about you surprise me? You decide what we're going to do." Taya says after some thought. "Keep it a secret until the day of."

"How am I supposed to know where you want to go without you telling me?"

"Oh, silly Jerri. This wouldn't be as fun if I just told you where I wanted to go. What's dating without a little chase?" Taya says, grinning. "Skipping straight to the end is boring. You have to have the chase, the song, the dance...all of it!"

The door opens. Sarai walks in, humming a tune you think is supposed to be the latest Litany song. She gives Taya a big hug, and you [[an even bigger one]]. "It's so good to see you guys," she mumbles into the top of your head.

passages.name: quadend
passages.text:
You come home after work. <<if $company>>You've bounced back from the scandal. Your rank's somewhere in the 60s. It's been a while since you last checked the Pickford Top 100 Chart, though, so you could be higher than that for all you know.<<else>>You've gotten yourelf a job at an ice cream shop. If anyone recognizes you, they don't say anything. They're probably being polite because they know that you're trying to bury your past. Your plan's to use your earnings from being an Estrella Girl and your ice cream job earnings to go back to school.

You plan on studying something music or buiness-related. You've got an insider's view of the entertainment industry that you want to put to good use.<<endif>>

Someone's playing a keyboard in the bedroom. <<if $company>>You keep that someone a secret from Estrella Entertainment, too afraid of what might happen if they catch wind that you're still with her. <<endif>>Someone else is shuffling cards to the music. And another someone else is calling you to hurry up and get in the room so you don't miss the show.
 
This is how it should be...
[[with no one else but the four of you|theend]].

Your heart's the warmest it's ever been.

links.text: with no one else but the four of you

passages.name: Stand down
passages.text: You stand down, ready for whatever [[tirade|scoffs]] Nayeli is about to embark on.

passages.name: something more interesting
passages.text:
"Oh, and I've got a date tonight. I'm the one who has to pick out what we're going to do."

Shanon perks up at that. "First date?"

"Yeah."

"What's he like?"

You break off eye contact at that question. This is it. The type of question that could spell the end of your career if you're honest. The type of question that could put you far deep into the caverns of a closet that you haven't been in for years and years.

"Um, funny that you ask that... He's...um..."

How [[honest]] do you want to be?

passages.name: couldn't
passages.text:
"Don't act like you're not gorgeous yourself." Taya doesn't hide the up-and-down checking she does with her eyes. "Gorgeous girl taking me to a gorgeous restaurant. What did I do in a past life to make me this lucky?"

"Do you believe in past lives?"

"It's a fun thought to entertain." A waitress drop off a glass of ice water for her. Taya says thanks. "The people that go to Kitagawa's are flush, aren't they? Everyone looks so nice."

"Do you normally eat at places like this?" It's not like Taya isn't flush herself, based on  what she's wearing and what Sarai's told you about her.

"Only on special occasions." She looks at herself in the reflection of her glass. "Sarai likes to insist on paying and Nayeli hates feeling like a [[charity case]], so..."

passages.name: foodtime
passages.text:
You let her know your choice. She smiles and says that it sounds delicious. Taya asks if you want anything to drink, as she gestures to that sensor machine you were looking at earlier. "Take whatever you want. It'll be charged to my card and won't matter."

"Ah, sure, I might have a little bit of something."

"Ugh, these all look like old man drinks. Scotch? Whiskey? Sarai's into whiskey, I think. It tastes like burning piss to me."

You remember that night when she was throwing back bourbon like it was nothing. After Taya calls room service to put in your oder, you bring it up to her. "Yeah, I didn't know she was that into it until she came home one night and hit the bottle hard. I've never seen someone drink that much without flinching."

Taya's smile fades. "Did anything bad happen that night."

"[[Nope.]]"

passages.name: Play
passages.text:
You grab her guitar and start to play. You let your mind check out, allowing your current feelings to take over.<<set $played_guitar = true>>

<<if $route_a>>It takes a moment for your song to get its legs. By the time it does, you're palm muting its accents to give it a driving edge. Tapping on the guitar itself allows you to put some percussion into the rhythm. Once you've got your beat consistently worked out, you figure out your chord changes. You're working with all power chords even though you're playing an acoustic guitar.

You remember what Nayeli told you last night, about how you don't meld your voice with the guitar's. You've got to prove her wrong. You have to show her that you're more than a decent musician.<<endif>><<if $route_b>>It takes a moment for your song to get its legs. By the time it does, you're playing a gentle song that reminds you of a spring breeze. Your chord changes are leisurely, making easy switches from C to G to D. Your thoughts drift over to all of your hopes about doing well in both your new relationship and your entertainment career.<<endif>>

As you open your mouth to sing, you hear [[someone beat you to it]].

passages.name: goodbye to ourselves the way we are now
passages.text:
"Is this the right way...for us to walk away from this and let the pieces fall back together however they may?" You ask the group.

"Laissez-faire approaches like that usually result in never seeing each other again," Taya says.

"I don't like that idea." Nayeli says. "I don't like this whole conversation. It's like we're giving up. Is that what's happening here, we're giving up on us?"

*[[It's for the best][$for_the_best = true]].
*[[No, we're not]].

passages.name: more work
passages.text:
"Nothing ever happens without work." Taya says. "That's why I like girls like you. They can't rest at mediocrity. They're always working to get better. Ambition's sexy."

"You're ambitious too, then." You blush.

"Heh, I guess you could say that. Watch out, I'm going to conquer the world some day."

"Or just mine."

"I'm working on that."

The waitress arrives with your drinks. The Midori Sour is a pretty shade of green in a stout glass. The Autumn Delight's a transluscent orange-brown in a tall glass, two stemmed cherries bobbing inside of it. She asks you if you're ready now.

"We can get [[anything you want]]," Taya tells you.

passages.name: Keep eating your dinner.
passages.text: You keep your head down, forking more cheesey noodles into your mouth. You're not getting through to this woman, so why keep [[trying|yep]]?

passages.name: Eat the lasagna
passages.text: You can afford a cheat night every now and then, can't you?\n\nYou enjoy the lasagna once it's [[ready]].

passages.name: endmoment
passages.text:
"How about us, Taya?" Sarai asks her.

<<if $stayed_first_third>>"Yeah, I'll stay with you,"<<endif>><<if $stayed_first>>"No, I'm washing my hands of everything,"<<endif>><<if $stayed_third>>"Yes, I'll stay with you,"<<endif>> Taya says.

"This is it, then. The moment we leave, that's the end of the quad as we once knew it." You say.

"It was a good run while it lasted," Nayeli says. She shrugs, shoving her hands into [[the pockets of her jacket]].

passages.name: some forum pages
passages.text: rahul_cookie posted 24 days ago, "YO JERRI IS BEST GIRL" nerdygirl14 posted 24 days ago, "stfu lool" rahul_cookie posted 24 days ago, "lol hw about no. did you hear her new song??" estrellaisbestrella posted 24 days ago, "She's grown as an artist. Her latest song reminded me of Heloise." Pinky posted 24 days ago, "Her new song's WAY better than the old one. The old one: forgettable. This new one: mind-blowing." JNFan posted 24 days ago, "jerri makes me so :D :D :D love that she isn't afraid to be who she is. we needed someone like her!!" rahul_cookie posted 23 days ago, "her gf is cute" nerdygirl14 posted 23 days ago, "yassssss" estrellaisbestrella posted 23 days ago, "I wonder if there will be more queer Estrella Girls, or will Jerri be the only one?" There are no more replies. [[Do a new search.]]

passages.name: funk
passages.text:
One Jerri's a star. She's important. She stands for everything queer and positive. The other Jerri's been struggling. She watches Estrella Girl Jerri from her side of the mirror. She should be happy. She should be a lot of things...

She shouldn't feel like she's someone different from Estrella Girl Jerri. She's the same person. She's bouncy, she's happy, she's never sad. She does everything right the first time. She's cute. She never fights with her girlfriends. She has no room in her life for problems.

You thought you were doing a good job of hiding what you're going through, but apparently you were wrong. You call Nayeli into the room. "We're going out tonight."

"Okay," she says. You're surprised she doesn't have a problem with it.

"Are you going to get us a discount on everything? We got one when we went to Red Lady's. That was awesome." Taya says.

"No, I'd rather go as [[a normal person]]," you tell her.

passages.name: A coffee shop to hear live music
passages.text:
If you did that...

If you took that walk...

You'd go in and sit down in the back so no one would notice you. <<if $company>>You'd wear a cap pulled low over your eyes and a scarf thick enough to come over your mouth.<<endif>>

You'd watch over all the acts as they go up for the open mic, waiting for the one you're looking for. And when she does step on, carrying her guitar, she'll miss you in the audience at first. That's why she'll be able to say that she's dedicating her song to a lost love.

When she reaches her last note, you'll catch her eye.

[[You'll catch her eye, and you'll both smile.|theend]]

links.text: You'll catch her eye, and you'll both smile.

passages.name: pierce
passages.text:
"As spoken by my favorite little green man, 'do or do not. There is no try.'" Sarai grins.

"Yeah, you should go to bed just for saying that." Nayeli says with a sigh. Her sigh is so deep it's like she's been putting up with bad quotes for years. Sarai kisses your forehead then skips off to the bathroom to brush her teeth.

You don't notice that Nayeli's gone until she comes back with a pillow and blankets for you.

"Hey, while we're alone, I wanted to check your pulse on everything. You're cool with this, right? Sarai told me you were, but this is my first time doing something like this so I just wanted to hear it from you that you were okay and stuff. Yeah." The words tumble out of you.

She lays the blanket over your legs and tucks the pillow off to the side. "It's not a big deal. There's better things to worry about than you."

* [[Press]].
* [[Let it go]].

passages.name: You're everywhere
passages.text:
She claps her book closed. "We should do something fun tonight. It's Saturday! I know a club we can totally get into. It's dark so no one will bother you. <<if $openmic>>You won't have to wear a cat mask.<<endif>>"

"<<if $openmic>>Yeah, as long as I don't have to wear that stupid mask, I'm in.<<else>>I'm in as long as it's dark.<<endif>>"

"We should make Nayeli come. Sarai's working late."

"I don't know...Nayeli's not a fan of crowds."

"Oh, c'mon. Invite her!" Taya encourages you. "This way me and Nayeli can like, tag-team to get you out of your [[funk]]. I can't do it alone."

passages.name: "My other girlfriend."
passages.text:
"She's my other girlfriend. She's not the only one, either. I know you all might be shocked right now, but who I am and what I'm doing with my life isn't strange. It's normal. This is me. I'm a polyamor—"<<set $othergirlfriend = true>>

You shut the television off. You don't need to re-live that again.

You told Nayeli and Sarai to watch the press conference with you. They're both equally surprised at what you said.

"Was Estrella okay with that?" Nayeli asks.

"N-no, they weren't." You hide your face in the fabric of the couch, not wanting either of them to see you cry.

"You might not think it right now, but you did a good thing for people like us," Sarai rubs your back.

You wonder when you'll [[start thinking|you wish you were alone]] that.

passages.name: might be over
passages.text:
Nayeli, one of Sarai's [[girlfriends]], lives with her. She [[doesn't speak much]] when you're introduced to her, and that doesn't change over dinner. Several times, you try to spark up some conversation with her, but she's not having it. You'd have more luck getting a fox to hatch out of an egg.

She's more preoccupied with [[texting on her phone]] than anything else. Part of you wants to toss her phone into a blender and push the "on" button.

The three of you sit on the scratched-up couch, eating the baked ziti that Sarai made to welcome you to your new home.

When Nayeli stretches, you notice that she's got a cartoon gecko tattooed on her bicep.

* [[Ask Nayeli about the gecko.]]
* [[Keep eating your dinner.]]

passages.name: Stay with both Sarai and Taya
passages.text:
"I'd like to stay with both of you," you say.

<<if $stayed_second>>"So in the end, you're picking everyone," Taya points out.

"I care about all of you. I didn't want to leave you." You couldn't do it.

"That's cool..."

<<endif>>"Thank you," Sarai says.

"Yeah, [[thanks|endmoment]], Jerri." Taya smiles.

passages.name: laughing all the way
passages.text:
Over the next few weeks, you fall into a pattern with your girlfriends and your work life. Things become routine. You work hard at Estrella Entertainment HQ, eat a globally-themed lunch with Ashley Evans, and go home. You cook and watch cardistry videos with Sarai, play music and sing with Nayeli, and go on dates and have adventures around the city with Taya.

The song you were working on is finished. It has the potential to hit the radio waves.

You've debuted as the latest in a long line of Estrella Girls. They had a grand ceremony for it. You went to the after-party solo, on Shannon's orders. They're putting the finishing touches on their plans for you.

You'll come out to the nation, and you'll [[be a star]].

passages.name: stuffing
passages.text: Once the lights are off, you're on each other with more confidence than you had the night before. You guide her to the places you need her the most. She's a fast learner.<<set $starry2 = true>>\n\nAfterwards, you [[fall asleep]], her head against your chest.

passages.name: beautiful lyrics
passages.text:
Once she brings the song to a good stopping point, you put don the guitar and clap for her. "That was fun. Thanks for letting me play with you. You're such a good singer. <<if $cool_song>>That end note you reached on that tater tot line was superb.<<endif>><<if $sad_song>>That vulture screech you did at the end was superb.<<endif>>"

"Thanks for putting up with my shit." Nayeli smiles. "Heart-to-hearts are difficult for me, but this? I can do this all day."

"That song was a heart-to-heart?"

<<if $sad_song>>"Vulture culture's about being okay with picking up the scraps. The song's about fighting against that."

"Pretty sure vultures do that to live."

"It's a song. Have a little imagination," she pushes your [[shoulder]].<<endif>><<if $cool_song>>"The only way to get tater tots for breakfast is to be a bad kid. Bad kids get wrecked, though, and that sucks. It's a metaphor."

"What's bad about tater tots for breakfast? It'd be like having hash browns on the side."

"It's a song. Have a little imagination," she pushes your [[shoulder]].<<endif>>

passages.name: only be with them
passages.text:
"You're welcome to stay at my place," she continues. "Your timing's pretty great, since our last roommate ended her lease. I'll have to float it by my girlfriends if you want a longterm arrangement, but they know enough about you that I'm sure they'll be okay with it."

A pit forms in your stomach. Yeah, you've been aware that Sarai has other people in her life (she told you that on your first date), but unlike your "people," she's got serious "girlfriend status" people. Sarai's the most serious person you're with at the moment, or rather she's the only person you've got right now.

Everyone else got tired of your shit.

Friends, lovers, family.

Sarai's your only life line.

"If I move in, does that make us girlfriends?"

"I've thought of you as my girlfriend for a while now, but if you want to make it official and all, sure." Sarai takes a sip from her matcha green tea. "We can be girlfriends [[if you move in.]]"

passages.name: "Yep, the one and only."
passages.text:
"I just got back from the store." Taya holds up her bags, as if it isn't obvious. "Figured I'd be nice and drop off a bunch of food for everyone. You'd be shocked at how much two girls eat. Um, three, now that you're here. Cool."

"You're not having any of it?"

"Nah, I can't stay tonight." She puts the bags in the kitchen. "I'd love to, but I've got class in the morning. The professor takes attendance and I already missed twice. One more miss and I lose all my particpation points."

"That sucks!"

"I know! It's literally the worst." Taya grabs the video game controller. "Are you using the TV?"

It's off. "No."

"Got it," she says as she takes off her backpack. It makes a thud when [[it hits the ground]].

passages.name: player
passages.text:
"Okay. Do you want to play or should I? The other person sings."

"I'll play. I want to hear you sing." You take the guitar from her and get into position, crossing your legs so the guitar can balance better. "Do you have a song in mind, or...?"

"We'll make one up. Lay down a steady rhythm."

"And what chords do you want?"

<<if $sad_song>>"G, A minor, C, and D."<<endif>><<if $cool_song>>"I don't know. Something punchy. Make it cool. Bounce around some bar chords of D, E, A, and B."<<endif>>

You slide her guitar pick out of the strings it's wedged between and get to playing. She watches you intently as you do. You mess up a couple of times, but she doesn't say anything. She just watches and waits.

Then, she [[starts singing]].

passages.name: ready
passages.text:
You get ready for bed. You splash water on your face and look at yourself in the mirror.

<<if $threes>>You haven't had sex with them both at once since that night. Did you do something wrong? Did you do too much to one of them and not enough to the other? Too fast? Too slow? You thought you'd been okay, but okay's not good enough. You should've been better than okay.

Then they'd both want you again. Never rest on "okay."

Should you try starting it up tonight or should you let it go? It may have been something that'll have to stay as a memory.<<endif>><<if $starry == true and $threes == false>>You've been in this polyship for over a month now and so far, you haven't had any group sex. Isn't that a hallmark of a polyamorous relationship? Everyone's supposed to share the same bed, and share themselves at the same time. You read all about it.

Are you doing something wrong? Have they compared notes together to figure out that you're not worth their time? It's not like you're ever left in the cold, but one person can only provide so much warmth.

Maybe you're the problem. Maybe something about you isn't working for them.<<endif>><<if not $starry>>You haven't taken the next step with Nayeli yet. It's not like it's required or anything like that... You don't want to push her if she's not ready and willing.

You kiss sometimes, but it never gets too hot and heavy. Are you the issue? Does she think she has to wait for your permission?

In the beginning, everything was all about your choices, your permission to take certain actions. It could be that she's waiting for you to make a decision on this matter, too. You're not used to relationships working this way, with all of this waiting...

Maybe she's not interested in a sexual relationship with you. Just because she's a cam girl, or she's having sex with your other girlfriends, doesn't mean she has to have sex with you at the drop of a hat. It's up to you.<<endif>>

You fix your hair into [[a loose ponytail]] and get yourself to bed.

passages.name: before you entered this quadship
passages.text:
What about you? What do you need now, after everything you've been hrough with them? More flexibility or a polyfamily? The first option clashes too much with Sarai's ideals, so it's one way or the other.

*[[Break up wih Sarai]].
*[[Stay with Sarai|yeahsarai][$stayed_first = true]].

passages.name: not having to depend on others
passages.text: "It's the last one," Nayeli says. "I'll...I'll stop. I don't know what the fuck I'll do but I'll stop."<<set $stopcam = true>>\n\n"[[Thank you|requestmoment]]," Sarai says. She's relieved.

passages.name: have some
passages.text: "Sure." Taya leans over and slips your straw into her mouth. Without breaking eye contact, she takes in a long drag of the Autumn Delight. "Yours is so good." She says it in a way that would normally be reserved for the bedroom. You look away. She starts laughing. "So, you never told me why you picked Chemistry as your major," she says. "I loved AP Chem in high school. Being a chemist might've worked out for me but I had to give this a try." You taste her lipstick on your straw. "Sometimes the things you think you love turn out to be different from what you expect. I was a Software Engineering major for a split second. Hated it. I'd rather do databasing and networking." "Is that [[what you do for fun]]? That is, if you have any time in your life for fun. You seem like a busy woman."

passages.name: if I was
passages.text:
"Sarai's a big girl. She can handle it," Nayeli says.

"So am I a little girl if it's harder for me to handle?"

"No. We all get jealous. Some of us cope with it better, that's all."

"That's all? That sucks."

"We manage it," she says. "Some people see jealousy as something ugly that you have to deny, deny, deny, but I don't. I live through it like all the other shit I live through.'

"Oh...wanna talk about it?"

"Let's shut up and do something better."

You relent, and it is better than talking. [[Way better|waiting]].

passages.name: forehead
passages.text:
"Yeah. I keep thinking that any day now they'll finalize what image they want to have, but I think there's been some setbacks," you say. "I might get to record something soon. That'll be nice."

"I'll play your song 500 times on repeat."

"Please don't."

Taya and Nayeli come back into the living room.

"Did I hear something about you making a song soon?" Taya pumps her fist in the air. "I can't believe I'm going on a date with a celebrity. This weekend's going to be <<if $route_a>>[[the best day of my life]]<<else>>[[the best day of my life|pleasework]]<<endif>>."

links.text: the best day of my life

destination.name: the best day of my life

links.text: the best day of my life

passages.name: Do a new search.
passages.text: PumpkinButterfly posted 18 days ago, "Where can I find Jerri's girlfriend's dress? This is the picture." Pinky posted 18 dayss ago, "I think I found something like that at H&M! See the link." mysteriosa posted 18 days ago, "She has a name!! It's Taylor!!!" estrellaisbestrella posted 18 days ago, "No. It's Taya. She said in an interview that she hates being called Taylor. She changed her name to Taya." nerdygirl14 posted 16 days ago, "ew y is it spelled like thaaaaaaaattttt" Pinky posted 16 days ago, "Ew, why do you type like that?" estrellaisbestrella posted 16 days ago, "I've reported you to the mods. Please remember the rules of this site, nerdygirl14. Back on topic, I found a similar dress at Forever 21. Here's a link." PumpkinButterfly posted 16 days ago, "Thank you so much, everyone! Sorry for not knowing her name. I forgot it. Forgive me. ^_^ Bye!!" There are no more replies. [[Do a new search.|search]]

passages.name: hqtuff
passages.text:
"We have group exercises again tomorrow morning, don't we?" You bite into your tomato and pesto chicken sandwich.

"Yeppers!"

"Kill me now."

"I love group work outs. They're awesome!" For as angelic as she looks, Ashley Evans might as well be a devil for the blasphemy she's spouting. "It's fun being surrounded by so many talented individuals in one place. It helps put things in perspective and, like, remind me that their talent's all within reach."

"More like it's miles, no, galaxies away...but I guess I get what you're saying." Today's session made you feel like you could be squashed under most of the other Estrella Girls' boots. It's going to take a lot out of you to spin that experience positively. "They're targets."

"Do you have anything scheduled for [[this afternoon]]?"

passages.name: andyou
passages.text:
And you...

You'll keep living in pursuit of your dreams,

[[whatever they may be.|theend]]

passages.name: figuring out the boundaries
passages.text:
"I know what the problem is." Taya begins. "This whole thing has to organically become a quad."

"Yes," Nayeli agrees. "This should be more like a series of relationships. The quad's still there but it's...separate at the same time. One plus one plus one plus one."

Sarai glances over at you. "What's your ideal situation?"

*[[The loving quad set-up.|speechwriter]]
*[[Separate relationships.|speechwriter]]

passages.name: Let Taya continue to take the fall.
passages.text:
"I give up." Nayeli throws up her hands and storms back into her room, done with the situation. You jump when she slams the door.<<set $taya_covered>>

You're glad she left. This means that nothing can get any worse...hopefully. Taya bursts out into laughter, whether out of amusement or nervousness, you can't tell.

"Why'd you cover for me?" You ask her.

"Nayeli was being mean for no good reason. She needed to be put in her place," Taya replies. "Anyway...what was it that we were talking about?"

"Date night plans."

"Yeah! [[Date night plans|continuation]]. Hm..."

passages.name: triad
passages.text:
"If my pillow was closer, I'd whack you in the head with it. I hope you know that." Nayeli plays a couple of chords she listed that were in the G key. She closes her eyes, a small smile on her face. It's like you're witnessing a reunion of longtime friends.

"Um...sorry to interrupt, but...you're not mad about what happened last Saturday, are you?"

"If it happens again," she strikes the E minor chord three times in a row to underscore her point, "I'm going to be angry at both of you. You don't take drugs without giving your girlfriend a heads up first. Fuck, I don't even think that shit you guys took was straight MDMA. Anything could've been mixed in that."

Nayeli plays another dark sequence of notes. "Is that why you guys invited me, so that I could [[be your chaperone]]? How was I supposed to enjoy my time if I was chasing after you idiots, huh?"

passages.name: Shut the door and run away.
passages.text: You run straight into your bedroom and collapse onto the floor, your heart pounding rapidly. <>Yes, you'd had sex with her before, but you hadn't actually seen her naked. <>That was not how you wanted to see Nayeli like that for the first time. You walked in on her and her private time with Taya. Sarai was working late, so it couldn't have been her. It had to have been with Taya. How are you ever going to live this down? You [[roll over onto your side]].

passages.name: over your dialpad
passages.text:
You deleted your parents' cellphone numbers from your contacts list a long time ago, but you've never forgotten them. You used to call them late at night when you were at college. They were your compasses, your guides in life for everything. They were with you through every up and down, every bad score on a midterm exam, every Research Day poster presentation, and every time you made a new friend.

Those exams are history.

Those posters are in the trash.

Those friends are gone.

Those days and nights of calling them about your successes and failures are over. 

You've gone from 97 on the Pickford Top 100 Chart to 75. You've got more music videos and more singles. You're making appearances all over the place. You're an actual, [[honest-to-goodness singer]].

passages.name: oops
passages.text: You flinch at Nayeli's harsh tone but Taya shrugs it off like it's no big deal. She checks her nails, looking nonchalant as she says, "fuck off, Yeli. No one cares about that stupid guitar. It's not even like you're playing shows anymore so it's not like you need to keep it pretty." "Go fuck yourself," she mutters. "Ha! I can touch my guitar as much as I want. I bought it." "With your dad's money." "So the fuck what?" That must've struck a nerve. "I gave it to you and I can take it away just as fast. I'll play with it all I want to and there's nothing you can do about it." *[[Interject and admit that you played it.]] *[[Let Taya continue to take the fall.]]

links.text: Interject and admit that you played it.

destination.name: Interject and admit that you played it.

links.text: Let Taya continue to take the fall.

destination.name: Let Taya continue to take the fall.

passages.name: enter the bedroom
passages.text:
The acoustic guitar and empty keyboard stand catch your eye first. From there, your eyes wander over to a bag on the floor stuffed with binders, notebooks, a stethoscope, some weird scissors, and white shoes. A layer of dust tells you it's been some time since the bag's been moved.

A desktop computer sits on a cherry wood desk. Blue lights shine periodically from it. Cables run from it to a guitar amp. You don't see an electric guitar around. Maybe it's been put away?

You have to keep yourself from laughing at their anime girl mousepads. It's one of the ones with added wrist support in the form of the girl's breasts. [[Interesting taste.]]

passages.name: be your chaperone
passages.text:
"You could've taken some too. Taya acted like you turned it down."

"There's no way in hell that I would. I hate feeling out of control." Nayeli calms down her playing. "...Have you fully come down from it? Sometimes it messes with people's heads and doesn't let go. I've seen it happen with Taya. She was depressed for weeks after her last time doing it."

"I have a hard time picturing Taya depressed."

"It's not good. You know how Ecstasy works, right? It blasts your serotonin levels way high, and then you crash way low. It doesn't happen for everyone, but it did happen that way for Taya." She does another run up a scale. "I'm worried about her. I don't even know why she'd take that shit after [[the bad reaction]] she had."

passages.name: yours
passages.text:
"Of course," Nayeli walks over to it, brushing her fingers down its neck. Pride lights up in her eyes. "Sarai's tone deaf. Taya doesn't know how to hold a guitar without dropping it. They're a mess."

"We should play together some time." This is your chance to get to know her through the power of music.

"No, we shouldn't." ...So much for that. "Our styles would clash. You're too...girl-with-a-guitar sounding. Sarai showed me some of your stuff."

"Pretty sure you sound like one too. You're a girl with a guitar too."

"No. You treat your guitar like it's a background piece. I treat mine with respect." She sits down on the bed and yawns into her hand. "I don't expect you to get that. You're a 'me, me, me' pop singer. You're in the [[most selfish genre]] of music there is."

passages.name: so angry
passages.text:
"—you're not 14 so stop acting like it—"

"Bite me!" Taya sticks her tongue out at her.

"We've got to take her home," Nayeli says, turning to you. "The last thing we need is for anyone to find out about this. It's fucked up how Taya's the smartest and most stupid girl I've ever met."

"Ha, joke's on you!" Taya squeals. "I'm not alone this time. You never want to do it with me, but Jerri took it. Jerri's my dream girl."

"What?" Nayeli's fury changes directions.

"It's E. Everyone does E," you say. Life's been hard on you. You want to be someone else for a while and have an out-of-body experience. You don't want to be a perfect angel. You don't want to be the person down on Earth looking up at that warped version of yourself. For one night, you just want to fly.

When's it going to [[kick in]]?

passages.name: done wonders
passages.text:
"Estrella must've used this incident as a stepping stool for everyone else." They jumped on your broken back to vaul themselves ahead.

"That sucks...I really liked meeting you and getting to know you."

There's something suspicious about the way Ashley Evans is acting. You're not sure what.

*[[Ask her if she had anything to do with the picture|Ask her if she had a hand in it]].
*[[Let it go|ASHLEY]].

links.text: Ask her if she had anything to do with the picture

destination.name: Ask her if she had a hand in it

passages.name: the hard way
passages.text:
"Do you want to have sex tonight?" Nayeli asks you, like she's asking you if you want to go play guitar with her. She's so casual about it. "It's not very romantic but ask and ye shall receive."

*[[Some other time]].
*[[Now]].

passages.name: a normal person
passages.text:
You all get ready. You and Taya make sure to make yourselves look a little more mysterious. On the way out the door, Nayeli looks at Taya's outfit in confusion.

"Why are you wearing sunglasses?" She asks her.

"Because I'm famous."

"Barely."

"More famous than you."

"Can we not fight on one of the rare nights out that we have together? Thanks," you say. Sometimes, it feels like you're [[wrangling children]] when you're hanging out with the two of them.

passages.name: mistaken
passages.text:
It's the end of another day at Estrella Entertainment HQ and you're getting your things out of your locker as you think back to your last conversation with Shannon. She told you that you'd have to sever all your ties with your "mistake."

No interacting with her. No being seen in public with her.

Nayeli had to be blacklisted.

Shannon said that this was part of the damage control. She gave you an ultimatum. It was your relationship with Nayeli or your relationship with Estrella Entertainment.

Which did you tell her was more important? What did you do in that meeting?

*[[You quit][$quit = true]].
*[[You remained with the company][$company = true]].

passages.name: the first of many
passages.text:
They wind up putting you in a cat masquerade mask, a knit ski cap, and one of Nayeli's old leather jackets. You don't know why they had a cat mask in their apartment. You don't want to ask. To match with you, Nayeli's wearing a cat headband (how Taya convinced her to wear that was a straight-up miracle).

You yawn in your seat. Your turn's coming up soon. Nayeli's focused on her cellphone. Sarai's entranced by the performance that's going on—some girl banging away at her guitar like it's a drum while she sings about her ex-boyfriend leaving her. You can't wait for it to end.

Taya says, "I can get you a coffee if you're falling asleep."

"I cut caffeine out of my diet. It's not the best thing to be drinking all the time..." Then again, you don't want to mess up the performance by being sluggish.

*[[Get coffee]].
*[[Don't get coffee][$willpower = $willpower + 1]].

passages.name: yep
passages.text: Before you moved in, Sarai had explained in detail what being her girlfriend entailed. Her girlfriends are in a network. The girlfriend of my girlfriend is my girlfriend. How you get there is up to you, but it's expected that you, and the rest of your girlfriends (you guess) do your best to get to know one another. Didn't Nayeli get a speech about this? You got the whole run-down from Sarai, including the bylines and all the ultra-fine print. Did Sarai skip out on telling Nayeli all of that? Or Nayeli heard it and just doesn't give a shit about any of this. That's a strong possibility. "Hey, Jerri..." Sarai starts. "Since you don't have a bed, you can [[sleep on my side of the bed|take my half]]. I'll take the couch."

links.text: sleep on my side of the bed

passages.name: Stay with Sarai
passages.text:
You let them go. You choose to stay with Sarai. Once the door closes, Sarai collapses onto the couch in tears. You put your hands on her shoulders. She doesn't reject your touch this time.

"Why'd you stay?"

*[[Love|overwhelm][$love1 = true]].
*[[Pity|overwhelm]].
*[[Don't know|overwhelm]].

passages.name: her hands hurt too much
passages.text:
The door finally opens and out steps Nayeli, a backpack on her back and a zipped-up guitar case in her hands. It would be one thing if she looked pissed off, but her face is blank. Neutral. This scares you more than anything else.

"Drop it!" Taya snaps at her.

"Fuck it," she deadpans as she lets the guitar go. It clunks onto the wood floor.

Sarai's sobbing too hard to speak. Taya leaves your grasp to hold her. She yells at Nayeli in Sarai's place. "Look at what you did to her."

"I don't give a fuck. I don't give a fuck about any of you anymore."

Nayeli walks out the door. She shuts it [[quietly]] behind her.

passages.name: Grab Sarai and kiss her first.
passages.text:
You kiss Sarai first. It's fast, cut off when Nayeli pulls you down on top of her.

"Hey, be more careful," Sarai chides her. "She's not a doll."

"Exactly."

You're in for [[quite the night|waiting]].<<set $tired = true>><<set $threes = true>>

passages.name: down on the table
passages.text:
Nayeli comes over to the table when she's done. "Hope I didn't embarrass you too badly." She pats you on the back.

"I think you killed her," Taya says. "Is there enough room in your trunk for a dead body, Sarai?"

"I don't know. Why are you asking me that?" Sarai misses the joke.

You finally look up. Nayeli asks you, "what did you think?"

"My opinion matters too." Taya coughs. "You were awesome."

"Yeah, it was great seeing you perform again." Sarai smiles at her.

"I didn't suck, did I?" She pokes your arm.

"No, you were amazing. I've never heard my song like that. It was...awesome." Your cheeks [[burn]].

passages.name: an even bigger one
passages.text:
"Where's Nayeli?" Sarai lets go of you and slides off her blazer.

"Holed up in her room doing her usual bitchy thing," Taya says. She plops herself down onto the couch, making herself comfortable. You're glad you have some solidarity when it comes to Nayeli, but you can't help but wonder if Taya's being a little too harsh.

Oh, well...it isn't exactly your business. Everyone's relationship functions differently.

"Since we're all here, we should have a group meeting. Sorry for the short notice, but I think it's best to do this with all of us here." Sarai says. "We should get everything out of the way now."

"I'll get Nayeli, then." You [[wish Taya luck]].

passages.name: ahhhh
passages.text: Taya lowers her voice. "It sucks being left out of everything just because I don't live with you guys. It's not like I don't hear about what you do." Oh... She must be talking about that... "I'm sorry," you say. "It's cool. I asked for this when I told Sarai not to force us to have a quad thing. I just didn't account for being left in the dust." *[[Ask her to stay the night]]. *[[Reassure her that she's not]].

links.text: Ask her to stay the night

destination.name: Ask her to stay the night

passages.name: The ceiling
passages.text:
"The ceiling."

"Did all of this go over your head?" Taya frowns.

"No, I was just being funny. I know what you meant."

"Good." Taya's frown becomes a [[smile|smirks]].

passages.name: Sleep.
passages.text:
Thursday comes and goes.

You meet Shannon in her office on Friday. She shakes out a cinnamon shaker into her coffee, staring at you over the rim of her glases. Coffee's on the list of food you've had to give up. You forgot if it was your vocal coach or your fitness instructor that banned you from coffee. The two of them have been banning things from you left and right, so it could've been both of them in cahoots for all you know.

You get the feeling they would've banned you from being happy if happiness wasn't one of the emotions you had to sell your audience on. They're out to get you.

"It's the end of your first week at Estrella Entertainment," Shannon says once she's poured in an adequate amount of cinnamon. "How have you been [[faring]]?"

passages.name: anything you want
passages.text:
"Sweet potato rolls," you say first. Shannon recommended those. "Calamari to start."

"Shrimp tempura," Taya adds.

"And the salmon and avocado rolls. Thank you." You pass the waitress the menus, and she goes off to the counter to punch in your order. Taya pushes the Autumn Delight towards you, and gets started in on her Midori Sour.

The flavor's pleasantly warm. It's a bit on the sweet side.

"Try some of mine," Taya holds it out to you. You take a sip, not wanting to look greedy.

"Is that watermelon?"

"It's melon. Can I [[have some]] of yours?"

passages.name: Both
passages.text: Ashley Evans nods. "A [[bit of both|fear]] is healthy, yeah."

passages.name: a familiar face
passages.text:
It's Shannon, your manager. She's so expensively dressed that she makes Sarai look poor. "Get in," she tells you, and you don't hesitate to follow her order. You've never been so thankful for heated leather seats before. "Can you explain to me why my newest talent is walking around looking like a nightwalker?"

"Nightwalker?"

"You look like a lady of the night. This is the sort of dirt that tabloids live for. Anyone can take your picture and spin it into a story." Shannon smells like smoke. "So tell me, what are you doing out so late in this part of town?"

"Um... I'm waiting until the library's open because I don't have a place to stay." You decide to come clean. Shannon's frown deepens. "I've been couch surfing but I'm [[all out of couches]]."

passages.name: Break up with her
passages.text:
"We can't be together, sorry," you tell her.

"I guess there's no point in me sticking around here anymore." Nayeli says with a heavy sigh.

"You can stay here for as long as you need to. I'm not putting you out on the street," Sarai says.

"[[Okay|all things considered]]..."

passages.name: Put down your phone and look up.
passages.text:
There she is, walking up to you with a big smile on her face. "This is a nice surprise."

You hug her. You've got a backwards hat on and a pair of oversized sunglasses to hide your face. It doesn't help very much, though, because once you're seen hugging Taya, someone puts two and two together and asks for your autograph.

You sign her notebook and her friends' notebooks and urge them to keep it quiet. They scurry off.

"Can we do something together soon? Just the two of us. I haven't stopped feeling like an ass about that E thing." Taya's [[lost her smile]].

passages.name: Let the blame rest with Nayeli
passages.text:
"At the risk of sounding like Taya...you have to get over yourself," you tell her. "Of course you're more than a body to us. Why else would Taya buy you that guitar?"

"She'll never let me forget it."

"That's part of Taya's personality. She likes picking on you, but it isn't because she hates you." You say. "And Sarai is busting her ass every day to provide you a home. And me too. I ran out here to get you. You're [[not just a body|hating yourself]]."

passages.name: Interesting taste.
passages.text:
There are a few packs of cards off to the side of the desk. You assume they must belong to Sarai. What's worrying is that one of the stacks looks burnt.

A pair of heavy duty speakers sits on top of a pile of books. These women are either well-read, or like to look like they are. There's Octavia Butler's Kindred, Toni Morrison's The Bluest Eye, Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie's The Thing Around Your Neck, Edwidge Danticat's The Farming of Bones, Nalo Hopkinson's Midnight Robber, and James Tiptree Jr's Up the Walls of the World.

The spines of the books on the bookshelf are too far away for you to read. You can make out that there's several card trick books and an Anatomy book or two.

You tilt your head towards the guitar. "Is this [[yours]]?"

passages.name: back to normal
passages.text:
The bed's too small for four people. You figure it's best that you give the three of them their moment together. As they go into the bedrom one by one, you get yourself comfy on the couch.

You're glad you were able to get Nayeli back. You don't want to see her, or any of the rest of them, in pain like that ever again.

Taya pops out of the room. "Jerri Beary..."

"Please don't ever call me that again." You cringe at the nickname.

"Okay. Jerri, what the hell are you doing in here? It's time for bed."

"I didn't think there'd be enough room."

"You're [[one of us]]. You belong in the bed too. Hurry up." Taya smiles.

passages.name: how serious
passages.text:
The cafeteria is grand. That's the best word for it. It's all-white aside from its blue tables. There are several food stations offering healthy options ranging from vegan lunch, all-around-the-world (looks like Asian Noodles today), the daily special (that must be the fish and rice), a salad bar, and a sandwich place.

Estrella Girls sit at the tables, giggling about jokes that probably aren't that funny. Executives and other business suit types chat quietly. A well-dressed janitor is mopping up a spill. You don't see Miya K, Rayna, and Lily Trilly around, not that you'd want to sit with them or anything like that. No, you've got Ashley Evans.

She says, "I think competing with people who are supposed to be your friends is silly. It's hard enough in this industry without worrying about other people from the same studio. We should support each other!"

"Why [[don't]] we?"

passages.name: SleepA
passages.text:
You wake up alone the next morning. There's a cold Poptart on a plate where Nayeli should've been.<<set $route_a = true>>

<<if $starry eq "yes">>Should've been? Last night didn't make her yours eternally. Don't get ahead of yourself.

You bite into the Poptart. You nearly miss the note she left for you. It's simple and to the point: HF. Is that "have fun" or "had fun?" You decide to take a pen and write something back to her.

* [[A winky face.|getready]]
* [[A smiley face.|getready]]
* [[A heart.|getready]]

<<else>>You bite into the 'tart. It could've used some serious toasting.

You get the feeling that today's going to be [[a long day]].<<endif>>

passages.name: SleepB
passages.text: You wake up to a plate of toast and jam and a glass of orange juice waiting for you on the coffee table. <<set $backpain = true>><<set $route_b = true>>\n\nIt's a nice gesture. You guess that Sarai had time to make you breakfast before she had to go. As you chew on the toasted bread, you get the feeling that today is going to be [[a long day]].

passages.name: furniture
passages.text: You get in bed together about an hour later with Sarai in the middle. She didn't eat. She claimed she had take-out at work. You [[raise your blanket]] over your nose to block out the booze smell that's radiating off of her.

passages.name: shoulder
passages.text:
"Good job on laying down that rhythm, by the way. I liked what you came up with."

"I used to play cover songs at bars all the time. That helped."

"In a band?"

"No, alone."

"I was in a band until our lead singer decided her shit was better than gold. She dumped us as soon as a record label asked her to. We were left in the dirt."

"We should play together sometime."

"We just did."

"No, live," you smile as you talk. "You're fantastic. You're better than some Estrella Girls I've heard around headquarters."

"Better than a commercial pop star? I'll take it." Nayeli puts the guitar back on its stand. "If we perform together, we're going to have to do it before you're too famous and upstage me," she jokes.

[[The door opens.]]

38. Lily Trilly 37. Michelle Quigly 36. Kellondra 35. Toni Marxx 34. DeLuxe 33. Cameo 32. Amelia J. Estevez 31. Moonlight 30. Katie BT 29. Gloriana 28. Mizuki Sonoda 27. Rionne 26. Alexa Winter 25. Milly Saunders 24. Alexandra Venti 23. Minjung 22. Prudence Bridges 21. Belinda Fire [[59-39|59 - 39]] >> 38-21 >> [[20-1]]

passages.name: Turn around and sing.
passages.text:
You perform your song, dance steps and all, to great applause. Your audience member gives you a standing ovation. <<if $tired>>You're aware that you missed a few steps, but she's got a big enough smile on her face that you don't berate yourself for it.<<endif>>

"Do people do the Jerry Springer chant at your concerts?" She cups her hands around her mouth and chants, "Jerri! Jerri! Jerri!"

"Stop it." You're back to being regular Jerri. Your persona's gone. "You're making fun of me."

"Not at all! I'm, like, super impressed." She sits down. "How'd you do that leaning tower thing?"

"You have to balance on your heels. You let your body fall and catch yourself. You're limp while rigid." You smile. "It took me a while to make it look good."

"And it shows. You're a great dancer."

"I had to become one fast."

"You must be ripped, huh?"

"No... Sarai says I'm getting [[less soft]], though."

passages.name: nextscene
passages.text:
That weekend, you go to a coffee house to attend an open mic show that Nayeli signed up to perform at. <<if $openmic_no>>You could've been up there on the stage with her if it weren't for your job duties.<<endif>><<if $hotel>>This is your way of making up for walking out on them with Taya before.<<endif>>

You wear a disguise—a hat, one of Sarai's blazers, and a pair of Taya's old glasses with the lenses popped out—to keep yourself from being recognized by anyone.

You share a table with Taya and Sarai. It's a low-key event. Performers go up one at a time in small groups or alone and do whatever they want in their five minute slot. You saw a pair of brothers do an interpretative dance, a woman with a finger puppet, and a violinist. You wish one of them was having an encore performance...anything to get the girl singing about her ex-boyfriend and using her guitar as a drum off the stage.

"Are you excited to see Nayeli perform? Then again, you've been playing with her for a while now." Sarai says. <<if $hotel>>She's not holding the other day against you.<<endif>>

"Performing with her is different from watching her," you say.

"Does that mean you'll be able to say things like 'that was a little pitchy, dawg?'" Taya jokes.

"She's pretty on pitch most of the time," you tell her. "Do you know what she's [[playing]]?"

passages.name: You quit
passages.text:
Ashley Evans bounces over to you, oblivious to how harshly your jaw's set. You're done with his place and all its rules. You don't need this.

"Are you leaving for the day or are you staying for extra studio time?"

You rip down your locker poster of Cameo, the one Sarai gave you as a joke. "I quit. I'm leaving forever."

"Is this because of that picture? You're going to let one scandal run you off from your dreams?" Ashley Evans' frowns are as big as her smiles. It's a mildly terrifying sight.

"Maybe this wasn't my dream after all. Maybe I was wrong the whole time."

Ashley Evans shrugs. Her frown's gone. "Okay. It's weird. The scandal's [[done wonders]] for everyone else. Our ranks have improved."

passages.name: itsover
passages.text:
<<if $stayed_first is true and $stayed_second is true and $stayed_third is true>>"Did what I think happen just happen?" Sarai asks.

"Yeah? I think we're all sort of still together." Taya scratches her head. "I mean, I guess I'm in for that. Was I not paying attention?"

"We are," Nayeli says. "we are, but things are going to be different in a good way. We needed this talk. Thanks for making us have it, Jerri."

"Jerri! Jerri! Jerri!"

"Stop, Taya." You cringe.

"Can we all hug for a minute?" Sarai asks. "I could use one."

"Yeah." You join everyone for a group hug.

How long will [[these good times|...]] last?<<set $all_together_now = true>><<else>>"Are we done now?" Taya asks.

"I guess so," you shrug. "Once we leave, things are going to be different."

"Yep," Sarai nods. "I've got some errands to run. I have to get going."

"I've got homework so I'm going to go too." Taya says.

"I'm in the middle of writing a song. I'm gonna get back to that." Nayeli says.

"And I'm...um, gonna go do something. I've got to take care of something."

"Something?" Taya asks with a smirk.

"It doesn't matter," you say.

You all [[go your separate ways|...]].<<endif>>

passages.name: someone else
passages.text:
Shannon's eyebrow shoots straight up.

"There was a roommate emergency. They kept me up," you say, trying to get her eyebrow to calm down.

She sighs. "I've seen that guilty face on hundreds of other girls' faces. I get it. Other people can be nice, but you have to take this seriously. This is your job, so act like it. This is especially important now that you've had your debut." Shannon pushes up her glasses. "You're at a critical point in your career. Don't let your personal life ruin that. Now, I'd like to go over the main reason I called you here today: we've figured out [[your image]]."

passages.name: doesn't speak much
passages.text: It's like she's doing everything in her power to keep her distance from you, even though you're in the exact same room. You look at her, and she looks away. You start talking, and she shuts up. How does Sarai expect you two to ever [[get along|might be over]]?

passages.name: she can sue me
passages.text:
The atmosphere in Kitagawa's is relaxed. The decor calls on shades of red and brown. Well-dressed couples chat in low voices, providing a low hum beneath the gentle Japanese music that's playing.

You sit in a booth waiting for your date. You're on your third glass of water and it's only been twenty minutes. You haven't had first date jitters like this in a long time. You're supposed to be cool. You're supposed to be an Estrella Girl: confident, radiant, and—

not sitting with your mouth hanging open when your date arrives at your table.

"Hope I didn't keep you waiting for too long." Taya's makeup game is on point. "It took me longer to get ready than I expected." She sits across from you.

*[[Tell her she didn't have to.|Tell her she looks amazing.]]
*[[Tell her she looks amazing.|Tell her she didn't have to.]]

links.text: Tell her she didn't have to.

destination.name: Tell her she didn't have to.

passages.name: the best day of my life
passages.text:
"She's not a celebrity. She's a pop star," Nayeli says. "She'll be a one hit wonder if she's lucky."

<<if $starry>>"Is this how you treat all the girls you fuck?"

The room goes silent. Nayeli's eyes widen to the point you're afraid they'll pop out of her head.

"You guys had sex?" It takes Sarai asking that for you to realize that you were the one with the outburst. She sucks in her bottom lip.

"I-I thought [[you wanted us]] to," you stutter.<<else>>"Are you pissed off at me because I didn't sleep with you?"

Taya gasps dramatically. "Drama, drama!"

"No fucking way. You make it sound like I was all over you. If you're trying to make me look bad in front of Sarai and Taya, it's not working," Nayeli fumes. "They know me too well for [[that shit to work]]."<<endif>>

passages.name: Tell Taya to stop lying
passages.text:
"Don't lie to her, Taya." Lies would make things worse. "Nayeli needs to come clean."

Nayeli's sitting up at this point, Taya's arms still protectively around her. Taya says, "shut up. What the fuck are you saying, Jerri?"

"Wow, you were all in on it. That's great. Fantastic." Sarai shakes her head.

"Taya didn't know about it. If she did, she would've stopped me." Nayeli's words come out slowly. "Jerri found out because she caught me doing it. I didn't want you to find ou this way, Sarai, I swear."

"You didn't want me to find out at all."

Nayeli [[gets quiet]].

passages.name: can't see it
passages.text:
"Would you guys like to spend the night together one last time?" Sarai asks. "Oh, and I'm not kicking out you or Nayeli. And Taya, you're welcome to come over whenever you want. The nature of our relationship may change, but I'm still who I am. This apartment's an open door for all of you."

"Thank you. I'll move out as soon as I can." Nayeli takes her hands off of her face.

"Yeah, I'll stay the night for old times' sake. One last hurrah." Taya says.

"Same," Nayeli says.

*[[Join them]].
*[[Go elsewhere]].

passages.name: Break up with Taya
passages.text:
"I'm breaking up with you, Taya."

"What?" It's like all the wind has been knocked out of her "Fucking seriously?"

"I'm sorry. I can't be everything you need," you say. "We've got to break up."
<<if $stayed_first>>
"Let me guess," she says. "You're going to stay with Nayeli? The three musketeers. Of course, of course... You guys wanted it this way all along but didn't know how to break it to me."

"We didn't," Nayeli says.

"It's all about what's best for everyone," you tell her.<<endif>>

"You can dress it up like that all you want, but I know what the truth is." Taya doesn't let up. She sighs and [[looks off to the side|okdecision]].

passages.name: Go elsewhere
passages.text:
"I've got to go, sorry," you lie. "Estrella scheduled me for something so I've got to get going."

It's better to walk away now and avoid the temptation of getting pulled back in.

Yes, this way is better. <<if $company>>Your career will thank you for it.<<endif>>

You leave soon after that.

[[...]]

passages.name: Break up wih Sarai
passages.text:
"I'm...I'm breaking up with you, Sarai." You tell her. <<if $company>>"I'm not sure I have the time to commit to a group in the way you think I should. I nearly lost my career over everything that happened. I can't go through that again."<<endif>>

"I understand. I thought this would happen," Sarai mumbles.

"I'll stay with you, Sarai, as long as you keep your promise." Nayeli says.

"Thank you." Sarai smiles sadly.

"I'll be going too." Taya says.

"You'll be happier that way," Nayeli [[says|nextdecision]].

passages.name: ASHLEY
passages.text:
You let it go.

You're never going to know who leaked that photo to the press.

"Thank you for being my friend, Ashley Evans. I wish you the best of luck with the rest of your career." You give her a farewell that Shannon would've been proud of you for.

"That's what friends are for." Ashley Evans beams.

You're done with everything Estrella-related. You just want to [[go home]].

passages.name: honest-to-goodness singer
passages.text:
Do your parents watch you on TV? You're making appearances wherever you can. Talk shows, interviews, conferences, concerts, meet-and-greets.

What do they think of you now? Are they ashamed that you're known as Estrella Entertainment's queer idol? They shunned you for something that's turned you into a solid star. You've risen above them.

Do they ever pick up the phone and think about calling you, just like you're doing now? Do they wish, do they hope that you'll be around for the holidays? Have they kept your spot at the table empty?

[[You'll never know|Close your laptop]].

passages.name: comments
passages.text: JNFan posted 1 day ago: "Terri is over. :'( I hate this! jifsijasfnfsianiaufs" nerdygirl14 posted 1 day ago: "whos the homewrecking bitch" estrellaisbestrella posted 1 day ago: "We need to remain civilized. I'm not happy but we don't need to call anyone a bitch. Jerri's not who I thought she was." Pinky posted 1 day ago: "I'm in shock. They were perfect for each other." hardboiledeggs posted 1 day ago: "lets find taya's number ;)" JNFan posted 1 day ago: "I feel like I've been LIED to." [[Next page.]]

passages.name: deadbolts
passages.text:
She lays down on the bed and drags the room service menu over to read it. You hadn't noticed it beneath the telephone. <<if $bull>>"Hey, Jerri, this may sound weird, but I have to remind you that I'm not looking for a pity fuck. That's not why I brought you here."

"Yeah, I understand."<<endif>>

"You can have anything you want from the menu. I'll cover it." Taya says. "It's the least I can do to make up for that shit show we just went through."

"I'm the one that caused it." You sit on the edge of the bed and put your head in your hands. "Nayeli was right. I wasn't thinking enough." What if Nayeli and Sarai hate you now?

"There's no use in beating yourself up over it. If it makes you feel better, you can tell your manager you're not seeing anyone anymore. You can say something like your girlfriend wasn't ready to go forward with all of this publicity."

"[[Are you?]]"

passages.name: Lesbian
passages.text:
Shannon drinks down more of her coffee. "That's good. The LGBTQ demographic is on the rise. It's a good time to be a lesbian star. A couple months ago, maybe not so much, but your people have been making strides. The time is now."

"Is that what you'll have me debut as?"
