"We've got market testing to do. We have to see if it's a viable image for you to have. If a more conservative audience proves more profitable, then that's the way that we will go." Shannon grumbles, "it's the conservatives who have money. Parents are the ones buying."

"Or their kids just borrow their credit cards."

"Same thing. I'll add this note to your file and get our research team to work." Shannon jots the word LESBIAN on a sticky note and smacks it down onto her desk. "Now what was it that you were saying about [[this girlfriend of yours]]?"

passages.name: find somebody, anybody
passages.text:
You enter a bar and try to turn up your...
* [[Charm|fail]]
* [[Sexiness|fail]]
* [[Energy|fail]]

passages.name: go home
passages.text:
A week's gone by since that terrible fight. You asked everyone to meet and talk in the apartment. The air's thick with tension. You're sitting in a circle, you on the couch with Sarai, and Taya and Nayeli in chairs facing the couch.

Sarai's got her hands in her lap, no doubt to hide how much they're quivering. Nayeli keeps her gaze straight ahead. Taya keeps messing with her hair. You're not faring well, either. Your foot won't stop tapping.

<<if $went_with_them>>Over the past week, the three of you had bounced around between hotels and Taya's dorm. It felt like you were hiding in secrecy.<<else>>You think abou the nights you spent soothing Sarai to sleep, how badly cut up inside she is over the entire situation. You hid the bottles you could find in he apartments to keep her from making a mess of herself again.<<endif>>

<<if $company>>Everything Shannon's been telling you at work has been weighing on your soul. She suggested that you cut out all of your distractions. She may have meant Nayeli specifically, but you're beginning to wonder how much of a distraction the rest of them are. Can you be a lover and a singer? Does one of them have to give? You're not sure. You're [[not a super idol|floor]]. You're human.<<else>>You haven't had the heart to tell any of them that you're no longer an idol. How will they feel when they hear it? Disappointed? Will they blame themselves? You wonder if any of them will try to take the fall. You grip your stomach to try to nurse the ache that's growing there. You'll have to [[admit your failure|floor]] later.<<endif>>

passages.name: whoever this person is
passages.text:
She turns her computer monitor around. Your face-to-face with a picture of you liplocked with Nayeli. It's from that night at the club. Your palms sweat. Shannon says, "I'm ready to hear your excuse."

"I'm 72 now..." You try that.

"You're at risk of falling off the chart entirely for this. Did you forget who your fans are? They love you and your girlfriend. They're shipping you." Shannon glares. "Who is this? Who'd you decide to throw away all of your hard work for?"

"I-I...um..." Your legs are shaking.

"Because it's strange that you were spotted with this girl and your girlfriend earlier that night. It looks like that you took your girlfriend and a friend with you to a night club, ditched your girlfriend, and cheated on her with this girl as soon as her back was turned." She rubs her temple. "There aren't many ways that we can spin this story, Jerri. [[Explain yourself]]."

passages.name: Estrella Entertainment
passages.text: From the company website: "Estrella Entertainment's mission is to maintain its status as one of the leading entertainment providers in the world. Our extensive portfolio of brands allows us to innovate with a diverse range of creative content and consumer products." Being part of Estrella Entertainment is <>a dream come true not just for you but for people everywhere. You used to watch Estrella Girls on TV and hope and pray for the day you could be a star. You'd stay up at night, holding a flashlight to magazines of flashy Estrella Girls until your arm got too tired. You'd line your lockers with posters of their pop stars. You'd hum their songs and learn their dances normal and mirrored. You've worked hard for this. This opportunity didn't just fall into your lap.<> [[Back.|sing]]

passages.name: the way it has to be
passages.text:
Nayeli turns to you next. "I don't want to break up with you, Jerri, but I get it if that's what you want to do.<<if $fired or $quit>> I feel like shit for saying that after you basically threw everything away for me... Fuck. So, it's your call."<<else>>"<<endif>><<set $single_second>>

What's the best thing for you to do?

*[[Stay with her][$stayed_second = true]].
*[[Break up with her]].

passages.name: Go home. It's not your business
passages.text: You don't spare them a second glance. You continue walking to [[your apartment]].

passages.name: burn
passages.text:
"Let's go out and celebrate!" Taya cheers. "What do you guys want?"

"A cheeseburger," Nayeli says.

"I could make one at home, if you want." Sarai says. "We've just got to get some ground beef."

"Can mine be a taco?" Taya asks.

"Yes, we can make you a taco. Let's go home." Sarai smiles and leads the way [[out to her car|cat costume]].

passages.name: the bad reaction
passages.text: You switch your fingers between the A minor and C chords on your guitar, just shifting them back and forth as you chew over everything Nayeli's saying. "I don't think Taya's been weird. I can try investigating for you."\n\n"Thanks. Can you strum what you're doing for me? I'm gonna come up with [[a melody]] for it."

passages.name: pressure
passages.text:
"We could do it again. We never did get you a present for your debut," Sarai continues as Nayeli starts getting more daring. You breathe out slowly, surprised that Sarai doesn't seem to notice what's happening.

"You made me dinner."

"I make you dinner every night. I'm talking about a better present."

"Or we could do it for fun," Nayeli says. "Stop me if you don't want to tonight."

Sarai gently turns your head her way and kisses you. "What do you want to do?"

Is there a catch? Why was this so easy to make happen?

You stop questioning it. You guide Nayeli's hand higher and then pull Sarai in for a deeper kiss.

[[...|waiting]]

passages.name: Side with Nayeli
passages.text:
"I agree with Nayeli.<<if $stopcam>> And it's even more fair since she's giving up being a camgirl for you guys. Common courtesy says that Sarai has to give up drinking for her."

"It's more than common courtesy."<<else>>"<<endif>> Nayeli says, "you scared me that night, Sarai. I don't want to be with someone who scares me."

"I'd do anything to make you forgive me," Sarai says. "I know that you don't think this is a big deal, Taya, but my relationship with Nayeli is. I'll give up drinking if that'll make you [[feel happier and safer]], Nayeli."

passages.name: take my half
passages.text:
You don't know who looks more confused: you or Nayeli.

"It's okay. You can keep your bed." You don't want to impose on your [[first night]]. Things with Nayeli are rocky enough as it is. "I don't want to make things weird."

"No, it's fine. I can take the couch. You and Nayeli can get to know each other without me making it awkward."

You doubt Sarai's presence is what's doing that. You're afraid of what might happen without her around.

"Doesn't matter to me either way." Nayeli finishes her plate. "I'm not the one who has to sleep on that shitty couch."

"It's not that shitty." Sarai pushes on Nayeli's shoulder. "I've got to get to bed soon, so take your pick. I swear it's not a problem if you take the bed."

* [[Accept the offer.][$route_a = true]]
* [[Turn it down.][$route_b = true]]

passages.name: freeloader
passages.text:
"Why do you treat me like one then?" Nayeli asks her. "Why aren't you forcing your money on Sarai and Jerri?"

"I've paid for things for them too." Taya says. "It's different with them because they can pay me back. I hate taking their money. Fuck it, sometimes I sneak Sarai's back to her. I'm not lying."

*[[Tell Nayeli that accepting help isn't shameful]].
*[[Tell Sarai and Taya to allow Nayeli her independence]].

links.text: Tell Nayeli that accepting help isn't shameful

destination.name: Tell Nayeli that accepting help isn't shameful

links.text: Tell Sarai and Taya to allow Nayeli her independence

destination.name: Tell Sarai and Taya to allow Nayeli her independence

passages.name: in the oven
passages.text:
"I'm not supposed to have any dairy." So much for solidarity in your food ban.

"It's just lasagna."

"It's just packed with dairy."

"Does it matter? You're working out every day. A lasagna square 'this' big isn't going to wreck everything for you," Sarai says.

Or will it?

*[[Eat the lasagna][$willpower = 0]].
*[[Turn down the lasagna|Turn dwn the lasagna][$willpower = 1]].

passages.name: oh
passages.text:
"Oh..." Taya's hold on you loosens. "Guess I'm not as perfect as you thought I was."

"I'm going to lose everything because of this. I turned down the press conference and now I'm going to face something ten times worse. Why did I do that?" You're crying so hard that you're shaking.

"You didn't have to do that for me. You could've gone."

"I couldn't let you down... I'm worried sick about you, Taya."

"Maybe you should stop worry about me then. Maybe you should all cut me loose." You don't look at her, but you can tell she's crying by [[the quality]] of her voice.

passages.name: Scared
passages.text: Ashley Evans smiles sadly. "Fear's normal. Just don't let it [[paralyze|fear]] you."

passages.name: sweat
passages.text:
You're sweating in the recording booth. The overhead lights are so hot that you can't wipe the perspiration off of your forehead fast enough. You make a mental note to bring a handkerchief for next time.

You've got a sheet of sugary sweet lyrics in front of you. They went with a danceable, high energy number.

It's hard for you to bring the energy that they're demanding from you. Your vocal coach keeps telling you to amp yourself up more.

"More fire! More fire!" He bellows into your headphones.

By the time you go home, your throat feels like it's [[raw]].

passages.name: whistles
passages.text:
You take up your five minute time slot with a medley of choruses from hits by singers in the Pickford Top 100 Chart. Lilou, Carey Marie, Meeko, Heloise, and, for added fun, Cameo.

When it's over, people clap for you as enthusiastically as an open mic audience can get. It's less than the screams and cheers you get as Jerri the pop star, but you like it. There's something about it that's different, and maybe even a little better. Maybe that's an added effect of getting to perform with Nayeli, though.

You go straight to Sarai and Taya's table. Sarai gives Nayeli a high five.

"You guys were fantastic!" She says.

"I need a PLA poster for my room." Taya grins. "How do you ladies feel about a private photoshoot at my place?"

"Shut up." Nayeli laughs. She hooks her arm around Taya's neck. "C'mon, let's go out and celebrate. And get Jerri out of that [[cat costume]] before she burns to death."

80. Nia Politan 79. Jaxx Magic 78. Maya Magnatama 77. Eskobara 76. Donna Brightly 75. Lady Lawrence 74. Lori Midday 73. Kathryn 72. Frankly True 71. Meghan Carlisle 70. Sapphire 69. Nancy Myers 68. Liza Berkowitz 67. TJ Soles 66. Lindsay Fast 65. Carlotta Queen 64. Billie Allington 63. Ava 62. Wei Wei Wei 61. Zoochild 60. Laura Levy [[100-81|You scroll through the list from 100 to 1.]] >> 80-60 >> [[59-39|59 - 39]]

destination.name: You scroll through the list from 100 to 1.

passages.name: getready
passages.text: You go off to get ready for [[the long day|a long day]] ahead of you.

passages.name: quietly
passages.text:
Is that it?

Is that the last time you're going to see Nayeli?

No more nights playing guitar with her. No more trading ideas for songs. No more mocking her for saying "whatever" and having her chase you playfully around the room because of it. No more duets of songs that warm your heart or make you cry from their sincerity.

No more holding her close at night or hearing her wish you good morning as she tries so damn hard not to look like a goofball as she smiles at you.

You should've done something. You shouldn't have stood there with your girlfriends screaming at each other as nothing more than a shadow. You grip the front of your shirt, something in your chest hurting. It's hard to breathe.

"Go get her, Jerri."

You lock eyes with Taya. She's hugging Sarai tightly to her chest.

You [[spring into action]] at her command.

passages.name: sniffle
passages.text:
"You're under no obligation to say it back. I just have to say it. I can't keep it to myself anymore," Taya says. She stares into your eyes. "Before I met you I was ready to drop out of school. Forget about dropping one of my majors, I was actually thinking about walking away from everything.

"I couldn't fathom why I was working so hard. What was I dying for? A job that would make me as rich as my parents? What's the point?" She takes in a breath. "I'd lost sight of my ambition. And then I met you. You're passionate. Full of life, energy, vigor.

"And when you were calling me perfect? That made me feel like I'd died and gone to heaven. <<if $hotel>>I'll never forget that night we had at the hotel. <<endif>>Making me into your public girlfriend...that was amazing. Not because I got to be almost famous, but because I could be with you. I felt special.

"Fuck, I'm stalling. Yeah, you don't have to say this back. I just can't keep holding this in.

"I love you, Jerri. I love you so much."

*[["I love you too."]]
*[["Thank you."]]

passages.name: call yourself an idol
passages.text:
You find her.

She's sitting in front of a building, her knees tucked to her chest. Nayeli looks up at you listlessly.

"Want to hear something fucked up?" She asks you.

You sit next to her, shoulder-to-shoulder. Cars pass by. You see glimpses of their drivers, caught up in their own worlds. "What?"

"I've got nowhere to go. You're the only ones I've got. That's what's fucked up."

"It's the same for me."

"Too many bridges burned?"

"Yeah." You'd burn through their attention fast. You'd [[want too much and get too little]].

links.text: want too much and get too little

destination.name: want too much and get too little

passages.name: Tell her to deal with it.
passages.text:
"I said I was sorry, so deal with it!" You turn to run. She grabs your arm to keep you in place.

"Don't you know who I am?" She lowers her sunglasses.

"No, I don't." You rip your arm out of her grasp, and run to get to the front doors of Estrella Entertainment HQ. You don't have time to talk to this girl, whoever she is. You've got better things to do, like not getting fired for [[being late]].

passages.name: Stay
passages.text:
"We can't go. That's going to make things worse." You turn down Taya's idea. You step away from her and away from your feelings of wanting to keep the peace. You've had enough of everyone's attitude.

You raise your voice at Nayeli. "I'm sorry for not doing what you wanted me to do. Maybe next time I'll call you first before I do anything with my life, because apparently you're the expert on all things right and not wrong."

"This is a trainwreck. I'm tired of this shit." Nayeli fumes. "Why the fuck are we fighting about this?" She stomps her foot down.

"Because you won't lighten up. The only times you're actually pleasant are when you're having sex or playing music. You're unbearable every other time." Taya says, not backing down. "Isn't that fucked up?"

Nayeli screams. "I'm done! I'm out of here."

"Wait, Nayeli, don't go. Think about this." Sarai tries to reason with her.

She storms past her and into the bedroom, slamming the door behind her. Sarai's a second too slow. You see her struggle to turn the door knob. It's locked. It won't budge. Sarai [[beats]] on the door, yelling for Nayeli to come out.

passages.name: Disagree
passages.text:
You disagree. "That's not true at all."

"Hey, I meant it all in good fun. I didn't mean anything bad by it."

"[[Sure|sure]]."

passages.name: use a pick-me-up
passages.text:
"Why are you acting like you weren't there that night?" Nayeli asks her.

"I'm not. I'm being realistic." Taya says.

"Sarai, I don't think I can be with you if you don't put yourself back in AA. You need to talk to your sponsor again," Nayeli begs. "Do something. Anything."

"You're too over-the-top," Taya mutters.

*[[Side with Taya]].
*[[Side with Nayeli]].

passages.name: finish eating together
passages.text:
You're at home, tuning your guitar to Nayeli's new keyboard. She saved up enough money to replace her old one. Since it's one of your off-days that means that it's only the two of you and no one else. You wonder how many men she had to see to get that keyboard. Hundreds?

You strum a C chord. "Can you play the A again?" Once she does, you're able to key in the tuning better. You match the A string to the sound of her piano. "Do you mind if I ask you something?"

"Shoot."

"Did you ever let Sarai know about the camgirl thing, or is it still a secret?"

"It's a secret. One that you should've [[forgotten]] by now."

passages.name: Go with them
passages.text: You leave Sarai without another glance.\n\nYou wind up in a hotel for the night. <<if $hotel>>It's the same one as before, devoid of all its charms. <<endif>>Even with the three of you sharing the bed, it's <<if $othergirlfriend>>[[the coldest]]<<else>>[[the coldest|mistaken]]<<endif>> it's ever been.

passages.name: faring
passages.text:
"Great," you say automatically. "I've been hanging out with Ashley Evans at breaktime. Thank you for introducing us."

"You're welcome. I've found that it's better for company morale if you make friends." Shannon sips her coffee. "How has your personal life been otherwise? You're not still out on the streets, are you?"

"I've got a place to stay. It's nice. My roommates are the best. We actually had a funeral service last night for all the food I can't eat anymore." You smile. "Then we played this game with a bunch of little sack creatures. They were cute. They run across the screen and jump and play and grab things. I was so awful they had to drag me through an entire level."

You laugh at the memory. Shannon doesn't. She looks at you like a bitter librarian sucking on a lemon.

Um... Maybe you should share [[something more interesting]].

passages.name: girlfriends
passages.text:
And since Nayeli's one of Sarai's girlfriends, and you're one of Sarai's girlfriends, that makes you girlfriends, too.

Sort of.

You're not sure how all of this is [[supposed to work|might be over]].

passages.name: Accept the offer.
passages.text: "I'll do it...as long as you're both okay with it." You look over at Nayeli expectantly. This is her chance to speak up, to complain, to cheer, to do something. <> She shrugs. Sarai beams. "It's a memory foam bed. You'll [[like it]]."

passages.name: forces you to be blind
passages.text:
"Okay, fine, but don't laugh. And don't say anything until I'm done." You turn around. You've got a storyline for your pop star persona. She's a girl that loves ice cream, singing, #justgirlythings, and would do anything to make someone smile. So that's what you're going to do. You're going to make your audience smile and have a good time.

To get in the proper headspace, you think about cuddling puppies.

And cute girls.

Cute girls holding puppies.

Yeah. You're Jerri, the cute girl and puppy lover. You're going to knock the socks off of the cute girl you're going to sing for, because #cute runs the world.

You've got this. You take out your cellphone and hold it to your face like it's a microphone.

[[Turn around and sing.]]

passages.name: like everyone else
passages.text:
"It's hard enough figuring out one person." You hold your head. "Three's insane."

"That's what you get for agreeing to be part of this." Nayeli doesn't have any sympathy for you. "Let's say that the good outweighs the bad, and that's what makes it worth it."

"You can help me figure out someone, though...you."

"What do you <<if $starry>>[[want to know?|starstuff]]<<else>>[[want to know?|notstarstuff]]<<endif>>"

passages.name: SLAP
passages.text:
Sarai grabs her by the wrists and throws her to the ground, hard enough for Nayeli to bounce when she does. She curls over on her side, tears running down her face. Before Sarai can get any closer, Taya rushes over and leans over Nayeli to shield her. Everything happens so fast.

"Calm down, Sarai!" You scream at her. "What the fuck are you doing?"

"It's too late for me to calm down."

"It's not Nayeli's fault. Someone must've hacked our computer."

"Or she met up with the wrong person," Sarai says. "She put us at risk. What if we got something from her? This is why we have rules. This is why we have our agreements, to prevent something like this happening...but you can't stop a bitch from being a bitch. [[Once a cheater]], always a cheater."

passages.name: Sing along to help
passages.text: As soon as you start singing, they stop playing and stare at you like "who the fuck are you, and what are you doing?"\n\nYou don't look at them. You squeak out a "sorry," give them the handful of change in your pocket, and rush off to [[your apartment]].

passages.name: a loose ponytail
passages.text:
In the bed, sleeping in the middle of Sarai and Nayeli, you wonder if you should bring up your concerns.

*[[Bring them up.]]
*You need your rest. [[Go to sleep.|waiting]]

passages.name: The slightly messy desk on the pink and white side.
passages.text:
"Your desk is the one over here, on the pink and white side."

Taya laughs. "Nope. Here, I'll give you a consolation prize." She gives you a kiss.

"What was the prize?"

"A kiss. What can I say, I'm [[cheap|feeling]]."

passages.name: tilapia and rice
passages.text: As soon as you leave the office, Miya K, Lily Trilly, and Rayna hurry on ahead. They don't wait for you. It's like their friendliness in Shannon's office was just for show. Or they're trying to be the first ones in line for that fish. Fish and rice is a hot ticket lunch item for sure. Who are you kidding? You're nothing to them. "Hey, do you want to eat together?" When Ashley Evans walks over to you, it's more like she's bouncing. "What's up with them?" "Some of the girls are just clique-ish. You know how it is. There's extra pressure on all of us since we're solo artists." "Living and dying by our fans," you say, quoting your manager. "There's pressure everywhere, but you don't seem like you're feeling it much." Based on her 'have fun' advice and how she's willing to eat with you, you wonder [[how serious]] she is about being part of Estrella Entertainment.

passages.name: "Thank you."
passages.text:
"Thank you."<<set $thank3 = true>> You couldn't say it back to her.

Taya smiles sadly. "You're welcome. I'm just glad I got it all out there into the open." She gives you a kiss.

"Is there any way we can getout from under this blanket? It's like a sauna in here..."

"Yes, [[silly]]. Let's go."

passages.name: cat costume
passages.text: <<if $comments_yes>>You read over [[some forum pages]].<<else>>Your thumb hovers [[over your dial pad|over your dialpad]].<<endif>>

passages.name: someone beat you to it
passages.text: "La la la!" Each note is sung more off-pitched than the last. You look up and see a girl around your age holding a couple of grocery bags. She's got a backpack on, which would've been enough to make her look young but she's also wearing red-rimmed glasses and a pair of lime green shorts. Where Nayeli was quiet and leather, this girl is loud and neon. "Sorry for joining in, but your song was so <>emotional and raw and stuff.<><>beautiful.<> I couldn't help it!" "Thank you," you say as you put the guitar away and return to the living room where she stands. "I'm Jerrica, but you can call me Jerri. You must be Taya." You remember that Sarai stressed her name was Taya, not Taylor. [["Yep, the one and only."]]

passages.name: "A mistake."
passages.text:
"A mistake," you watch yourself say. You turn the television off and lay down to hide your face in the couch fabric.<<set $mistake = true>>

Sarai and Nayeli watched the whole thing with you. You wanted them around for emotional support. Sarai rubs your back and lies to you that everything will be okay. Nayeli leaves to get some air.

"This is why you should've come forward as yourself. You would've avoided this," Sarai says.

"Stop it." You can't look at her. You don't want her to see you cry.

"You hurt Nayeli. Why would you say that?"

"They told me to say that. They wanted me [[to admit that]] she was a mistake."

passages.name: your true fans
passages.text:
"My 'true fans' are the ones that Estrella cares about the most, and the ones I'm at the most risk of losing." You can't stand the smell of your food. You don't have it in you to look at where you've fallen in the Pickford Top 100.

If you see that your number's dropped, that'll be the death of you.

Ashley Evans says, "as long as this scandal doesn't [[get any worse]], you should be okay."

passages.name: Some other time
passages.text:
"Some other time is okay," you say to them. "I just wanted to make sure you were still into me, that's all."

"I'm not going to bother responding to that," Nayeli says.

"Nayeli, kiss Jerri. She's feeling vulnerable."

"I'm not kissing her because you told me to." Nayeli leans over and kisses you anyway. You feel a little better from that, but it's what she whispers in your ear that makes you giddy. "I like you so much, Jerri. Don't forget that. I really do care about you."

You [[snuggle|waiting]] into Nayeli and fall right asleep.

passages.name: It's for the best
passages.text:
"It's for the best. We'll rip each other apart if we stay together for much longer," you admit. "There's been cracks in this relationship for a long time. It took that last fight for it to become clear. Why let things fester and get worse?"

Nayeli covers her face.

Sarai says, "we don't have to all break up. Some of us could stay together."

"It doesn't feel right continuing this without us being a group. It has to end, like Jerri said." Taya says. "If it rebuilds from there, good, and if not, then in the immortal words of Nayeli, whatever."

"Alright," Sarai weakly agrees.

Nayeli speaks through her hands. "I can't believe we're letting this happen. We're throwing everything away because of one stupid fight."

"We're keeping what we have left safe," you tell her.

"I [[can't see it]] that way," she says. "We're giving up and you're all okay with it."

passages.name: beats
passages.text:
"Why'd you say that, Taya? What the hell?" Sarai yells at her. Taya must've opened a deep wound. Nayeli won't open the door, no matter how hard Sarai slams her fists into it.

Taya sits down on the couch, her shoulders slumped. You join her, rubbing her back as she rests her head against you. "I was only telling the truth," she mumbles. "Why is Nayeli allowed to get away with being a bitch, and when we do it, we're punished for it like this? Now I look like the bad guy."

Minutes go by. Sarai had to stop knocking because [[her hands hurt too much]]. You're too busy consoling Taya to look over the damage.

passages.name: the coldest
passages.text:
You're cleaning out your locker at the Estrella Entertainment HQ.<<set $fired>>

It's over.

They let you go.

The scandal was too much for them.

Shannon told you that they couldn't afford to have any of their other products or Estrella Girls associated with this sort of scandal. You were early enough in your career for them to let you go so they could make themselves look good.

It's [[over]]...

59. Ruffy 58. Mia 57. Strawberry Sunrise 56. Pana 55. Aliya Ace 54. Rayna 53. Faith 52. Linda Spike 51. Rainfield 50. Lena Somerset 49. Amy McWilliams 48. Jessica Nash 47. Indigo Tollhouse 46. Tiffany Spears 45. Amanda Welshman 44. Gall 43. Miya K 42. Angharad 41. Cristina Martinez 40. Katrina Aguilera 39. Cicada Jones [[80-60]] >> 59-39 >> [[38-21|38-11]]

passages.name: took her to
passages.text:
"Sorry if I seemed possessive earlier. I don't want to be that girl."

"Blame it on the NRE."

"See, you're getting the hang of it. You'll be a poly expert in no time." Sarai gets out of bed and shuts off the light. You waste no time in snuggling close to her once she gets back in bed. <<if $starry>>Should you do more than that tonight? Wouldn't that be the right thing to do since you slept with Nayeli?

*[[Initiate sex.]]
*[[Don't. Just go to sleep.]]<<else>>

You peacefully [[fall asleep]] within minutes.<<endif>>

passages.name: floor
passages.text:
You take the floor first. "How's everyone doing?"

"Miserable," Sarai says. "I'm not going to dance around it...I've been feeling awful. I regret everything I said that night."

"Whatever," Nayeli says. "Someone had to say it."

"I missed you guys."

"You're not allowed to miss us!" Taya yells. "You drove us out of here. You can't hate us and love us in the same breath. It doesn't make any sense."

"It wasn't in the same breath," you defend her. "It's [[been a week]]."

passages.name: kiss her
passages.text:
"Shit, sorry." You back off. "Was that too fast?"<<set $kissed_n>>

"Don't ruin the moment by saying you're sorry." She gets out of bed and turns out the light. You wonder if she's doing that to hide the embarrassed look on her face. You may have caught her off-guard, but you can tell that she liked it. "Good night."

You may be cracking through Nayeli's shell after all.

You [[fall asleep]] smiling to yourself.

passages.name: meet Sarai
passages.text:
"We met at a presentation thing. She introduced me to Nayeli." Taya doesn't get to say more than that because the door opens and in walks Nayeli herself. She makes a loud, fake sound of disgust when she sees Taya. She gives you a small smile, which you consider a sign of progress.

Taya grabs her arm as she walks by her, and pulls her down for a kiss. <<if $starry>>Should you give her one too? That's the expectation now, isn't it? You're at that level.<<endif>>

"Has my favorite grump been playing nice? Be honest."

"I'm always nice," Nayeli defends herself.

"Not so much at the beginning. I thought you hated me," Taya says.

Okay, good, you're not the only one. Nayeli goes into her bedroom and closes the door without argument. Taya purses her lips into a pout, then turns to you [[with a smile]].

passages.name: tayaintro
passages.text:
You've got your eyes closed when a key turns in the door and someone carrying grocery bags walks in. Their bags crinkle as they swing them. They stop in front of you, and say, "hey" in a voice you don't recognize.

You sit right up.

The grocery bag girl's wearing a backpack, which would've been enough to make her look young but she's also got on a pair of red-rimmed glasses and a pair of lime green shorts. Where Nayeli was quiet and leather, this girl is loud and neon.

"Hi. I'm Jerrica, but you can call me Jerri. You're Taya, aren't you?" Sarai stressed that her name was Taya, never Taylor.

[["Yep, the one and only."]]

passages.name: Interject and admit that you played it.
passages.text:
"She didn't play it. It was me," you explain. "I don't know why she's trying to act like she did, but she wasn't anywhere near your guitar."

"My guitar," Taya corrects.

"Okay," Nayeli visibly relaxes. Her voice is back to its normal even level. She scratches her arm. "Please ask me next time, okay?"

"She shouldn't have to." Taya says.

"I shouldn't have played it without asking no matter whose it is."

Nayeli retreats back into her room, saying, "yep, okay. [[Thanks]]."

passages.name: Get up without her help
passages.text: She grimaces when you refuse her hand. "Let's talk in the bedroom," Nayeli says. You follow her [[there|her bedroom]].

passages.name: nostuffing
passages.text:
"It might be a little too soon..." You say. "You don't have to sleep on the floor. Don't do that." The floor would be worse than the couch.

"Okay, cool. I got it." Nayeli gets up and turns out the light.

You [[fall asleep]] on your own sides of the bed.

passages.name: Turn it down.
passages.text:
"I'd rather take the couch, sorry." <<set $route_b = "yes">>

"That's okay," Sarai says. Her smile's lost some of its shine. "I should get going. I've got an early shift at work tomorrow. What do you have going on?"

"I've got dance practice. I think it might be all day."

"That sucks."

"You're a dancer?" Nayeli leans towards you. "You don't look like a dancer."

"Yeah, dancing's not my thing, but I'm going to try my best."

"There's no such thing as trying. You do it or you don't." Her brown eyes [[pierce]] through yours.

passages.name: helpful
passages.text:
Nayeli tucks the waterbottles under her armpits, sets down the drinks, and grabs you both by the hands. You're too busy rubbing your palm into hers to lament your wasted money. That drink was a whole $8 and no one had any!

They say guitar players' hands are supposed to be rough, but that's not true in Nayeli's case. You never see her lotion her hands so this must be her natural softness. You giggle. Natural softness. Other parts of Nayeli are soft, too. You love Nayeli's skin. She's got wonderful skin.

You're in your own world until Nayeli pulls the curtains closed to your private booth. You must've teleported upstairs. That's the only reasonable explanation. Or...jetpacks. Taya's smart. She could invent a jetpack. Oh, but she's not an Engineering major. You were the one that was going to be a mad scientist. Why aren't you doing that?

Taya breaks out into a fit of giggles. She squeezes the velvet couch you're on.

"You're both idiots," Nayeli says. No, she grumbles it. She's [[all grumbly]].

passages.name: burning disappointment
passages.text:
It was the winter break of your sophomore year of college when you told her that you weren't going back. School was torture. You wanted nothing more than to pursue your talent at singing. The chemistry sets that had once excited you made you feel disgusted with yourself for wasting your time for so long.

You had to get out.

Your mother didn't understand. She was furious. "Do you know much I sacrificed so you could go to college?" She screamed loud enough for tears to come out of her eyes.

You had to shatter her dreams and use them as stepping stones for your own.

Sacrifice...
Sacrifice...
[[Sacrifice...]]

passages.name: a perpetual off-day
passages.text:
"And then there's Nayeli," you continue. "I've mostly seen her in house clothes, but the clothes she comes in wearing have been like wow. She pulls off that gorgeous-grunge thing so well."

"Wipe your chin, Jerri, you're drooling."

"Heh... Taya's an eccentric hipter. I don't know what else to call her style. Finally, there's me, the clearance girl."

"You've got a style similar to Taya's. Your color palette's more muted. You could probably fit into her clothes, come to think of it. She's got mountains of them."

"...You know what? This talk didn't help me at all. Now I'm just more confused," you groan. "I'm going for this one. If she hates it, [[she can sue me]]."

passages.name: don't you dare lie
passages.text:
You strain to watch them kiss in the darkness. They have to lean over you to do it. The close proximity of it all is enough to make you fill up with want.

*[[Grab Sarai and kiss her first.]]
*[[Grab Nayeli and kiss her first.]]

links.text: Grab Sarai and kiss her first.

destination.name: Grab Sarai and kiss her first.

links.text: Grab Nayeli and kiss her first.

destination.name: Grab Nayeli and kiss her first.

passages.name: Turn dwn the lasagna
passages.text: You turn down the lasagna. You make a salad for yourself while Sarai and Nayeli enjoy their "[[layered dairy cakes|ready]]."

passages.name: too many limbs
passages.text:
"How was work?" Sarai asks.

"They finalized my image."

"Hella gay!" Taya blurts out.

Nayeli's shocked. "They're letting you be gay?"

"More than that, they're going to make her the face of the gay movement for young girls everywhere."

"Um, they didn't say it like that."

"That's fantastic." Sarai claps for you.

"There's one more cool thing about it. She gets to have a girlfriend." Taya continues to [[steal your thunder]].

passages.name: all out of couches
passages.text:
She taps her perfectly manicured nails on her wheel. "If you want to make it to the top, you're going to have to live your life much more carefully from now on. This sort of thing?" She waves in your face. "It has to end. If you don't treat your life like you've got a thousand eyes on you at all times, you're going to crash and burn."

Shannon shifts her car out of park. She goes on, "you have to be aware of the profile that you're keeping. You literally live and die by your fans, and you've got the toughest crowd to endear yourself to...teenage girls. Do you understand what I'm saying? Put your seatbelt on."

You buckle up, suddenly feeling very drained after today's activities. "Where are we going?"

"My place. This is a [[one-time deal]]."

passages.name: Untitled Stylesheet 1
Untitled Stylesheet 2
scroll
passages.text:
The articles are rooted in truth, as distorted as they are. Nayeli had been selling herself...in a way.

"Where's Nayeli?" You ask.

"Should be home any minute," Sarai says.

"Keep her away from her," you tell Taya.

Sarai laughs. "No fucking way. Nayeli deserves a piece of my mind. Those pictures online are all real, didja know that? They've got her crown tattoo in 'em... She's a fucking royal bitch, that's what."

"Who's [[a royal bitch]]?" Nayeli walks in.

passages.name: studying to be a nurse
passages.text:
Her tone loses its friendliness. "Nayeli told me you took drugs last night and it got out of hand."

"I took one."

"You shouldn't have taken a whole pill."

"I wanted to have fun." Fun's aftermath sucks.

"That's the wrong way to do it," Sarai says. "You have to be more responsible when you do things like that. Did Taya hand it to you that way?" She sighs. "Maybe she's the problem here. Between how much she fights with Nayeli, and her making you take drugs..."

"She didn't make me do anything. I just haven't been feeling like myself lately. It wasn't her fault. She was trying to help me." You roll over and regret it instantly. Sarai moves the trash can to the [[edge of the bed]].

passages.name: use these
passages.text:
"I had to teach myself how to use them. My parents never took me out to eat. Fast food, yeah, sometimes, but they wouldn't have ever gone to an Asian restaurant. They're down-home Americana types."

"I dunno. I grew up eating out a lot," she smirks. "And I mean that in both ways."

You nearly choke on your drink. The waitress shows up to the rescue with the plate of calamari. You break out your chopsticks and shove a piece into your mouth. Taya's careful not to smudge her lipstick as she eats.

"Um, so about what you just said... How long have you known you were gay?"

"Who says I'm gay? Aren't we just pals being gals?"

"I think you mean gals being pals."

"Dammit, fucked that up. Okay, pretend I didn't say that. I think I knew when I was around 11 or 12," she says. "Sleepover. It was one of those stupid [[changing parties]]."
